loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson O. O. is 27 years old, married, and has five children aged between nineteen and three years old, whom they hope to give a good education to the university level.

His business is located at a market at Nyalenda in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region of Kenya that harbours Lake Victoria. He owns a motorcycle which he uses for business. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for one and a half years now. He says the business is really good but the major challenge he has is being robbed of his earnings by thugs who pretend to be customers. However, he works hard to keep his business doing well.

He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy spare parts to repair the motorbike. He hopes to grow his business and even own a fleet of rickshaws in future. He describes himself as friendly.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Pang

texts.en:
Pang S., age 31, lives in Siem Reap Province. Previously, she used to work in a local restaurant as a cook and she also spent the rest of her time selling soft drinks like Coke, pure drinking water, and fruit juice to the villagers. She is married to Soun Vibol, age 30, who shares the responsibility with Pang S. in the family by driving a motor taxi.

 He runs his business very well because he has skills in communication which he uses with his customers. However, his income is not so much due to his motorcycle being too small to carry many passengers. That is why Pang S. has decided to ask for a loan of $300 to buy a trailer to connect to the existing motorcycle so that her husband can use it to pick up more passengers than before.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to connect to their existing motorcycle.

loans.name: Jessica Milagros

texts.es: Jessica tiene 26 años de edad y es soltera sin hijos. Vive en casa de abuelos en la parte rural del distrito de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. Gana la vida vendiendo productos de belleza y salud. También ofrece el servicio de locutorio en el cual sus clientes pueden usar sus teléfonos para hacer llamadas tanto nacionales como extranjeras. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 1 año en su domicilio, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una caja de instalación y chips de teléfonos para el normal funcionamiento del locutorio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con esta inversión, podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Jessica is 26 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She lives in her grandparents' home in the rural part of Lambayeque district, in the north of Peru.

Jessica earns a living selling beauty and health products.  She also offers a 'locutorio' service where people use her telephones to make both national and international calls.  She has been running this business from her home for one year.  She knows the business very well and already has an established customer base in her area.

Jessica will use her loan to buy an installation box and telephone chips for her establishment.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  As a result of this investment, she will be able to offer a better service to her customers and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy equipment and more telephone chips for her 'locutorio' (an establishment that provides phones for public use)

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is 36 years old and is married with three children. She does farming to earn a living. She has been farming for the past ten years. Through Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, she has been able to buy dairy cows. She hopes to own a pick-up for transporting farm produce in the future. She is requesting 17,000 KES to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 26-year-old man from Palestine who is engaged and getting married soon. Muhammad is an employee with a decent salary but he needed a loan to cover some of the wedding expenses.

Muhammad came to FATEN and took a loan to pay for the wedding hall rent and photography expenses. Muhammad is photographed in the picture here.

loans.use: Pay for wedding expenses

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercidita is a married woman and 38 years old with five school-aged children. Mercidita has a retail shop where she sells different products in the community.

Mercidita is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy bread, soft drinks, canned goods and noodles to sell in the community. Each month, Mercidita earns about PHP 4,000 from her selling business.

In the future, Mercidita hopes that her business will improve so that she can sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy bread, soft drinks, canned goods and noodles to sell

loans.name: Karambenor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 07 juin 2011. Il est  constitué de trente six femmes qui habitent le même village. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Juliette qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 36  ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants.

Elle s’active dans la vente de poisson fumé. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et d'acheter plus de marchandises (poisson fumé) afin de mieux développer  son petit commerce.

Les profits générés par son activité lui permettront de participer à l’améliorer des conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on June 7, 2011. It is made up of 36 women who live in the same village. Their primary activity is petty commerce. 

Madame Juliette, who is on the right in the photo raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 36, married, and the mother of six children.

Her business is selling smoked fish. She has a good deal of experience in this field as she has been doing this work for several years. 

This loan will permit her to bolster her working capital and buy more merchandise (smoked fish) so that she can expand her little business. The profit she generates through her business will allow her to help improve living conditions for her family (health, food, clothing, etc.) and put aside more in savings.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is divorced and has six children. Efua sells bags of charcoal and maize in Abura, which she has done for four years. She makes sure that the children are fed, educated and sheltered with the earnings she makes from her sales. 

A loan of 700 Ghana cedis, when received, would be invested in the purchase of bags of maize. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest for future growth. 

She is squatting close to a bag of maize.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of bags of maize.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 40 years old, married to Victoria and has four school-aged children. He has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 16 years. He was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He has paid all his previous loans well and in good time. Simon plans to use the loan amount to buy more sheep, which he will rear and later sell the wool.
In the future, Simon hopes to buy more sheep, which he will rear and also be able to sell the newborns.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for rearing.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a 60-year-old man, married, and lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He has two good children with him. He owns and operates a sari-sari store to earn a living. He generates a total of PHP 20,000 a month from the store activity. His business is good enough that he has managed to run the business for ten successful years already. 

Antonio has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional grocery stocks, school and office supplies to sell. He has been a member of GDMPC for three years. He hopes to expand the managed store and make a good income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery stocks, school and office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: La señora Maria Eugenia se dedica a la elaboración de masitas como ser empanadas, queques, galletitas y otros. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como ser harina, azúcar, levadura para continuar con su negocio, pues los ingresos que genera son importantes para ella. Maria Eugenia vive en  alquiler en una casa,  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Bajo Tacagua en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera  y no tiene hijos. Ella ha solicitado que su crédito sea a través de Kiva, pues esta será la cuarta vez que los financiadotes de Kiva le ayudan a continuar con su negocio.
texts.en: María Eugenia makes baked goods like turnovers, cakes, cookies and others.  She needs the loan to buy raw ingredients like flour, sugar and yeast to stay in business because the income she earns is important to her.  María Eugenia lives in a rented house that’s located in La Paz’s Bajo Tacagua zone.  She is single and has no children.  She has requested that her loan be through Kiva because this will be the fourth time that Kiva lenders have helped her to stay in business.

loans.use: to buy bread baking ingredients.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Матлуба добросовестная трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 3 детей. Её муж является бизнесменом.  Доход мужа не позволяет им полностью покрывать все расходы семьи, из-за этого она решила помогать мужу и открыла свой собственный бизнес. Более 21 лет она занимается купля продажей обуви и детских одежд. Она имеет сою торговую точку на центре местном города, а также много клиентов. Матлуба   хотела бы получит займ в размере 1250$ США для покупки новых ассортиментов модных обувей. Она хочет заранее благодарит Киву и Кива кредиторы за их поддержку и доброту. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Matluba is a conscientious, hardworking woman. She is married and a loving mother to three children. Her husband is a businessman. Her husband's income is not enough to cover all of the family's expenses. Because of this, she decided to help her husband and opened her own business. For more than 21 years, she has been engaged in buying and selling shoes and children's clothes. She has her own shop in the center of the city, as well as many clients. Matluba is requesting a loan of $125 US to purchase a new assortment of stylish footwear. She thanks Kiva and Kiva lentors in advance for their support and kindness.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase a new assortment of shoes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old and lives in the town of Masidi in the Mbarara region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Mary has a business of a small retail shop that sells household goods like plates, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase plates and cups for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mary hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Mary hopes to expand her business.     Mary is a member of BRAC’s Small enterprise (SEP) program which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase plates and cups for resale.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a diligent mother. She has three children attending school. Now, due to the increasing cost of basic commodities, Jessie needs to gain more profits to sustain her family's daily consumption of meals and allowances. For 10 years, she has been operating her small sari-sari store (variety) in front of her house. With her daily income, she was able to pay school fees. The other part was used as revolving capital to continuously sell grocery items to the people in her neighborhood. 

Jessie in now asking for an additional capital of PHP 6,000 to buy sugar, vinegar, cooking oil, breads and eggs to sell in her store to increase the capacity of sales from her business. 

Jessie would like to keep making better sales to save for the college education of her three children. She wants them to have their own degree and good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy sugar, vinegar, cooking oil, bread and eggs to sell in her store

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a married woman who lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling enterprise, retailing at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business, and dreams of establishing another sales shop in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, Mesalimu wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale with a loan of Kshs 20,000.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cumbe (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cumbe esta formado por 14 mujeres, quienes laboran en diferentes actividades en su parroquia o en la ciudad de Cuenca, sus trabajos les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y también darles a sus hijos un ejemplo de esfuerzo y trabajo. Viven en la parroquia de Cumbe, lugar que  de clima frió y de hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, tienen una gran variedad en su gastronomía y su gente es de un corazón muy cálido.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Sra. Laura, tiene 34 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 19, 16, 15, 12, 10 años de edad y todos estudian. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Laura se dedica a la cría y venta de  pollos y cerdos a los cuales los vende en su comunidad. Como pasa en casa ella no se descuida de su familia. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 8 años beneficiándose de los créditos en su hogar y  en su negocio. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cerdos y  alimento para animales.

Su meta es continuar con su negocio y que  sus hijos salgan adelante en sus estudios.

Las dos fotos pequeñas adjuntas son de dos socias que por notivos familiares no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del rupo.
texts.en:
The Cumbe Communal Bank is 14 women who work in different jobs in their parish or in the city of Cuenca.  Their jobs allow them to contribute to the finances of the home and also to be an example of effort and work for their children.  They live in the parish of Cumbe, an area of cold climate and pretty landscapes.  The people there work in business, raising animals, and agriculture.

Laura, 34, is one of the members of this group.  She is married and from this marriage has five children, ages 19, 16, 15, 12, and 10, all of whom are in school.

Her husband works in construction as a mason.  The house she lives in is her property.

Laura raises and sells chickens and pigs, which she sells in her community.  Since she works at home, she does not neglect her family.

She has been benefitting from loans from the communal bank for eight years, in her home and in her business.  She's going to use the new loan to buy chickens, pigs, and animal feed.

Her goal is to continue with her business and for her children to get ahead in their studies.

The two small attached photographs are of two members who for family reasons were unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, and animal feed.

loans.name: Yarn

texts.en: Yarn, 38 years old, is a farmer and animal feeder, earning $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning $5 per day. The couple has three children, all studying. Each month, Yarn spends $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy rice seed and fertilizer. She wants to feed animals to sell when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Lolita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: María Holanda

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo). Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 49 años de edad está casada y de  esta relación tiene tres hijos dos mayores y el menor de 17 años, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa y estudian en Universidad y en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella realiza el crédito  para ayudar a su esposo con su negocio y con esto contribuir para sacar adelante a su familia, él se dedica a la venta de pescado, para lo cual tiene un puesto en el mercado en el cual vende al por mayor y al menudeo a las personas que día a día llegan hasta este lugar para abastecerse de productos para el sustento diario, él trabaja todos los días, desde la madrugada él se desplaza hasta las playas para comprar directo a los pescadores y luego llevar a dicho mercado donde distribuye sus productos, lleva más de 20 años en este negocio y siempre le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de pago del grupo y le gusta por los beneficios que le ha dado la institución.
 
Su sueño es comprar un camión para transportar sus productos ya que alquilan transporte todos los días.
texts.en:
The María Del Carmen communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton (Portoviejo). This is where the famous toquilla straw hats are from. The city has a cool climate with a lot of natural tourist attractions unique to the area. 

Here we meet María. She is 49 years old, married and has three children. Two are grown and the youngest is 17. Two of them live at home and go to college and high school. Her husband is a merchant.  
 
She is taking out this loan to help her husband with his business and to contribute to getting her family ahead. He sells fish, and has a stall in the market where he sells wholesale and retail to people who go to his place every day to get his products for their daily use. He works every day. Before dawn he goes to the beach to buy directly from the fisherman and later he goes to the market where he distributes his products. He has been in this business for more than 20 years, and it has always gone well for him.

This loan is to buy fish. Since the communal bank started, she has been the payment treasurer for the group and she likes it because of the benefits the institution has given her.
 
Her dream is to buy a truck to transport their products, since they rent transportation every day.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Moonon

texts.en:
Mr. Moonon, 49, is retired and lives with his wife and 4 children in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All of his children still live together with their parents. Moonon was an army man and has worked as a colonel of the Mongolian Military Force. 

Moonon always wants his children to move out and start their individual lives immediately. His elder son, Ariunbold, will be married in next month, before the Christmas day. Therefore, his father Moonon wants to prepare his wedding gift, a ger. A ger is the nomadic Mongolian traditional tent and it does not cost so much in the markets of Mongolia. It consists of its wall, made by sheep's wool and other parts made of wood. Historically, Mongolians have been living and using the ger for their nomadic life for many hundreds of years. The loan Moonon is taking will be used to cover the cost of new ger for his son’s wedding.

loans.use: to cover the cost of a new ger for his son’s wedding.

loans.name: Rosi

texts.es: Rosi, de 31 años, es una mujer muy amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Ever de 25 años y sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. La tienda de abarrotes de Rosi es una de las más concurridas en su localidad. El gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera tienda en abrirse y la ultima en cerrarse. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su pueblo, lleva 04 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, ya que tiene que atender de corrido si no quiere que sus ventas bajen. Para más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el almacén principal de su pueblo. Este será su préstamo numero 02 con MFP y se siente muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le dan para continuar con su trabajo. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, podrá incrementar más productos para su negocio como: arroz, azúcar, conservas, fideos, leche, entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosi, 31, is a very kind woman living in her own house with Ever, 25, and their two beloved children that she wants to provide a better future for. 

Rosi’s grocery store is one of the busiest in her location.  Her pleasant personality and kind treatment have made her the favorite among her neighbors who don’t hesitate to make their purchases starting very early since they know that her store is the first to open and the last to close.

What she likes best about her work is chatting with her neighbors about what’s going on in town.  She’s been in business four years and considers the most difficult part having to stay inside her store all day because she has to stay open continuously so that sales don’t drop.  For later on, she hopes her business will grow and become her town’s main store.

This will be MFP loan #2 and she is very happy because of the financial support she’s getting to stay in business.  She will use the 2000 new soles to increase stock merchandise for the store like: rice, sugar, canned goods, noodles and milk, among others.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe BENKADI sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39  ans, et en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogamiques à Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
ASSETOU, la première à gauche, fait la vente des œufs, il y'a environ  10 ans et souhaite devenir grossiste. 
Elle compte acheter, avec son  prêt  une centaine d’alvéoles d’œufs. Elle s’approvisionne chez les producteurs dans les environs de Sikasso.
Elle les revend en détail, sur commande et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en: The four members of the BENKADI group are mostly married women who are on average 39 years old and have three children each. They live in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso.  As they are seeking to meet their customers' needs, they are requesting their tenth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution. ASSETOU, the woman on the far left in the photo, has been selling eggs for about 10 years and would like to become a wholesaler. With this loan, she plans to buy about a hundred egg trays.  She buys her eggs from local producers.  She resells them for retail, takes orders, and also sells from her home, to customers of both genders who pay her in cash.  She expects average monthly profits to reach 23,500 CFA francs, part of which will be used to pay off the loan and interests, while the rest will go into savings.

loans.use: To buy eggs.

loans.name: Vahob

texts.ru: Вахоб житель района Шахритус. Ему 41 год. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его дети уехали на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Сам Вахоб занимается выращивание овощей и посевом бахчевых культур. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже год. Кредит берет для приобретения земли.
texts.en: Vahob is a resident of the region Shahrituz. He is 41 years old. He is married and has two children. His children have gone to work in the Russian Federation. Vahob himself works with growing vegetables and melons. He has already been engaged in this activity for a year. He takes a loan to purchase land.

loans.use: to purchase land

loans.name: Mamadou Khaly

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Mamadou  Khaly est un jeune chauffeur âgé de 31 ans .Il est marié et père de deux enfants .IL fait du transport depuis douze ans.
Avec le crédit il envisage  de faire quelques travaux de construction chez lui.
Il gère sa petite famille et satisfait leurs besoins quotidiens. Dans  l’ avenir  il veut devenir  un grand transporteur.
texts.en:
Mamadou Khaly is a 31-year-old driver. He is married and has 2 children. He's been a driver for 12 years.
With this loan, he plans on doing some construction work at home.
He takes care of his family and meets their daily needs. In the future he would like to become a major carrier.

loans.use: to do some construction work at home.

loans.name: Gladys Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora Gladys es socia del banco comunal 2671, vive por un hermoso lugar de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es una de las más importantes del país, en diciembre de 1999 fue nombrada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y gentiles.

La Señora. Gladys tiene 30 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo tiene un taller propio en donde fabrica muebles, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Gladys labora en un almacén donde vende los muebles que su esposo fabrica y se encuentra 10 años en este negocio.  También vende Toperware (plástico) encontrándose en esta actividad 2 años.
 
Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de artículos de Toperware para su negocio y madera para el negocio de su marido.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of Communal Bank 2671.  She lives in a pretty part of the city of Cuenca, one of the most important cities in the country.  In December 1999 it was named a World Heritage Site.  The people there maintain the culture and traditions of their communities and are known for being pleasant and kind people.

Gladys, 30, is married and has two children from this relationship, ages 12 and 8.  Her oldest child studies in secondary school and her second, a daughter, studies in an elementary school in the city.  Her husband has his own workshop where he makes furniture.  She does not have her own home, so she rents.

Gladys works in a department store when she sells the furniture her husband makes, and she has been in this business for ten years.  She also has been selling Tupperware (plastic) for two years.

She is in her third loan from the communal bank and she is going to invest it in buying plastic Tupperware products for her business and wood for her husband's business.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy plastic Tupperware products and wood.

loans.name: Thérèse's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans un même  groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Thérèse est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Thérèse âgée de 48 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Thérèse est mariée à certain Gabriel. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Thérèse vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Thérèse et son mari. Pour cette raison, Thérèse vend des boissons dans un restaurant depuis huit ans, et de la nourriture de façon secondaire, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Thérèse s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Thérèse sollicite ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des boissons et des sacs de riz

loans.name: Siguitemogoson Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SIGUITEMOGOSON est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Biba, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de l’habillement et de produit cosmétique.
Les femmes du groupe SIGUITEMOGOSON sont à leur vingt septième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MORIYA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de produit cosmétique. Elle compte acheter des cartons de pommade chez les grossistes à Dioïla.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat de produit cosmétique

loans.name: Jennifer Candace Jane

texts.en:
Jennifer Candace Jane is 28 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

Jennifer Candace Jane is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been pig fattening for 10 years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jennifer Candace Jane requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Jennifer Candace Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josphina

texts.en:
Josphina is 65 years old. She is married with two children.

She has had a cereals shop business for eight years. She will be using the loan to purchase more stock of dry maize and hopes this will help her to expand her business and provide basic wants for her family.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to live a good life.

This is her sixth loan and she has borrowed Kshs 10,000 to be repaid in 12 months.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry maize

loans.name: Vestanie

texts.fr: Vestanie, 45 ans vit en union libre. Elle a trois enfants. Elle revend des boissons gazeuses à domicile. Cette activité lui permet de gagner des revenus pour prendre soin de sa famille et faire un peu d’économie pour les cas imprévus. Son objectif est de faire avancer son commerce et augmenter ses bénéfices. Avec ce prêt, elle va augmenter son stock.

loans.use: augmenter son stock

loans.name: Kossi Joseph

texts.en:
Kossi Joseph K. was born in Davéli-Tsévié in 1973. The son of peasants, he used to spend all his time with his father in the fields, which prevented him from continuing his education beyond the 5th grade. Benefitting from the support of his village, he was able to learn woodturning. With an initial loan of $550 that he repaid in regular installments, he was able to open his own workshop, which he named «Aimons la Vie», that is, Let’s Love Life. Very energetic and of good conscience, he extended the reach of his business into certain villages near Tsévié. He is married and the father of three children. His wife got training in hairdressing with his help and support. An honest man, Joseph can be trusted, and he has efficiently mastered his business.

Mr. K. is requesting a loan of $1,500 which in part will serve to buy a new machine and to pay for boards. It will also serve to open a hairdressing salon for his wife. The will allow his wife to help with household expenses in order to better ensure the welfare of the entire family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur K. Kossi Joseph est née en 1973 à Davéli-Tsévié. Fils de paysans, il passait tout son temps à accompagner son père au champs ce qui à fait qu’il n’a pas pu continuer ses études au delà du cours primaire. Bénéficiant de l’appui de certains partenaires du village, il a pu apprendre le tournage du bois. Grâce à son premier crédit de $550 obtenu et régulièrement remboursé, il a pu ouvrir son propre atelier de travail. Très dynamique et de bonne foi, il a étendu son champ d’action dans certains villages proches de Tsévié. Marié, il est père de trois (03) enfants, il a su aider sa femme à se former à la coiffure. Honnête, Joseph est un homme de confiance qui gère avec efficacité ses affaires qu’il maîtrise assez bien.

Monsieur K. Kossi Joseph sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $1500 va servir d’une part, à acheter une nouvelle machine et à payer les planches et d’autre part, à ouvrir un salon de coiffure pour sa femme. Ceci va permettre à sa femme de l’aider dans les dépenses du foyer afin de mieux assurer le bien-être de toute la famille.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine and lumber

loans.name: Clara Selene

texts.en:
Clara was born in Monclava in the state of Coahuila. She is married and has two children. Hus husband is a bricklayer. Seeing as his salary wasn't enough to cover the family's basic needs, much less pay for the children's education, Clara decided to open a business one year ago selling clothes to family and friends. At first she sold them on consignment to give her customers time to pay her, but this meant she couldn't recuperate her cost quickly. This is why she started to sell cosmetics as well to try to recuperate her cost faster.

Her customer base has grown slowly but surely. Clara would like to offer a larger selection of products to decrease the time between her investment in the product and profit from its sale. She knows the ins and outs of her business well and would like loan of $250 to purchase cosmetic products to meet the demand of her customers. She will pay back the loan in 4-8 months. Clara thanks all of the people who support her business' growth.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Clara nació en Monclava, Coahuila, esta casada y tiene dos hijos. Su esposo trabaja como albañil y Clara al ver que los ingresos de su esposo no le cubrían los gastos indispensables del hogar y menos para la educación de sus hijos, decidió poner su negocio, el cual empezó hace un año vendiendo ropa entre sus familiares y amigos, inicialmente daba sus productos en consignación para poder darles un tiempo para que sus clientes le paguen y por ello no recuperaba el efectivo invertido rápidamente, por lo que también incursionó en la venta de productos de belleza para compensar el tiempo de la revolvencia de su dinero.

Poco a poco su clientela se ha ido incrementando y al tener una rotación lenta de sus ingresos ella quiere tener mayor cantidad de productos que ofrecer, ya que sabe que en poco tiempo recuperará su inversión ya que sabe muy bien los ciclos de su negocio, por ello Clara esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 250 para comprar mercadería de los artículos de belleza que ofrece y así satisfacer su demanda, ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en un plazo de 4 a 8 meses. Clara les agradece esta ayuda a todas las personas que la apoyen y la ayuden a crecer en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Akouavi was born in 1969 in Aklakou, where she still lives. She is married and mother of three children. She is able to provide for the needs of her children thanks to the earnings she gets from the sale of beauty products. Her nickname is "Mother CHOUCHOU" and her smile and welcoming ways make her a friend of everyone. With 15 years experience in this business, she has mastered all parts of this activity. She is asking for a loan of $800 to increase the range of the products she sells and meet the demands of the marketplace. In doing so, she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Akouavi est née en 1969 à Aklakou où elle vit encore. Mariée et mère de trois enfants, elle réussit à prendre en charge ses enfants à partir du revenu tiré de la vente des produits de beauté. Surnommée « Maman CHOUCHOU », son sourire et son accueil font d’elle une bonne femme aimée de tous. Dotée d’une expérience d’une quinzaine d’années dans ce commerce, elle maîtrise tous les rouages de cette activité. Elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour augmenter la gamme de ses produits et faire face aux demandes sur le marché. Par là elle réussira à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Increase the range of beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her used clothing inventory

loans.name: Erodita

texts.es:
Erodita H. Chambi, is married and has three children. She works with her husband in a carpenter shop which is located in their home, creating distinct furniture mostly by request of their customers. They have been doing this for more than 8 years, and a few times they have done work for the public where the demand is great, mainly in large construction such as buildings, offices and others. Erodita will use the money to provision materials before the end of the year, the time when the price of wood goes up and it is much more expensive to do the work without income for the family

Erodita H. Chambi, casada y madre de tres hijos, trabaja con su esposo en un taller de carpintería propio ubicado en su domicilio, principalmente realizando trabajos a pedido, elaborando distintos muebles. Ya son más de 8 años en esta actividad, y muy pocas veces realizan trabajos para la venta en vía pública la demanda es mucha, principalmente para construcciones grandes como ser edificios, oficinas y otros. Erodita precisa de capital para poder aprovisionarse de materia prima, antes de fin de año, época en la que toda la madera y principalmente la venesta, que incrementa su precio y se hace mucho más costoso realizar los trabajos encargados sin tener ganancias para su familia.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To purchase prime material for their carpenter business

loans.name: Sirri Neba

texts.en:
Born in 1953, M. is married and the mother of five children. All her resources were invested in the education of her first son, who unfortunately died. This was a great loss for the family. Since then, it has been difficult for the other children to be educated because of a lack of school fees. In order to feed the children, she started selling some food items.

Given a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to add to the food items, firewood and palm oil. The profit raised will be used to pay apprentice and school fees for her children.

She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and palm oil

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Mrs. Chin V., age 23, works selling desserts earning around $2 a day in profit.  Her husband, age 35, is a mechanic making about $4 a day.  They have two children who are too young to attend school yet.  

She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase more spare parts for her husband’s mechanic stand, and use the leftover money to expand her business to meet customer demands.

loans.use: To purchase parts for a mechanic stand and ingredients for her dessert-making business.

loans.name: Mtumwa's Clothes Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa is 22 years old. She is married and has a four year old child. She has a clothing business which she started in 2002. Everyday, she sells clothing from 7am to noon. In a month, she can make a profit of about $165.

Mtumwa hopes for a loan to increase her supply of clothing. She will share this loan with Zuhura, a member in her loan group who also sells clothing in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy clothing inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in his land for planting rice crop.

loans.name: Asha's Tujikwamue Group

texts.en:
Asha is a 39 year old married woman with three children, ages 6, 4 and 1. She and her husband also take care of two other people, ages 63 and 50. Asha is a cloth seller, a business she started in 2006. Every day she works from 8 A.M. to 7 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $140.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell food.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is a member of the Indo America Community Bank which is located at Mz JLt 36, in the Pedro Portillo subdivision of the District of Calleria, in the state of Ucayali. She is 42 years old and has four children. Her husband is a chauffeur. Gloria invested her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos in a small bodega (grocery store), which she now owns.

Gloria gets up at 6:00 in the morning to make breakfast for her children and husband and then turns to running the bodega, where she works until 8:00 in the evening.

With this loan of 3,000 soles (approximately $1,125), which will be paid back in six months, Gloria plans to buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, noodles, oil, eggs, a box of milk, and a box of soap, etc.

Gloria is very happy to be able to make her dreams come true. She has greater self-esteem and also is able to support her children’s studies. She also helps out with household expenses and is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for the support it has provided to her business.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La señora Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal Indo América, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Pedro Portillo, Mz J Lt 36, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es chofer. Gloria con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega de venta de abarrotes, se levanta a las 6 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dedica a su bodega y la atiende hasta las 8 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, fideos, aceite, huevo, 1 caja de leche, 1 caja de jabón, etc.

Gloria esta muy contenta, por que puede hacer sus sueños realidad, aprendió a valerse por si misma y además puede apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, también aporta a los gastos familiares y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise for sale in bodega

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rose seedlings.

loans.name: Aniva Auano's Group

texts.en:
This group from Salelavalu on Savaii Island includes nine women working in their different businesses. Some of them are engaged in agriculture or fishing, while others have a handicrafts (Samoan fine mats (ietoga), bags, fans, etc) business. They comprise one of SPBD's competitive groups and they are looking forward to paying off their loan as soon as possible. This will then allow them access to larger loans to improve their standard of living and help their organization grow.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts and equipment for farming and fishing.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Socorro is 45 years old, she is the mother of 3 children, whom study and are the reason for her efforts, she lives with her partner, Mr. Lener, who dedicates himself to working independently and he supports her a lot. Mrs. Socorro has dedicated herself to the sale of groceries for some time, to be able to help with the family expenses, due to her charisma her clientele grows daily, and she finds it necessary to be able to improve her business. At the same time, she is the owner of 2 taxis which generate an income, she needs to keep them in good condition, and because of this she requests a loan to help her meet her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Socorro tiene 45 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos, los cuales estudian y son la razón de su esfuerzo, ella vive con su pareja, el señor Lener, que se dedica a trabajar en forma independiente y la apoya mucho. Doña Socorro se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace ya tiempo, para poder contribuir con sus gastos familiares, debido a su carisma cada día la cantidad de clientes crece, y ella se encuentra en la necesidad de poder aumentar e implementar su negocio. A la vez, ella es propietaria de dos mototaxis los mismos que le generan ingresos, para lo cual necesita tener en buenas condiciones sus herramientas de trabajo, es por eso que requiere del préstamo solicitado para lograr su meta trazada.

loans.use: To implement the merchandise of her store.

loans.name: Joseph Maxwell

texts.en: Joseph Maxwell M. A. sells is a taxi driver who uses his own car. At the moment the car is giving him problems and he needs financial assistance to buy spare parts for the repairs of his car.  He is married, but his wife's income as a seamstress is not sufficient for Anthony and his 2 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi T. est revendeuse de pagnes au centre commercial de Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 29 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle opère dans ce secteur depuis 5 ans. Akouvi désire par ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son activité en achetant des balles de pagnes pour la revente. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akouvi T. sells "pagnes" (lengths of African print cloth) in the commercial center of Kpalimé, a town situated about 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. At 29 years old, she is married and the mother of 2 children. She has been working in this sector for 5 years. Akouvi wants to use this loan to bolster her business by buying bales of "pagnes" for re-sale. This will allow her to earn more so as to better support her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Elshen

texts.en: Elshen A. is 37 years old. He's married and has three children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in his life pushed him to recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 15 years, he and his wife have been purchasing calves in the local market, fattening them, and selling them. Elshen is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and to educate his children. Elshen wakes up early every morning to feed his calves with the goal of fattening them and selling them at the best price in the local market. Now he applied for a loan of $1200 USD to buy four calves to expand his business. Your generosity can change his life.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita D. owns a clothing store in the town of Iha in the Bekaa valley. A 40-year old mother of three children, Rita has been in the clothes-selling business since 2000. In 2007, wishing to have her own business, she opened her own store. This trade allows Rita to help her husband, a local fireman, with the household income.

Today she requests a loan of $1,000 to expand her inventory for the winter and propose a bigger choice of clothes to her clients.

loans.use: To expand her winter inventory.

loans.name: Gannyedo

texts.en:
Jeanne G. was born around 1975 in Cotonou and is married and has 3 children who are all at home. Jeanne used to help her mother sell at her store, but after her marriage in 1988 she opened her own store and sells eggs, thermoses, and baby items. She makes her purchases in Missébo and is a mobile vendor. She will use this loan to buy more perfume, baby items, cologne, and infant clothes.

Dame G. Jeanne est née vers 1975 à Cotonou , elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants qui sont tous à la charge des parents. Elle aidait sa mère à vendre et après s'être mariée elle s'est mise à son propre compte depuis 1998 jusqu'à ce jour où elle elle vend des oeufs, des termoux, des articles pouvant compter pour le trouceau d'un bébé, elle fait ses achats à Missébo et fait une vente ambulante. C'est pour répondre à la demande de ses clients qu'elle a sollicité le prêt a servi à l'approvisionnement de ces articles.

loans.use: Purchase of perfume, baby items, cologne, and infant clothes

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Mrs. Pheap L. is 44 years old and she lives in Tul Sro Lau village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Leng Seng, are laborers. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn little income which cannot provide a good life for their family. To improve these living conditions, Mrs. Pheap L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to be a motorbike taxi driver. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She has five children, four of whom are attending the local school, while the other is too young to work or study because that child is at the age of five years old. Her husband is also present with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to be a motorbike taxi driver.

loans.name: Sindiya (Fraternité) Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sindiya (composé de 4 femmes  mariées et une celibataire) ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans avec en moyenne 1 enfant. Elles resident  dans le quartier  Ouayerma II dans la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mal).
Elles  exercent des activités commerciales différentes mais les plus dominantes sont la vente du bois de chauffe, la vente d’habits  auxquelles s’ajoute la vente d’oranges et divers petits articles.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante les membres de ce groupe ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle, ils sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 5 chargements de charrettes  en oranges, 2 chargements de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 2 douzaines de vêtement  pour enfants, 2 balles de friperie et 3 paquets d’articles divers. Elles s’approvisionnent soit à Bamako (capitale du Mali),  ou sur place à Sikasso et dans les villages environnants auprès des paysans producteurs.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso  et à domicile  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 15 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Sindiya group, made up of five married women and one single woman, are on average 32 years old and have a child. They live in the Ouayerma II neighbourhood of the city of Sikasso in Mali. They have a variety of businesses, but their main income comes from selling firewood, clothing, oranges and a variety of small articles. To satisfy their customers' increasing demand, the member of this group decided to join the microfinancial institution Soro Yiriwaso with which they are now at their fifth group loan. All previous loans have been fully repaid. They will use this loan to buy five cartloads of oranges, two truckloads of firewood, two dozen of children's clothing, two bales of used clothing and three packages of various articles. They will buy their goods either in Bamako (the nation's capital) or locally in Sikasso and from neighbouring villages, from the farmers themselves. They sell their products retail and for cash in the markets of Sikasso and from home, mainly to women and men. They expect to each make a monthly average profit of 15,000 FCFA which they will use to pay the interest on the loan and to support their families.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, children's clothing, used clothing, fruit and various articles for resale.

loans.name: Sonagnon Félicienne

texts.fr: Originaire d'Odja,elle vit le jour le 08/04/1973 à Houlènou. Elle est à Mr KOUNNOU Valentin commerçant de profession. La dame Sonagnon est mère de trois enfants dont un garçon et deux filles tous scolarisés. L'aîné du nom Juste est au CM1 et les deux jumelles sont à la  marternelle. Elle acquiert ses marchandises( pétrole, lait, tomates fraiches, charbon...) dans le marché international du Bénin (Tokpa). Elle est à son quatrième crédit et elle sollicite un prêt. Son lieu d'activité est à son domicile sise à Kpondéhou dans la rue opposée au commissaisriat.
texts.en:
With an origin in Odja, Ms. Sonagnon saw the light of day on April 8, 1973 in Houlènou. She is married to Mr. Valentin Kounnou, who is a merchant. Ms. Sonagnon is the mother of 3 children, one son and two daughters, all in school. The eldest, Juste by name, is in 4th grade and the twin girls are in kindergarten. She obtains her merchandise (gasoline, milk, fresh tomatoes, charcoal...) in the international market of Benin (Tokpa). She is presently requesting her fourth loan. She sells out of her home in Kpondéhou in the street across from the police station.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 4 sacks of charcoal, soap, and some foodstuffs

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: Khut K., 45, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She is a farmer and makes $2.5 USD per day, while her husband is a pig breeder and makes rice wine. On average, he makes $5 USD per day. This couple is also supported by two children who are construction workers. The rest of her children are in school. Khut K. would like to take out a loan to purchase a grinding mill and pigs.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill and pigs

loans.name: Somun

texts.en:
Mrs. Somun Y. (right) was born in 1969 and lives in Trapaing Veing village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mom Houl, is a worker who has been hired to dig a well.

Although they try to work hard, they earn less income than needed to support their household. In order to improve their lives, Somun decided to ask for a loan to buy five piglets for breeding.

She has four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: Buy piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia I. is 50 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions and drinks. She also sells palm oil. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Lizzy

texts.en: Lizzy sells gallons of palm oil. Lizzy hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more gallons of palm oil to sell. She promises to pay back her loan promptly. Lizzy is 50 years old and married to U. who is a retired teacher. They have four children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gallons of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Enhbold

texts.en:
Enhbold D. lives with his wife and their teenaged daughter in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Enhbold's family lives in his parents' home because they are unable to afford one of their own. His daughter is 14 years old and goes to a local high school.

Enhbold has a small business making furniture. He started his business in 2000 with his wife. His workplace is located very close to the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. This convenient location makes the transportation of furniture to the Narantuul market easier and cheaper. He mostly makes drawers, cabinets, and shelves. The demand for these products is quite high because they are cheaper than imported furniture.

In the future, Enhbold would like to expand his business by adding more desirable furniture items. He says that with his increased profit, he aims to purchase his own home, where he will be able to live with his family.

He requests a loan to purchase raw materials, such as clean-cut wood, for his furniture-making business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his furniture-making business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (1014060439) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has four adult children.

T. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising water buffalo for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month.

In 2001, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her 8th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Lilia Flor

texts.es:
La señora Lilia Flor, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 20 años y no tiene hijos.

Florcita, es una mujer joven que le gusta trabajar, nos cuenta que anteriormente vendía cosméticos de la línea Avon y luego por iniciativa propia, decidió dedicarse a la venta de hamburguesas, con el fin de generar sus propios ingresos económicos, con su primer prestamo en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 y con el apoyo de su pareja compraron su carrito sanguchero, posteriormente fue comprando sus utensilios y materiales para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.  

Actualmente, sigue con la venta de hamburguesas, fuera de su casa donde hay bastante movimiento y cuenta que le va muy bien  en sus ventas, empieza a vender  a partir de las 6:00 de la tarde, ya que a esa hora ya hay clientes que desean probar un aperitivo, es ella misma quien los atiende con esa amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos: papitas al hilo, a diario compra 25 panes especialmente para las hamburguesas, embutidos como: jodoc, jamonadas quesos, chicharrones, carnes, huevos y  pollos, en cuestión de verduras comprara tomates y lechugas en kilos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando mesas, sillas y paraguas, para dar una mejor imagen a su negocio y así atraer mas a sus clientes.

Lilia Flor, esta muy segura que su negocio prosperara mas de lo que ahora esta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Lilia Flor is a member of the “La Marginal II” communal bank in the district of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, in the state of San Martín. She is married, 20 years old and doesn't have any children. Florcita, is a young woman that likes to work. She says that she previously sold Avon brand cosmetics and then, via her own initiative, decided to work selling hamburgers with the aim of earning her own income. With her first loan from the Manuela Ramos organization of 300 Nuevos Soles and with the support of her husband, they bought a food cart; later they bought utensils and material to provide a better service to their customers. Currently, she is continuing to sell hamburgers, outside of her house where there is quite a bit of traffic and she says that her sales are very good. She starts selling at six o'clock in the afternoon, since at that time there are customers that want a snack, and she attends to them with the friendliness and charisma that characterizes her. With this loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles, which will be invested purchasing ingredients; potatoes, she buys 25 breads especially for the hamburgers, cold cuts such as jodoc, ham and cheese, pork rinds, meat, eggs, and chicken, as well as vegetables like tomatoes and lettuce. Part of the money will also be used to purchase tables, chairs and umbrellas, to give her business a better appearance to attract more clients. Lilia Flor, is very sure that her business will prosper to be better than it is now and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals. Lilia Flor, esta muy segura que su negocio prosperara mas de lo que ahora esta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare hamburgers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking and sale of corn

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
El señor Noe M. es una persona trabajadora que diario sale a las calles de promotor de Afore (empresas que especializan en el manejo de los ahorros para el retiro de los trabajadores) el cual es el mejor de todos y ellos y tiene buenos ingresos; su esposas trabaja en maquiladora de asistente de mantenimiento.
Los dos se han propuesto darle una mejor educación a su hija ya que la inscribieron en una escuela privada donde tenga mas probabilidad de aprender ingles en estas escuelas  la lengua extranjera es primordial. Noe cree que la mejor herencia que le puede dar a su hija es  una preparación académica  para que ella misma se defienda en la vida y no pase lo que a el mismo.
El crédito que Noe necesita es para pagar colegiaturas, uniforme y artículos escolares.
texts.en:
Mr. Noe M. is a hard-working person who daily works as a retirement fund marketer (working for businesses that specialize in the management of workers’ retirement funds), of which he is one of the best, and they have good income; his wife works in a factory as a maintenance assistant. The two have plans to provide an education for their daughter and they have enrolled her in a private school where she will have a greater chance of learning English as in these schools learning a foreign language is essential. Noe believes that the best legacy he can give his daughter is an academic preparation so that she can support herself in life and not have the challenges he experienced. The loan Noe needs it for tuition, uniform, and school supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay school related expenses

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan has owned a satellite station for nine years. His clients are people from his region. He did not have problems starting his business. Hassan decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. He is a 51-year-old man who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. He requested a loan of $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new satellite machines for his work. 

Hassan has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his business as well as his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase new satellite machines for his work.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifanía is from Huancavelica. She came to Lima when she was a child and finished her studies. Later she began to study sewing, dressmaking, and cosmetology. Every weekend people come to her house for her services and she says that she makes more in her business than any other business she’s been in. She likes the business she runs out of her home, and appreciates that her mother is able to help her.

Epifanía is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and doesn’t have any children of her own but is taking care of a child from her sister’s first marriage. She is raising the child as if it were her own.

Epifanía is a member of the Valley Roses Village Bank. Since joining FINCA, she has learned to save her money and to be in solidarity with her group members. Epifanía needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy groceries, three sacks of rice, three sacks of sugar, and two jugs of oil. Her dream is to have her own place in the market where she can sell groceries.

loans.use: To buy groceries, three sacks of rice, three sacks of sugar and two jugs of oil

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim S., 36, is a true entrepreneur who sells rice, food and grocery items from home. She makes US$48 in revenue each day in Phnom Penh.

Kim is married and has one child living at home to support. Her husband, Oum Sophat, grows and sells vegetables. He makes approximately US$5 every day.

Kim would like a loan of US$1,000 to expand her businesses. She will increase her grocery inventory and also reinvest in her food business.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de buen carácter, tiene 36 años y vive con su pareja y madre de sus 2 hijas, en una casa alquilada. Se dedica a sembrar y cultivar plátanos, café, rocotos y cayhuas en sus propias chacras, donde generalmente trabaja solo; pero para la temporada de cosecha, necesita de la ayuda de su esposa, quien lo ayuda a encajonar los plátanos. Estas labores agrícolas le agradan muchísimo, más aun cuando los comercializa a un buen precio, vendiendo las  50 ó 70 cajas que tiene hasta 490 soles, pero cuando bajan los precios muchas veces no llega ni a la mitad de esta cantidad; pese a estas dificultades, Juan no piensa dejar sus cultivos, ya que gracias a ellos trabaja tranquilamente, sin presión alguna y brindando lo necesario para su familia.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, en el segundo le normaron secretario de su banco comunal, desde entonces en cada reunión lleva junto a él el libro de actas del grupo. Con el dinero solicitando piensa implementar en su casa un espacio para la venta de  combustibles, debido a que está situado al costado de la carretera principal de su localidad. También comprará cajones vacíos para encajonar sus frutas.
texts.en:
Juan is a man of good character. He is 36 years old and lives with his partner, who is the mother of his 2 daughters, in a house that they rent. He dedicates himself to planting and cultivating bananas, coffee, large peppers, and cayhuas (local peppers) on his own small plots of land where he works alone. However, for harvest season he needs the help of his wife, who helps him box the bananas. These agricultural labors please him a lot, even more when he can sell the food at a good price. He can sell 50 to 70 boxes and make up to 490 soles ($169 dollars), but when the prices drop he doesn’t even make half of this. Despite these difficulties, Juan doesn’t think he should leave his crops since thanks to them he works calmly, without any pressure and providing what’s necessary for his family. This is his third loan with MFP (a Kiva field partner); in the second loan they named him secretary of his communal bank. Since then he brings the group’s book of minutes with him to every meeting. With the loaned money he is thinking of creating a space in his house for the sale of fuel since his home is located on the edge of the principle highway in his area. Also he will buy empty boxes for packing his fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase boxes for fruit and to invest in a new business

loans.name: Najjanankumbi E Nakito Mary Group

texts.en: N. Mary is a thirty-eight year old single mother of five children, one of whom is still in school. She has a restaurant and a bakery. She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, tea, milk, etc. for her restaurant business. She is managing her home very well; with the loan, she will be able to educate the children and encourage the community to work. She is an enterprising business woman whose dream is to obtain her own plot of land.

loans.use: purchasing wheat flour, cooking oil, tea, milk, etc. for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Hernan Henry

texts.es:
Hernan  vive en la calle  “29” de la zona  Rosas Pampa de la ciudad de El Alto

Vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, en la casa de sus familiares. 

Hernan posee un automóvil con el cual trabaja como chofer  de una línea de trufis en la ciudad.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la reparación del motor de su movilidad, ya que  actualmente presenta fallas mecánicas que le impide realizar sus jornadas de trabajo completas. 
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Hernan lives in the Rosas Pampa area of the city of El Alto, on street 29. He lives with his wife and his children, who are of school age, in his family's home. He has a car with which he works as a chauffeur with taxi line in the city. The loan will be used to repair the motor of his car, because he currently is experiencing mechanical problems that prevents him from working full time. This is his second loan with Impro, and his evaluation qualified him to be given the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of the motor of his vehicle

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith C. lives in Barangay Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. After finishing her high school studies, she married George C., and they are blessed with four children. For the sake of their future, she and her husband help each other to earn an income and to support their children's studies.

Judith's husband is a carpenter in their village. He also cultivates their farm during the planting season while Judith sells fish in the village. She acquires her products from Dagupan City and sells them via house to house delivery. Her average daily income is 350 PHP, which she uses to provide for their daily needs and the children's schooling. Since their children are now at college level, the couple need to earn more income to support and finance the children's tuition fees and allowances. Judith wants to improve her small business but she has only a small amount of capital. Therefore, she wants to borrow 5,000 PHP, which she will put with her own capital to acquire more fish to sell in the village. She hopes that this will be a great help to her in improving her small business.

loans.use: As additional capital to purchase more fish

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada has owned her business as a hairdresser and beautician since 2006 with eight years of prior experience in this field.

She is 31 years old and married with three young children. She works a lot to make a good income for her family in addition to her husband's work. 

Nada is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy beauty products and some supplies needed to increase her business productivity.

loans.use: buy beauty products and supplies

loans.name: Purevdorj

texts.en:
Purevdorj is 62 years old and lives with his wife in Khar-khorin, the ancient capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. He has two adult sons, the oldest of whom lives and works nearby while the youngest is in the army. 

Purevdorj and his wife operate a retail clothing business in the local market. He began his business in 2007 and since then, has learned a great deal about business and the local business environment. When he was a young man, Purevdorj had a terrible accident and lost one of his hands. While his disability has made life more difficult for him, he has never let it keep him from working hard and being successful. 

He would like to expand his business in the future and says, “All I want is to help my children to lead happy lives.” Purevdorj is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a large amount of clothing from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of clothing

loans.name: Miradil

texts.en: Miradil M. was born in 1955. He is married and has two children. Miradil and his family live in the Fuzuli region. He has been in the business of selling shoes and clothing for five years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to expand his display area with the purpose of improving his business.

loans.use: to expand the display area

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda G., 47 years old, is managing a small rice field in Veruela, Agusan del Sur. A mother of seven children, Rosalinda desires an abundant life which is why she is working very hard to manage her business well and augment the family income. She really enjoys her livelihood and believes that through the purchase of farming necessities such as fertilizers, she will have a greater chance of obtaining a better crop yield. Rosalinda is therefore applying for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. for this purpose.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: K.g.

texts.en:
M. is a married woman living with her husband. She has five children and her husband works as a day laborer.

Her husband’s income is not enough for their large family, so M. started a small lunch supply business from her home. Her husband also helps her in the supply of the business.

Now M. is thinking of expanding her business as it is going well and she has seen demand in the area grow.

loans.use: To buy groceries, pots and pans, and a string hopper

loans.name: Florely's Group

texts.en:
Florely Q. is from the village of Villa Corazon, Mallig, Isabela. She is 32 years old. Florely is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Florely Q.'s group.

Florely is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Florely owns & operates a business venture into making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Florely has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Florely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Florely is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Florely from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
