ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana Lucia Santillán T. tiene 21 años, es soltera, y  no tiene hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Ana trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, cebada, trigo,  además se dedica a la cría animales en la casa como ganado, chanchos,  los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Ana desea ayudar a su mama con los quehaceres domésticos. 

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Ana Lucia Santillán T. is 21, single, and has no children. She lives in the canton of Guaranda in the Bolívar province. She is a member of the rural communal bank "Grupo Enmanuel," which is located 45 minutes from the Guaranda capital in Bolívar province. There are 17 members in all, and it is an agricultural and livestock community. The people are indigenous and speak Quechua. Ana works in agriculture to increase her family's economic resources. Her main crops are corn, barley and wheat, and she also works breeding livestock such as pigs. She sells her products from her house and she also sells her crops in the wholesale market of Guaranda every 6 months. An important cultural event is carnival, which is celebrated every year in February. In addition, Ana likes to help her mother with the household chores. Ana requests this loan to buy supplies for her work in the fields, particularly chemical and organic fertilizers. Her goal is to have a successful economic activity for her family. The challenges she faces are the problems with the weather and the diseases that can affect the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies (fertilizers)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gull-E-Lala Group

texts.en: Nasrin J. is thirty-nine years old and the leader of Gull-E-Lala group. Nasrin is married and has four children. She lives in the 7th district in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a very hardworking women and she is honest. She is responsible for all of the members of her house. She is a tailor and she sews different kinds of pillows. She has requested a loan to help increase her business and buy the materials she needs to do her tailoring. She thanks the Kiva lenders a lot.

loans.use: To buy materials she needs to do her tailoring

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 36 años, casado y padre de dos hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se dedicó a las tareas del campo, sembrando hortalizas, como: zanahoria, espinacas, cebolla; así como también alfalfa, que servirá como forraje para sus cuyes, que son alimento primordial de éste animal. Cada mes comercializa cuyes en gran número a una empresa, lo que le genera un ingreso adicional a su economía, eso le da mucha satisfacción a Jesús. Ahora se propone mejorar la crianza de este animal, ya que le están dando buenas rentas. Su trabajo es de todos los días de manera incansable y ahora tiene como meta, ampliar el espacio de su granja y aumentar la producción de cuyes. Este es su catorceavo crédito con MFP, por tanto seguirá siendo muy puntual con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará sacos de abono para sembrar alfalfa, ya que es el alimetno fundamental de sus cuyes.
texts.en:
Jesús is 36 years old, is married, and has 2 children, who live with him in his own house. Since his childhood he has worked on the land, sowing vegetables such as carrots, spinach and onion. Jesús also plants alfalfa, which serves as food for his guinea pigs, as it is their primary source of food. Each month he sells a large quantity of guinea pigs to a company, giving him additional income, and in turn, great satisfaction. Jesús is proposing to improve and expand his guinea pig breeding as it is giving him very good results. His work is never-ending, every day, and he now has the goal of expanding the space of his barn and increasing the production of guinea pigs. This is his fourteenth loan with MFP, and he will continue to be punctual with his payments as always. With the loan he is seeking his will buy sacks of fertiliser to sow his alfalfa, as it's so important for his guinea pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alfalfa as guinea pig feed

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.es: Rosanna tiene 24 años, es soltera, vive en una casa alquilada con su hijo Johan de 7 años. Ella es padre y madre para su pequeño, es por eso que a diario se esmera en hacer que nada le falte, desde entonces se dedica al cuidado de café, plátano y palta, que son sembrados sobres sus terrenos heredados por su madre. Actualmente no cuenta con la ayuda de algún familiar, por ello contrata operarios, quienes se encargan de dejar limpios sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su labor es cosechar, ya que le resulta divertido recolectar cada grano de café, sin embargo le es difícil trasladar los pesados sacos o canastas. Esta actividad lo considera muy rentable, porque le permite vivir cómodamente y realizar algunos ahorros. Por otro lado tiene una tienda al cual desea incrementarla de productos para dinamizar sus ventas y de las utilidades que reciba empezar a estudiar una profesión. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasta de pertenecer a su grupo comunal por todos son muy unidas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos de primera necesidad para abastecer su pequeña tienda.
texts.en:
Rosanna is 24-years-old, single, and lives in a rented house with her 7-year-old son, Johan. She is both father and mother to her little one, and that’s why every day she makes sure he doesn’t lack anything. She works growing coffee, plantains, and avocadoes, which she raises in lands inherited from her mother. Right now she doesn’t have help from any of her family, so she has to hire laborers, who she charges with keeping her fields weeded. What she likes best about her job is harvesting, and she has fun collecting each coffee bean. However, it is hard for her to carry the heavy baskets or sacks of coffee. She considers this activity very profitable, because it allows her to live comfortably and even save some money. On the other hand, she has a store that she would like to grow by adding more products, to achieve more dynamic sales and, with her earnings, go to school to study a career. This is the first time she’s had a loan from MFP, and she shows herself to be very enthusiastic about belonging to a groups, because they all are very united. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy staple goods to stock her store with.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods to stock her store

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 57 years old. He is married and has three children, age 22, 24 and 26 years old. One of his children is still attending school.

He is a farmer from Eastern Kenya near Nkubu town. He has been farming for ten years and his products are milk, pawpaw, bananas and mangoes that he sells to the local market. He also owns some rental houses in the same area. His biggest challenges in farming are lack of enough finances for expansion, poor infrastructure and low prices for his farm produce.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 40,000 KES to construct a water tank to improve his banana plantation. The extra income from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children and to improve his family's standard of living. In the future, he hopes to be selling his farm produce to international markets and to acquire at least three high yielding milk cows.

He says that Juhudi Kilimo is the best organization for small scale farmers.

loans.use: To construct a water tank.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan is married with a grown son. He is a businessman from Beregovo. He offers car repair services in his hometown. Stepan launched this venture 15 years ago. He is an experienced technician who always tries to introduce newer equipment for a quality outcome of his work. His serious and responsible business approach has helped his business grow over the past 15 years. Currently, Stepan has about 50,000 grivnyas in inventory. His gross income amounts to 17,000 grivnyas, and his net profit is about 5,000 grivnyas.

Stepan is seeking a 10,000 grivnya loan to purchase spare parts for different vehicles he repairs in his workshop. A broader assortment of necessary parts will help Stepan attract more customers to his venture; thus, increasing his monthly income. Stepan is very serious about loan repayment. He has repaid previous loans without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To purchase spare car parts

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Lorena P. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 35 years old. Ma. Lorena is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Lorena owns & operates a fishing business, operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. 

Ma. Lorena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Lorena has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ma. Lorena is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Ma. Lorena from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's school fees and to make improvements to her house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Alinhinkira Womens Association-Jinja Group

texts.en:
In every difficult situation, there is always the need for one to remain philosophical. Succumbing to self pity and resentment has always been most young people’s weak point. This weakness in character is what 35-year-old N. Joy has invariably steered clear of in the last four years as she operates her metal fabrication shop business in Ivunamba-Jinja. 

She says her strongest personal attributes are being unwavering and in having self drive. She is a joyful married lady with four school going children. She has been driving a roaring trade in her business, going by the $80 her business generates for her in a month as profits. 

With this loan she wants to buy more metal to improve her metal fabrication business. She says she will be able to fabricate more items such as metal chairs.

loans.use: Buying more metal for fabricating household items such as metal chairs

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter A. A.   es un señor de 49  años de edad, que vive con su esposa y 4 hijos  en una comunidad de Costa Rica llamada General Viejo de Pérez Zeledón; está comunidad se destaca por estar ubicada en el Valle del General. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería, la agricultura y comercio este último ha crecido en gran manera brindando nuevas oportunidades de trabajo.

Don Walter  ha sido agricultor toda su vida. Pero ahora él y 2 socios más van a construir la porqueriza más grande de su comunidad. El tiene grandes expectativas y asegura que va ser un gran negocio, ya que el precio del producto va en aumento 

El   desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢615 000 (seiscientos quince   mil colones) para comprar más cerdos y mejorar las condicione s de cuido e Infraestructura de su porqueriza. Con este préstamo espera alcanzar su meta de tener 150 cerdos para engorde.
Don Walter es socio de la Asociación de Productores El General, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su Sexto cuarto  y considera que su negocio va ser todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Walter A. A. is a forty-nine-year-old man who lives with his wife and four children in a community of Costa Rica called General Viejo de Pérez Zeledón, a region known for being located in the Valle de General. The region's economy consists primarily of cattle farming and agriculture, the latter having grown to such an extent that it is creating new opportunities for work. Walter has been in agriculture all his life, but now he and two additional members are going to build the biggest pigpen in their community. He has high expectations and assures that its going to be a large business, given that the price of the product is rising. He wants to obtain a loan for ¢615 000 (six-hundred-fifteen-thousand colones) to buy more pigs and improve the quality of care and infrastructure for his pigpen. With this loan he hopes to achieve his goal of having one-hundred-fifty pigs to fatten up. Walter belongs to the Asociación de Productores El General (El General Producers' Association), one of one-hundred EDESA member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be his sixth loan and he feels that his business will be a complete success.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs, and to rebuild his pigpen.

loans.name: Jackson Luis

texts.es: El Señor Jackson Luis tiene 22 años de edad, él se dedica a una abarrotería en su domicilio, negocio el cual administra por lo que trabaja todos los días desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Es una persona que ha trabajado toda la vida y gracias a su esfuerzo y constancia puede gozar de una vida tranquila pues siempre está pensando en el bienestar de su familia. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica a este negocio y fue por medio de lucha y sacrificio que ha logrado mantener su negocio. Este financiamiento es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar aceite y detergente. El sueña con mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. Jackson Luis is 22 years of age, and runs a grocery store out of his home every day from 5 am to 7 pm. He has worked his whole life and is thankful that due to his hard work, he can enjoy a tranquil life, but is always concerned with the welfare of his family. The grocery store has been in existence since two years ago and it was through his struggle and sacrifice that he has been able to maintain it. This loan will be used for the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil and detergent. He dreams of improving his income.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo (capital for his business)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make necessary repairs on her small home

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva pertenece al Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Genoveva es soltera, tiene 3 hijos y solo uno estudia, Genoveva tiene un restaurante llamado Miski Mikuy en un local alquilado en una avenida, brinda servicios de desayuno, almuerzo, cena, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 5 personas, Genoveva tiene proyectado complementar su negocio con la venta de pizzas.
Genoveva necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles para la compra de un horno pizzero.
Los sueños de Genoveva son tener un local propio y sacar adelante a su hija.
texts.en:
Genoveva belongs to the Sonrisa ["Smile"] Community Bank. Genoveva is single and has 3 children, only one of whom is in school. Genoveva has a restaurant called Miski Mikuy in a rented location on a boulevard. She offers brekfast, lunch and dinner with the help of 5 people. Genoveva plans to complement her business with pizza sales. Genoveva needs a loan of 1600 soles to purchase a pizza oven. Her dreams are to have her own location and to get her daughter ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of a pizza oven.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba F. is married. She smokes fish for sale at Elmina. Her husband is a mechanic.  Aba uses her income to help her husband to take care of the home.  Aba will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba anticipates reinvesting her increased profit back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Ndiongolor Pintok Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de NDIONGOLOR PINTOK est créé le 14 octobre 2010, jour de son inauguration. Il est composé de 36 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles se sont regroupées par voisinage et par affinité. 

Bernadette D. tout à fait derrière et levant la main est présidente du Banc Villageois. Elle a 49 ans,elle est mariée et a 9 enfants en charge,elle habite a Ndiongolor Pintok

Elle fait le petit commerce de mil et l'élevage de mouton depuis 7 ans. 

Son nouveau crédit de 50.000 francs CFA lui permettra de faire l'extension de son activité afin de réaliser des épargnes
Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la dépense quotidien.
texts.en:
The Ndiongolor Pintok Banc Villageois was formed and inaugurated on October 14, 2010.  It is made up of 36 women, all from the same village.  They formed the group on the basis of proximity and affinity.

Bernadette D., in the back row with hand raised, is president of the Banc Villageois.  She is 49 years old and married with nine children in her care, and lives in Ndiongolor Pintok.  She has sold millet and raised sheep for seven years.

Her new loan of 50,000 francs CFA will allow her to expand her business activities in order to save money.  Her goal is to support her husband in covering daily expenses.

loans.use: loan will be used to buy sheep

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita L. is a married woman who lives in Brgy, Talubangi, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: Tricycle Operator, Networking and Buy & Selling Dried Fish / Charcoal businesses.  Her husband Ramon L., who is 50 years old, works as a Tricycle Driver to earn his living.  They have 3 children who are 20 to 24 years old.  

Lolita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lolita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus raising the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 20th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital/maintenance so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children.  Lolita L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance and additional capital.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 55 years old, married, and father of six, aged between 10-30 years, with two attending school.  He has been a mixed farmer for twenty years.  He sells bananas, maize, beans, sugarcane, coffee and milk locally.

He has requested this loan of Kshs. 45,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The proceeds will cater for school fees and other family expenses.  In five years he aspires to have four dairy cows.

The challenge he is facing is unpredictable weather occurrences affecting  crop production, e.g., tomatoes.   He is thankful to Juhudi for the loan and hopes to get more later on.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg S. is 41 years old and lives with her husband in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her husband live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her husband is a driver and operates a transportation business using his own truck to supplement his family’s income.

Oyunchimeg manages a clothing business in her town. She started her business in 2004 and has since built a stable operation. After growing her business over the years, her earnings enabled her to buy a car for her family.

Oyunchimeg is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more winter clothes in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more winter clothes

loans.name: Obedi

texts.en: Obedi is 26 years old and lives with his family in Fort Portal, Uganda, where he hopes to build his own home over the next three years. For the last six years, he has made a living by providing transportation services. Things have gone very well, but he does not own the motorcycle he drives and therefore has to give 70 percent of his income to the owner. He is applying for this loan to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy his own motorcycle

loans.name: Los Progresistas De Cupiche Group

texts.es: “Los Progresistas de Cupiche”, es un grupo conformado por 8 personas muy emprendedoras cada uno con diferentes actividades pero un solo objetivo, el cuál es trabajar mucho para lograr el progreso de  de cada una de sus familias, tal es el caso de Julia Teodora quien tiene 42 años de edad y se dedica a preparar tortas para vender, actualmente está  especializándose en repostería, también tiene un mini bazar en el cuál vende regalos, cosméticos, adornos y gaseosas,  gracias a su esfuerzo y  trabajo ayudó a su esposo a construir su casa, mejorar su negocio y darles educación superior a sus hijos mayores y el ultimo de sus hijos se está preparando en una academia para ingresar  a la universidad. Julia Teodora solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar los artículos que le hace falta en su mini bazar como son: adornos, regalos, cosméticos e ingredientes para preparar tortas. Ella sueña con poner una pastelería en su casa. En la fotografía podemos apreciar a los socios de la alcancía comunal en el negocio de Julia Teodora con sus hijos en brazos en el momento del desembolso.
texts.en:
“Los Progresistas de Cupiche” is a group made up of 8 very enterprising people, each one with a different job but only one goal: to work hard in order to achieve progress for their entire family. Such is the case of Julia Teodora, who is 42 and makes pies to sell. She currently specializes in desserts, and also has a mini bazaar where she sells gifts, cosmetics, decorations and pop. Thanks to her hard work she has helped her husband to build their home, improve their business and give their older children higher education. Their oldest child is studying in an academy in preparation for entering university.
Julia Teodora is requesting this loan from EDAPROSPO to purchase the articles that she needs in her mini bazaar, such as: decorations, gifts, cosmetics and ingredients for making pies. She dreams of opening a bakery in her home. In the photo we can see the members of the community ban in Julia Teodora's store. Julia Teodora has her children in her arms in the photo.

loans.use: gifts, decorations, cosmetics and ingredients for pies

loans.name: Merina

texts.en:
Merina N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Merina changed her business from a retail shop to selling local gin.  She has been in this business for a few months, working 6 days out of every week. Merina sells her products from home by means of retail.    She also generates additional income through a retail shop. 

Merina has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerry cans of local gin. The main business challenges for Merina include the rainy season, transportation, and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations are to be a local gin agent and to educate her children up to university.   

Merina lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and electricity bills.

loans.use: To buy local gin

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a widow who lives in Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and a Natasha dealer business. She has 4 children who are between 27 and 38 years old.  All of her children are married. 

Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Erlinda's previous loan of PHP 10000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6400, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15000, which she intends to use to purchase more stocks to sell so that she can continue to save up for future household expenses. Erlinda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 	

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold, 49, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a house on land that they have owned for 21 years. His two children attend college and his wife helps him with the business.

Ganbold started his carpentry business with his wife in 2001. They operate their carpentry and woodcraft business in a workshop that they built in 2004 using their business profits. In the future, they are planning to enlarge their workshop and operate it all year long. Ganbold is a hardworking and modest person who says, " We want our children to finish their college and begin their own life without any difficulties. We work hard to pay for our children's tuition fees". Ganbold is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more materials for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle to resell.

loans.name: Jafeth

texts.en:
Jafeth is a married man with three children, two boys and one girl. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

Jafeth has operated a grocery shop for the past ten years, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of competition and the high cost of transportation in his business. With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase a deep freezer to improve his business and meet customer demand. Jafeth decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
31-year-old Jenalyn is a married woman. She has 2 children aged 16 and 13. Her husband works as a driver and farmer.

Jenalyn is engaged in farming. She grows rice crops then sells her harvest at the market. Aside from farming, Jenalyn also owns and manages a sari-sari store, selling items such as canned goods.

Jenalyn's loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and additional merchandise to resell.

loans.use: to purchase seeds/fertilizers for her rice farm and merchandise for her store

loans.name: Hasanatu

texts.en: This is 32 year-old Hassanatu B..  She is married, and has 1 child who is 12 years old. In 2006, Hassanatu established her assorted food stuff business. She began her business because she wants to generate income and support her child.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 300,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Hassanatu requires a loan in order to buy more food items for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Hassanatu plans to educate her children and establish a savings account. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy imported food items for her business

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en:
Akbar U. is a 37-year-old farmer who is married and has three sons. He has been breeding cattle since 1998, starting with initial capital of 20,000 KGS. Today he has milk cows, sheep and horses at his farm and also cultivates a plot of land where he grows corn, wheat and vegetables. 

Akbar wants to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to buy more milk cows in order to increase milk sales and acquire new customers. With the revenues from this loan, he plans to build a barn for his cattle to provide good conditions of cattle maintenance. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary P.  is 28 years old. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. Two of them are in school. 

She is currently in the business of selling vegetables. 

Her future goal is to educate her children.

loans.use: to stock more vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy utensils, shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Amistad Del Sur Group

texts.es: Amistad del sur es una asociación conformada por 9 socias ingresan en su segundo ciclo sin haber tenido problemas de pago en el anterior ciclo. Son personas que a la fecha han demostrado mucha responsabilidad con sus cuotas. Ellos se dedican a distintas actividades con lo que logran mantener a sus familias y para lo que requieren el préstamo, tal es el caso del Sr. Agapito actualmente presidente de la asociación, el se dedica al autotransporte, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos que a la fecha se encuentran en etapa escolar. Con el dinero del crédito realizara mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y no le permite ofrecer un buen servicio,  Su máximo sueño es de poder comprarse su casita y así dejar de vivir en alquileres ya que es un gasto enorme,  muchos integrantes como el son personas trabajadoras por lo que agradecen la colaboración otorgada por la institución.
texts.en:
“Amistad del Sur” (Friendship of the South) is a Communal Bank that consists of nine members who are starting their second loan cycle. They did not experience any problems with repaying their previous loan. To date, the members have demonstrated great responsibility with their payments. They engage in different business activities in order to support their families. For this reason, they are requesting a loan.

Such is the case with Sr. Agapito. He currently serves as President of the Communal Bank. Agapito works in the transportation sector. He lives with his wife and two children who are attending school. The money from his loan will be used to maintain his vehicle, which is currently experiencing a few problems. This prevents him from offering good service. His greatest wish is to buy a small house because living in a rental property is an enormous expense.

Most of the members are hardworking individuals. They are grateful to be in a partnership with Emprender.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha  is a married woman with two children, both of whom go to school.  She doesn't take care of additional family members. She sells fruits and  vegetables at the market and works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 10 years.  

Aisha has requested a loan of 100,000 from MCDT SACCO,  with which to buy more watermelon, oranges, mangoes, and tomatoes.  Her major business challenges include transportation and perishability.  She resides in a rented house and has access to electricity  but not piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more fruits like watermelon, tomatoes, oranges and mangoes

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI I  est constitué de femmes mariées du village de N’PANA dans la sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, région de KOULIKORO (deuxième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 30  ans,  4 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide et du gombo.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont à leur  quatrième  prêt  de campagne.
MINATA, qui est la deuxième debout à droite,  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU, BAMAKO et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail, souvent en gros, au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 20.000 à 30.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Group Benkadi I is composed of married women from the village of N'Pana in Ouelessebougou prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and are on average 30 years old with four children. They cultivate groundnuts and okra.
In order to make their farms more profitable, the group's members have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their fourth agricultural loan.
Minata, the second woman standing from the right, plans on using her loan to purchase a sufficient quantity of groundnut seeds, small equipment, and agricultural inputs from the great market in Ouelessebougou. After the rainy season, crops are stored for a while to acquire value before being sold at the great market of Ouelessebougou, in Bamako and in neighboring markets. They are retailed or most often sold wholesale against cash or credit to customers who often come from the big cities.
After selling their crops, the group members expect to each make a profit of 20,000 to 30,000 CFA, which will be used to repay the loan with interest and for the daily expenses of their families.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs (such as fertilizers and seeds) and small equipment.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a retail shop that sells snacks, breads and biscuits. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Eufemia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Hawley Helbert

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Hawley Helbert; el tiene 22 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de taxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro, para comprar repuestos como llantas.
  
                                              
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Santo Domingo" communal bank, which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Mr. Hawley Helbert. He is 22 years old, single and has one son. He divides his time between his daily activities and his transportation business. He has a car that he uses for a taxi service around the streets of the city of Cusco. He works from 5:00 AM until 9:00 PM and would like to expand and improve his taxi service. He is requesting a loan for car maintenance and to buy spare parts, such as tires.
  
                                              
Hawley is very happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with his repayment schedule.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his car and to buy spare parts like tires

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira, a 45-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Eastern Poblacion, Lopez Jeana, where she has a business selling fish, earning about PHP 10,000 each month.

A member of PMPC for five years, Elvira has requested a loan for PHP 15000 to purchase additional equipment and fish for her business. She would like to have enough money for her future and the daily living requirements of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and fish for her business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Vivian is concerned with the future of their children. Therefore, Vivian aimed to become financially stable in order to give their children a bright future. She is 32 years old and was blessed with three children. Since farming is the main source of their living, they work hard and strive harder to increase their yields and thereby earn a higher income to satisfy their needs and to finance the education of their children.

Due to financial difficulties, she is asking an additional capital of PHP15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain their rice production. She believes that the loan will help them to increase their production and income. She mentioned that hard work and sacrifices are the only way to attain success. 

In the future, Vivian dreams that their business will grow and their children will all graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain the rice production.

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en:
Elmie is a former Overseas Filipino Worker in Bahrain. She earned enough income for her family, but because of the hard work she was forced to return home. On her return, she engaged herself in the hog fattening business.

She is 48 years old and blessed with four children. Through her business, she is sending her children to school. Within three years of operating her business, she is earning an average amount of PHP 1,500 every month, but this is not enough to provide their needs.

Thus, Elmie is requesting a loan amount PHP 4,000 to buy two more hogs as an additional source of profit. She hopes to earn higher than expected income for the improvement of their living conditions as well as to save for the educational purposes of her children.

loans.use: to buy two more hogs as additional source of profit

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and four children. For the last five years, she has run a shop where she buys and sells coconuts. She is applying for a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more coconuts to sell to her customers. Jenelyn joined HSPFI earlier this year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lizeth Andreina

texts.es:
La Señorita. Lizeth Hortensia es socia del banco comunal Bella Vista, vive por una comunidad que pertenece al a parroquia Victoria del Portete (Cuenca), esta localizada al sur de la Capital Azuaya, lleva su nombre en honor a la batalla ocurrida en sus campos, precisamente en las faldas del cerro Portete el 27 de Febrero de 1829. Su gente mantiene las tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señorita. Lizeth tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su papá se dedica a laborar en varias actividades y su mamá trabaja en la cría de animales específicamente en la de ganado. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Nuestra socia pasa en casa y se dedica la cría de animales como: cuyes, pollos y ganado a los cuales los vende en su comunidad o en las ferias de la ciudad.

Este es su primer crédito  y lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado y en alimento para el mismo.
 
Su meta es  ingresar a la universidad y ser profesional en la rama de la medicina.
texts.en:
Srta. Lizeth Hortensia is a member of the Communal Bank “Bella Vista”. She lives in a community that is part of the parish of Victoria del Portete (Cuenca), which is located to the south of the capital of Azuaya. This area is named in honor of a field battle that took place at the foothill of Portete on February 27, 1829. The people have maintained the local traditions and earn their living by raising animals and farming.

Srta. Lizeth is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Her father works in various activities and her mother raises animals, especially cattle. They do not own a home, so they live in a rental property.

Lizeth spends her time at home raising animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and cattle and then sells them in her community or at the fairs in the city. This is her first loan and she will use the money to invest in cattle and the appropriate feed. Her goal is to enroll in the university and become a professional in the field of medicine.

loans.use: to buy cattle and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Khim, 31 years old, is a tailor who earns $10 per day. She is a single mother with two children, 15 and 12 years old. Both are studying. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a new sewing machine for her business. She plans to expand her tailoring business and hire two or three tailors to work in her shop but she will need a long time to reach her goal because now she doesn’t have enough money.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Jeruk Manis 1 Group

texts.en:
Karniawati is 32 years old and married with three children.  She has been buying and reselling snacks (cakes and cookies) and clothing from her home since 2007.  This is her second loan with VisionFund Indonesia.  Her business is going smoothly. She wants the loan to increase her business capital (for snacks and clothing to resell) and will also use some for school fees for the children. 

The income from her business also helps pay for the school fees and uniforms so the family can send their children to school.  She hopes that the family continues to have enough income so the business can grow and the family can be more prosperous.  Also, if they become more prosperous, they hope they can someday afford to send their children to college.

loans.use: to buy more snacks (cakes and cookies) and clothing to resell.

loans.name: Milagros 1 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Milagro I es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está integrado por 11 mujeres muy trabajadoras, con ganas de salir adelante y progresar y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias.
Lilian es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella tiene una pequeña despensa. Gracias a este negocio ella puede sacar adelante a su familia con mucho sacrificio, trabajo y esfuerzo. Comenta que le va muy bien con las ventas y que le gustaría poder seguir con su negocio, es por ello que solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, lácteos, panificados y otros, con los cuales podrá ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.
Ella al igual que las demás está muy agradecida con la fundación y con Kiva, ya que la ayuda que les brinda es muy importante para el crecimiento de cada una.
texts.en:
The group Milagro I is located in the city of Encarnación. It is comprised of 11 very hardworking women who want to be successful and make progress and in this way to help their families. 
Lilian is one of the members of the group and she has a small store. Thanks to this business and much sacrifice, work, and striving, she can move her family forward. She comments that sales are strong and that she wants to continue with her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy drinks, groceries, dairy products, baked goods, and other things that will enable her to offer her clients greater variety.
She and the other members are very grateful to the foundation and to Kiva as the help that they have offered them is very important for the growth of each woman.

loans.use: To buy drinks, groceries, dairy goods, baked goods, and others.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is 52-years of age, married and has been blessed with five children. He is living in the village of Bugallon Norte, Ramon. He works hard to make a living. Armando is glad because his wife is helping him in improving the living conditions they have. 

Armando has been involved in the hog raising business for four years. He is raising one sow and fattening seven hogs. He patiently runs his business though sometimes he has suffered from difficulties. He endured all those hardships in his hog raising business because he is aiming to give his family a better future and to improve their living conditions. 

He is happy seeing that his wife is also busy in running her retail store. Armando would like to ask for financial assistance amounting to P35,000 which will be used to buy feeds for the daily maintenance of his hogs. He is hoping that he could get the amount requested because it will help him to fatten his hogs. This would mean a lot on him because he could raise them well until they will reach their optimum growth. In that way, he could sell them for a greater price and he could also save some for his security purposes when he gets weak.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for daily maintenance of raised hogs.

loans.name: Ramona Dolores

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ramona, tiene 56 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen  seis hijos,  cinco de ellos mayores de edad y el menor de 11 años que  estudia el último año de escuela. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella lava ropa ajena para ganarse la vida y además junto a su marido se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería, todos los días su marido sale a recorrer la ciudad vendiendo los billetes de lotería y ella de igual forma lo hace en sus momentos que está desocupada o en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local en el cual también vende sodas, aguas, bebidas y helados. Lleva con su negocio por más de 15 años y gracias a estos negocios sacaron adelante a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar detergentes, billetes de lotería, sodas y otras cosas que vende en su local. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The “San Vicente” communal bank meets every two weeks in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place noted for being very commercial, for its traditional feast days of Saints Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.


We met Ramona here.  She’s 56 years old, in a common law relationship and has six children; five of them are adults and the youngest who is 11 years old is attending the last grade of elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.


She takes in laundry to earn a living and with her husband she also sells lottery tickets.  Her husband goes out every day to walk the streets of the city selling lottery tickets and she does the same when she’s not otherwise occupied or at home where she has a small locale where she sells soft-drinks, water, beverages and ice-cream.  She’s been in business for more than 15 years and thanks to these businesses they raised their children to become upstanding citizens.


She will use this loan to buy detergent, lottery tickets, soft-drinks and other things she sells in her locale.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because the loans have helped her very much in her business.  Her dream is to stay healthy to continue forward.

loans.use: to buy detergent, lottery tickets, soft-drinks,etc.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe constitué essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39  ans, et en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à BOUGOULA - VILLE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
AMINATA, la première en grand boubou, fait le commerce de la pomme de terre, il y'a environ 14 ans  et jouis d’une grande renommée à la matière.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  une dizaine de sacs de 50kg de pommes de terre. Elle s’approvisionne chez les producteurs dans les voisinages de Sikasso ville.
Elle les revend en détail, sur commande, au marché et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 43.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: BENKADI is a group mainly consisting of married women with an average age of 39 and an average of four children. For the most part, they live in monogamist families in Bougoula, one of the popular neighborhoods of Sikasso. They are on their 14th loan with the Microfinance Institution Soro Yiriwaso to help meet the needs of their clients. Aminata, pictured first in the large boubou, sells potatoes. She has been doing this for about 14 years and has a very good reputation. With her loan, she plans to buy about ten 50kg sacks of potatoes. She buys from producers in the neighborhoods in Sikasso. She resells them, by order, at the market, and to family; she has both male and female customers. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 43,500 FCFA which will partly be used to pay for the loan and its interest and the other part for savings. She hopes to increase her business to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Berna Joy

texts.en: Berna Joy is engaged in agriculture. She raises hogs, and her husband cultivates land. Berna Joy would like to further develop her hog-raising business, and to do this, she needs a sufficient financial investment. With the requested loan, Berna Joy plans to purchase feed and vitamins for her hogs. Expansion of the farm will help Berna Joy earn more income so she can renovate her house. House renovation will mean improved living conditions for Berna Joy and her parents, who live with her.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 52-years-old, married to Jane and they are blessed with two children. He has been rearing beef cows for slaughter in his butchery for the past three years earning a monthly income of Kes 15,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Paul will use the loan to restock beef cows for  for his butchery business. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.

 His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop which will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy stocks of beef cows for his butchery business.

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.en:
Hamzah is 24 years old. He is the second oldest son among seven brothers and sisters. 

Hamzah is studying to become a lawyer in one of the private universities in Jordan. He has applied for this loan to pay for his semester’s fees so he can register and continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay for his semester’s fees

loans.name: Nadeema's Group

texts.en:
Nadeema is a member of this group from Iraq Nadeema, is a 43 years old divorced woman. she has two children. After divorce she had hard time to support her family. Nadeema  opened a beauty salon that  providing hair styling, cuts and coloring, face massage, make-up and beauty care to support her family . 
When she heard about Izdiharona's qard hassan product (without interest) for widow women she took a loan to buy air-conditioner and renovate her workplace. She is aiming to increase business and change her Salon to a beauty center .
The story of Nadeema  and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic developments clients .
They preferred to blur their faces for cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Nadeema's Group's 3,000 loan helped a member to buy air-conditioner and renovate her workplace .

loans.name: Fifa Mahouton Group

texts.fr: FIFA MAHOUTON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Odoe Louise (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 39 ans. Odoe Louise n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Odoe Louise est mariée à un cuisinier du nom de Pascal. Le couple a cinq enfants, scolarisés et aucun à leur charge. Odoe Louise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Odoe Louise vend des beignets à base de farine de blé, du sucre, de l'huile végétale et des poissons fumées, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Odoe Louise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Odoe Louise sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe FIFA MAHOUTON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter de la farine de blé, du poissons, du sucre et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Yubeidy

texts.es: La Sra. Yubeidy vive en domicilio de sus Padres y trabaja en la misma comunidad que es Cumandayti del Municipio Villa Vaca Guzmán del departamento de Chuquisaca, se dedica a la actividad Agropecuaria, siendo el único ingreso con el que cuenta por el momento y manifiesta que no tiene el apoyo económico para iniciar un emprendimiento y tener mejores ingresos y poder independizarse de su hogar para y no ser una carga a su humilde Familia y a futuro poder ayudarles y/o apoyarles económicamente, por esta razón requiere de dinero como apoyo para poder iniciar la actividad de apicultura (producción de miel) ya que cuenta con el conocimiento necesario para iniciar esta actividad por la capacitación que recibió de ONG´s. como la Fundación Nor Sud y Ayuda en Acción Bolivia, actualmente vive en su domicilio junto con su Familia; con el préstamo le servirá para implementar su producción apícola para producir miel, mencionar que dicha persona se dedicó desde jóven a la actividad Agropecuaria y es el único medio que tiene para su sustento diario y otros gastos Familiares y con esta nueva actividad podrá obtener a futuro un mejor ingreso económico y de esta manera poder vivir en mejores condiciones de vida junto a su Familia.

loans.use: implementar su producción apícola para obtener mejores ingresos y ofrecer mejores alternativas a sus clientes.

loans.name: Akouavi Kobéro

texts.en:
Miss Akouavi Kobéro J. is 30 years old and single. As the eldest daughter born into a poor family, she had to leave school very young in order to work and to help out her parents. So she started work in a shop selling pagnes (decorated fabric draped round the waist to form traditional tunics for both men and women) and jewelry. Thanks to this small income she was able to provide for her parents and her four brothers and sisters. After obtaining a loan of $650, Miss J. opened her own shop selling pagnes and jewelry. However, she only has limited means to satisfy the increasing demands of her fast growing clientele. In order to meet these demands, Miss J. is requesting a loan of $1200 which she will use to fund the purchase and resale of pagnes, jewelry and other items. The experience which Miss J. has built up in this field is the key to the success of her project.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 30 ans, Mlle J. Akouavi Kobéro est célibataire. Née d’une famille très pauvre, elle a dû abandonner très tôt l’école en tant que fille aînée pour travailler et venir en aide à ses parents. Ainsi, elle commença à travailler comme employée dans une boutique de vente de pagne et de bijoux et c’est grâce à son petit revenu qu’elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de ses parents et de ses 4 frères et sœurs. Avec le crédit de $ 650 obtenu, elle a ouvert sa propre boutique de vente de pagne et de bijoux. Mais ses moyens sont très limités pour satisfaire les demandes sans cesse croissantes de sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus importante. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite alors un crédit de $ 1200 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente des pagnes, des bijoux ainsi que d’autres articles. L’expérience que Mlle J. a acquise dans ce domaine est un atout pour le succès de son projet.

loans.use: buying and selling pagnes and jewelry

loans.name: Daniah

texts.en: D. is 47 years old and married with three children aged 30, 9 and 6. She sells some snacks, beverages, and fruit-flavored blended ice. She once stopped her business due to a shortage of working capital. Now, after being a member of MBK, she has returned to re-open her business. She wants to get a $50 loan to buy beverages like cola, fruit syrups, and some more snacks, and the rest will be spent to buy fishes at the fish market nearby. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Selling fried snacks

loans.name: Kayi

texts.en:
At 47 years of age, Mrs. Kayi G. is the mother of seven children who have been fatherless since 1998. Facing the needs of the household alone, she devoted herself to a small business of fried fish, which she buys on credit at the market to re-sell around the village which she crosses throughout the day. The meagre income barely suffices to cover the daily expenses of her family, who live in increasing misery. Having successfully gained many clients, Mrs. G. needs financial support to buy and fry fish herself to re-sell; this will increase her profit and hence her income. She is asking for a sum of $600 to provide herself with a can of oil, firewood, and a box of fresh fish in order to increase her income and alleviate the suffering of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 47 ans Mme G. Kayi est mère de sept enfants orphelins de père depuis 1998. Seul à supporter les charges de la famille, elle s’est consacré au petit commerce de poissons fris qu’elle prend à crédit les jours du marché pour revendre dans les quartiers du village qu’elle sillonne en longueur de journée. Les revenus très maigres suffisent à peine à couvrir les charges journalières de cette famille qui vit dans une misère accrue. Ayant réussi à avoir beaucoup de clients, Mme G. a besoin des moyens financiers pour acheter et frire elle-même les poissons et les revendre ; ce qui augmentera son bénéfice, donc son revenu. Elle sollicite un montant de $600 pour s’approvisionner en bidon d’huile, en bois de chauffe et en carton de poissons frais afin d’augmenter ces revenus et alléger les souffrances de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy, fry, and re-sell fish

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
Shahnoza’s entire family is engaged in business. Shahnoza and her mother travel to purchase goods in Khudzhand and Karosoo, Kyrgyzstan. Her father sells on markets (he is on the photo). Shahnoza is not married and lives with her parents. She has been in business for 5 years and has gained considerable expertise in running a business. Shahnoza sells food products and a variety of small items. The small items are sold retail on markets, while food products are sold wholesale. Recently, Shahnoza received a loan from MicroInvest. She used the money to purchase household goods. Now she plans to take another loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Вся семья Шахнозы занята в бизнесе. Шахноза и мама ездят за товаром в Худжанд и Каросуу, Кыргызстан. Отец торгует на базарах. Шахноза не замужем и живет с родителями. Шахноза в бизнесе уже 5 лет и за это время она приобрела большой опыт в ведении бизнеса. Ассортимент товаров огромный и включает в себя от продуктов питания до разной мелочевки. В розницу на базарах продают хозяйственные мелочи, а продукты питания продают оптом. Шахноза недавно получила займ в Микроинвест. На полученный займ она закупила хозяйственные товары. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Nativity and her family have been selling food and snack food in area high schools for several years. Very early everyday, they prepare the vehicle that they use to transport the food to their awaiting clients.

Due to bad weather and the load the vehicle carries everyday, it has had several mechanical problems and the family has had to use its entire savings to repair it. Since some of the problems it has cannot be fixed, they have decided to buy a new vehicle.

For this purpose, they are requesting a loan of $500.00 to make the purchase. They are committed to working very hard so they can pay the loan back within 6 months. With the new vehicle they will be able to transport their products more easily, and they will improve their quality of life. Natividad and her family thank you for your generous support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Natividad y su familia hace varios años se dedican a la venta de productos de consumo en los colegios. Todos los días muy temprano preparan la movilidad que los ayudará a llevar los alimentos hechos por la reina de la casa para ofrecérselos a sus clientes que la esperan expectantes. Debido a las inclemencias del tiempo y a la carga diaria el vehículo motorizado esta sufriendo varios desperfectos y todo el ahorro que habían acumulado hasta hace poco se ha utilizado para repararlo; en vista de que hay algunas fallas que van a persistir, la familia en su conjunto a decidido adquirir un vehículo nuevo. A raíz de este hecho solicitan un préstamo de 500 dólares para realizar la compra y se comprometen a trabajar muy duro para retornarlos en un período de 6 meses, con él podrán agilizar el traslado de sus productos y mejorarán su calidad de vida. Natividad y su familia agradecen tu generoso aporte.

loans.use: To buy a new vehicle for the purpose of transporting food products

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Mrs. Faith O. is 30 years old and is married with 4 children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where she sells fish to people living in her community.  She has been in this business since 2000 and is currently a LAPO member.  She is requesting a loan of $325 to enable her to buy more fish to sell.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Yut

texts.en: Mrs. Yut C. works selling vegetables at a market, earning around $3 each day in profit.  Her husband works producing palm sugar by boiling the sap from palm trees, making around $4 a day in revenue.  They have five children, of which, two work in construction each earning about $2 per day, and one is unemployed.  She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to purchase a generator for their house to improve their standard of living and allow them to work at night.  Her husband is pictured in the photo making palm sugar as she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a generator for her house.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia deals in palm oil. She is 53 years old and married with 4 children. She is the leader of her union. She needs the loan amount of $525 to buy more palm oil for sale. She has been in the business since 2004.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil for sale

loans.name: Nubia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nubia Garcia is known for being an excellent grade-school teacher, a vocation she has dedicated herself to for 20 years in a small school in the region of El Sauce in the city of Leon.

She has been working hard for a long time to improve her standard of living but unfortunately the salary she earns doesn't permit her the dream to rebuild her house. She needs to rebuild because her home is in poor condition with broken floors and holes in the roof. For this reason she seeks the help of Ceprodel to receive financial support in the form of a loan to be able to realize her dream of rebuilding her home.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Nubia Garcia se caracteriza por ser una excelente maestra de primaria cuya labor la ejerce desde hace 20 años en un pequeño colegio en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León.

Es una dama que por mucho tiempo se ha esforzado para mejorar el estado de su vivienda pero lastimosamente el salario percibido en su negocio de docencia no le permite llevar a cabo su sueño de reconstruir su casa. Es necesario destacar que la casa se encuentra en mal estado con el techo roto y además el piso quebradizo. Es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para recibir apoyo financiero por medio de créditos y así lograr su sueño de construir su casa de habitación.

loans.use: To purchase building materials and to pay for labour wages

loans.name: Masasi Group

texts.en:
Sabra B., age 36, is married and has an 11 year old son. She opened a charcoal business two years ago and works from 7am to 8pm daily selling charcoal. This business nets a monthly profit of about $75.

Sabra is the chairwoman for loan group Masasi, which has 16 members (see the photo). Sabra and her loan group hope for a loan to expand and develop their various small businesses. This is the group’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. The group as a whole guarantees the loan of any member who defaults.

Sabra will use her share of the loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Mr. Komi A. was born April 19, 1980 in Kouvé, in the district of Yoto. He is a sculptor and is married to Mrs. Abla Occansey, who is a seamstress. He began working as a sculptor in 1999 in Lomé. He bought tree trunks from the town Kpalimé and in certain other villages where the wood is plentiful and then brought it back to Lome. His customers all come from this town and from the interior of Togo, but above all they are foreigners and tourists. To keep his business going, he needs a loan of 450, 000 FCFA in order to purchase 100 feet of teak and 150 tree trunks in order to finish work for two complete lounges-sitting rooms.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Monsieur A. Komi est né le 19 avril 1980 à Kouvé dans la préfecture de Yoto. Il est un sculpteur et s’est marié à Mademoiselle OCCANSEY Abla qui est une couturière. Il a commencé son activité de sculpture en 1999 à Lomé. Il achète les troncs d’arbre à Kpalimé et dans certains villages ou le bois abonde et revient faire la sculpture à Lomé. Ses clients potentiels viennent de Lomé, de l’intérieur du Togo et surtout de l’étranger (Les touristes). Pour mener à bien son activité, Monsieur A. Komi sollicite un crédit de 450.000 FCFA pour acquérir 100 pieds de teck et 150 troncs d’iroko pour la fabrication de deux salons complets.

loans.use: To purchase 100 feet of teak.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco F. is a 36-year-old single father of a 5-year-old son. They live in the Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood.

Mr. F. has been selling lubricant for 3 years. During this time, he has struggled to increase his clientele. It was difficult for him in the beginning because of the lack of funds and experience needed to manage his business. His biggest dream is to always be able to offer his son—his reason for living and for whom he works day to day—the best in life.

With this loan, he would like to augment his inventory so that he can improve his selection of products, thus increasing his profits. He would also like to expand his business and offer more complete service.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco F. tiene 36 años de edad, es soltero, habita en el barrio Maria Auxiliadora, y tiene un pequeño hijo de 5 años.

Don Francisco se dedica a la venta de lubricantes desde hace 3 años, y durante este tiempo ha ido luchando para obtener más clientela, al inicio fue díficil por la falta de dinero y la experiencia para manejar su negocio. Su mayor sueño es siempre poder ofrecerle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo que es su razón de ser, y por quien trabaja dia a dia.

Con el préstamo desea elevar el nivel de inventario para poder mejorar su oferta y así obtener más ganacias para su negocio, el cual quiere agrandar para así ofrecer un servicio más completo.

loans.use: Increase inventory and offer customers a greater selection

loans.name: Yuldus

texts.en:
Yuldus K. is 37 years old. She is married and has three school-aged children. Her husband is an entrepreneur.

Yuldus is a market vendor. She sells fabrics in the local market. She has been in this business for six years. Yuldus started her business because she needed extra income to be able to help her husband to support the family. She also needed her own income in order to afford her home and health expenses.

She is trying to diversify the range of goods that she sells in order to satisfy the needs of clients with varying levels of income. Her business is stable, allowing Yuldus to make a considerable contribution to the family budget. She is doing her the best in order to make her children well-educated. She is dreaming that, in the future, her children will become successful entrepreneurs.

Now Yuldus is planning to purchase new fabrics in order to increase her stock of the fabrics. For this purpose, she requests 3400 Somoni ($1000 USD) for 8 months. Yuldus thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy new fabric

loans.name: Jerusalen Group

texts.es:
This is the Jerusalem community bank maD. up of 15 members, the 95% women from the same neighborhood. The neighborhood is called Villa Gadus, a humble neighborhood but with people of good heart. The meetings are held in the house of the President, Yolanda, who is a very responsible and punctual and a woman of strong character. The treasurer is Maria del Rosario and the secretary’s name is Reina. The great majority of the members work selling different lines of cosmetics house to house and the secretary makes homemaD. bread. All of the members have been awarded loans of 1.000Bs each in the first cycle to increase their working capital as each has her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Este es el Banco Comunal Jerusalen Conformado por 15 socias un 95% son mujeres D. la misma zona, El barrio se llama Villa Gadys, un barrio humilD. pero con gente D. gran corazon, las reuniones se llevan a cabo en la casa D. la Presidenta Sra. Yolanda una señora muy responsable, puntual, D. carácter fuerte, la Tesorera es la Señora Maria del Rosario , la Secretaria la Sra. Reina z, la gran mayoria D. las socias se dedican a ser Promotoras D. Cosméticos en diferentes líneas D. cosméticos, la Tesorera se dedica a la venta D. ropa, la Secretaria hace Pan Casero. A todas las socias se les ha otorgado un crédito como primer ciclo D. 1.000Bs a cada una, para el incremento D. su Capital, todas tienen negocio propio.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in some stylish pants to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is thirty-nine years old. She is married with five kids, of whom two have successfully completed high school and the other three are still in schooling. Ellen enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her kids.

Ellen owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. However, she is constrained by low capital from making meaningful progress. She is requesting a loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to make increased profits. She believes with her good customer relations, the loan will enable her to realize her dream. She is a member of the community group called Esther Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Zubayda.

texts.ru: Лачинова Зубайда живет в городе Яван. Работает в городе Нурек.Арендует прилавок  в магазине , где торгует продуктами питания. Занимается данным бизнесом уже четыре года. Хочет увеличить товарооборот . Для этого ей необходимо получить кредит. Это поможет ей увеличить доходы, в который так нуждаются ее дети. Зубайда разведена и имеет двоих детей. Поэтому ей просто необходимо увеличить зарабатываемые ею деньги.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zubayda L. lives in the city of Yavan. She works in the town of Hyrek. She rents a booth in a store, where she trades food products. She has been involved in this type of business for 4 years. She wants to increase commodity circulation. However to do this she needs to receive a loan, this will help her increase revenue which her kids are in desperate need of. Zubayda is divorced and has 2 children. Therefore it is imperative for her to increase her profits. She plans to return the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of commodity circulation

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en:
Kehinde, 43 years old and married with four children, sells cooked food in her shop located at Alaba International market, one of the biggest markets in Africa, located in Lagos State, Nigeria. Kehinde operates her business Monday through Saturday, 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. Her customers are mostly traders selling in the market.

Kehinde is now requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Catita Alvina

texts.es:
La señora Catita Alvina pertenece al BC. La Mujer Riojana y vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia y distrito de Rioja. Se dedica a la venta de jugos y extractos de frutas y verduras. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Mercado Central  Pto. N° 129, lugar donde espera a sus clientes. También vende refrescos y chupetes por las tarden en su casa ubicado en el Jr. Julio C. Arana 219. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará frutas frescas como plátanos, piñas, papayas, azúcar en saco, leche y cerveza negra. Con estos productos quiere estar abastecida con lo necesario para atender bien a sus clientes, también implementará un nuevo puesto de venta que acaba de comprar en el mercado.
Catita tiene 51 años de edad, es madre de 03 hijos y vive con 02 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Catita Alvina belongs to the Mujer Riojana (Riojan Woman) Village Bank in the city of Rioja in San Martin, Peru. She sells juices and fruit and vegetable extracts from her stall in the Central Market where she awaits her customers every day. She also sells drinks and popsicles in the afternoons from her home on Julio C Arana Street. With this $975 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy fresh fruit like bananas, pineapples, papayas, sugar, milk, and beer. With these products, she will be well-stocked in order to properly attend to her customers; she will also set up a new stall that she recently purchased in the market. Catita is 51 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are still dependent on her and live with her. Her goal is to expand her business and help her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bananas, pineapples, papayas, sugar, milk and beer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
