loans.use: To buy more rice for resale

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 47 años de edad, es casada hace 27 años, y madre de 8 hijos, actualmente vive con 3 de sus hijos menores, y con dos de sus nietas, en su casa propia. Desde muchos años atrás viene trabajando como ama de llaves, en la casa de la alcaldesa de la municipalidad de su localidad, de lunes  a viernes de 7am hasta las 5pm. Teodora trata de realizar con mucha eficacia y rapidez su trabajo, para darse unas horas libres para preparar los alimentos en su casa para su familia. Los sábados y domingos trabajar en la carpintería junto a su esposo, quien es un carpintero reconocido y próspero que en ciertas oportunidades recibe contratos grandes, entonces le falta mano de obra para el acabado correspondiente, y se ve obligada a trabajar Teodora y a buscar ayuda de una amiga suya, quienes son las encargadas de realizar el lijado y el laqueado hasta darle el brillo a cada bártulo que fabrican. Teodora y su esposo en todo este tiempo de convivencia han tratado de trabajar en armonía  en la fabricación de los muebles, con la finalidad de llegar a convertirse en una mueblería muy reconocida en su zona, y que sea una actividad muy rentable para que cuando crezcan sus hijos se dediquen a ella. La carpintería por el momento les es muy rentable y más cuando reciben contratas de varias instituciones. Actualmente Teodora es la presidenta de su banco comunal, donde viene recibiendo su 5to préstamo de MFP, y todo este tiempo no ha tenido problemas en realizar los pagos correspondientes. El dinero que solicita es para invertir en los insumos para su carpintería como son; lacas, tiner, lijas, y madera; con la finalidad hacer crecer su capital y no tener necesidad de insumos cuando tenga que realizar el acabado de los muebles.
texts.en:
Teodora is 47 years old. She has been married for 27 years, and is the mother of 8 children. Currently she lives with the three youngest of her children, and with two of her nieces, in her own home. For many years she has worked as a housewife in the house of the mayor’s wife. She works from Monday to Friday from 7am until 5pm. Teodora tries to do her work efficiently and quickly, so she will have free time to prepare the food in her own home, for her family. On Saturdays and Sundays she works in the carpentry shop alongside her husband, who is a well-known carpenter, and has prospered through certain opportunities when he received large contracts. Then he lost a worker and correspondingly stopped. He was obligated to have Teodora work and to look for help from a friend of hers, whose job it is to do the sanding and polishing until each piece they make shines. Teodora and her husband in all their time of living together have tried to work in harmony making furniture, with the end of being able to make it into a well known furniture shop in the area, and so have a profitable activity so that when their children grow up they will work there too. Carpentry at the moment is very profitable and they have received contracts from several organisations. Currently Teodora is the president of a community bank, where she has received 5 loans from MFP, and in all this time she has not had problems making the corresponding payments. The money that she is asking for is to invest in the materials for her carpentry shop, such as lacquer, thinner, sandpaper, and wood, with the goal of growing her capital and not to not be in need of materials when she has to finish the furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her business

loans.name: Muritala

texts.en: Muritala T. sells medicine in wholesale and retail. The demands for his medicine are high and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. He needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. He is 35 years old and he is married with 2 children. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Lidya

texts.en: Lidya is widowed, and she takes care of 2 dependents. Lidya is a millet seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya. She is a member of the Kabwe group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more millet to sell. She is hoping that with this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: Buy more millet for resale

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen is 39 years old and she is married with seven children. She mills grains for customers and she also sells foodstuffs. She needs a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate I. is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions. Kate is the lady standing in the picture. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase one hair dryer and hair extensions. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and one hair dryer

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheng S., 57, and her husband, Mr. Som-oun Nhem, 59, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1962 and have seven children: two sons and five daughters. All of their children are married, one of whom lives with the family. Her husband has been a primary school teacher since 1983.

Kheng has been selling silk products for fifteen years. She buys the goods from the local villagers and then resells them in other provinces. Now Kheng is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more silk fabrics for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more silk fabrics for resale

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 44 years old and is married to Marcos H., a 43-year-old farmer. They were blessed with two children who are both studying. The eldest, Herson, is 17 years old and is currently a college student, while the second, Lea May, is 13 years old and a high school student. The family lives in the hilly place of Barangay San Lorenzo Ilagan, Isabela. Delia's dream is to uplift their standard of living someday, and she is working very hard to become successful. According to her, life is full of challenges, but she never gives up trying to reach her dreams.

Delia is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to expand her rice retailing business. The money will enable her to maintain her business and also expand into a vegetable vending business. Currently, Delia is able to earn an income of PHP 700 weekly. She uses her income to provide for her family needs and saves some of it for the schooling of her children, who are enjoying their summer class vacation at the moment. She wants to grow her business and she is praying that her loan request will be granted.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis T. is 32 years old. He is married and the father of three children. Currently, all his children are in school. Francis is a very hard-working young man who works hard to provide for his family especially in the area of education. He sells palm nut fruits in large quantities to companies who produce cooking oil in bulk. He takes delivery from the farmers in the communities where he lives.

Fortunately Francis has a truck that conveys that palm fruits to his customers. He also uses the truck for commercial purposes which generates extra income to support the family. He is therefore requesting a loan to enable him to purchase increased stocks of palm nut fruits. With his 14 years' experience, he believes he can work very hard to repay the loan on time. He belongs to the village bank called ‘Papaye’ which means Goodness.

loans.use: To purchase increased stocks of palm nuts for resale

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora G. is from the village of Landing, Baliangao Mis. Occ.. She is 40 years old. Dioscora is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Dioscora raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dioscora is just starting this business.

In 2004, Dioscora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dioscora is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as appliance loan. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Dioscora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: appliance loan

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 46 years old, married, and father of four children. All his children are currently schooling. He lives with his wife in the western region of Ghana.

George is a very hard-working man who wants to provide for his immediate family with the needed support. He is a dealer in electrical goods and he is also an electrician. Professionally as an electrician, he takes contract from clients and wires their houses for them. He is consistent in his job and many contracts have been awarded to him. He has also been selling electrical parts for nine years now.

George wants the loan to buy materials that he frequently uses for work. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices at Kumasi and sells them to his customers at retail prices. With the loan he believes he can be more resourced to expand his territories of work and also to provide his children with an education.

loans.use: To procure an increased stock of electrical and electronic parts

loans.name: Primera Oportunidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo Primera Oportunidad  lo integran Rosario M., Martha Alemán y José Domínguez. Estos  son provenientes del municipio de Nindiri  y cuentan con muy bajos recursos  económicos. Ellos ya han trabajado en conjunto  con Adim lo que le ha otorgado   mayores oportunidades para su negocio y su familia. 

En la actualidad estos desean seguir trabajando pero para ello necesitan de capital para invertir en la compra de productos para sus negocios respectivamente como  la compra de pollo, maíz y zapatos de todo tipo.

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Rosario M. de 33 años de edad que hace quince años  inicio con venta  en pequeña escala de  pollo crudo que de poquito en poquito ha ido aumentando.   Ella es madre de un adolecente de 15 años y lo que más desea es seguir trabajando por su hijo y por ella pero para ello necesita de capital para reinvertir en la compra de pollo crudo.

 De la misma manera su compañera de grupo Martha Alemán que tiene dos años de tener una  tortillería que uno de los negocios más rentables porque es parte de la dieta nicaragüense y que no falta en los tres tiempo desayuno, almuerzo y cena.  Este tipo de negocio requiere de trabajo e inversión   para  invertir en maíz, leña y molino. 

Mientras José Domínguez de 30 años tiene dos años y medio de vender zapatos de forma ambulante. Este tipo de comercio es muy laborioso, casando y requiere de mucha inversión para adquirir los distintos modelos de zapatos y cantidades grande.
texts.en:
Rosario M., Martha Alemán and José Domínguez are the members of the Primera Oportunidad (First Opportunity) group. They are from the Nindiri municipality. Although they have limited resources, their businesses and families have benefited from opportunities previously provided by ADIM. In order to continue working, they need capital to invest in the purchase of products for their business. These products include chicken, maize (corn), and shoes of all types. Rosario M. is the group coordinator and is 33 years old. Fifteen years ago, she began a small-scale business of selling of poultry and it has been growing over the years. Rosario is the mother of a 15 year-old son. For her sake and that of her son, she wants to continue working but needs capital to invest in her business. Martha Alemán has operated a “tortilleria” for two years. It is a very profitable business because the Nicaraguan diet includes tortillas at breakfast, lunch and dinner. This type of business requires hard work and ongoing investment in the purchase of maize, firewood and grinding mills. José Domínguez is 30 years old and has worked for two and a half years as a traveling shoe salesman. This type of business is very labor intensive and requires the investment necessary to acquire a variety of models and sufficient quantities of shoes to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products to support their respective businesses: chicken, maize, and shoes of all types.

loans.name: Shosanya

texts.en: Shosanya sells clothing materials used as lining in making clothes of different styles by customers as occasion demands. She has been in this trade for the past five years and with patience has groomed this business to this level. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase clothing materials to sell.Shosanya is 27 years old and married with two children. I am grateful to all who makes this loan accessible.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials to sell.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est spécialisée depuis 2005 dans la vente de produits d’alimentation générale, plus précisément la vente d’huile de palme  et d’huile blanc. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière au foyer. Elle s’approvisionne lu plus souvent à Tsévié, à une trentaine de kilomètre de Lomé, mais aussi à Kpalimé sur moins de cette distance. Elle vend ses produits à la devanture de sa maison dans le quartier de Tokoin Tamé à Lomé. C’est pour renouveler son stock presque fini qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander 50 bidons d’huile de palme et 45 bidons d’huile blanc. Ce prêt lui permettra également de couvrir ses frais de transport vers les mieux d’approvisionnement.
texts.en:
In 2005, this lady became specialized in selling grocery items, palm oil and white oil to be precise.  She is married and the mother of two children.  This business allows her to bring her financial share to the household.  She usually stocks up in Tsévié, located about 30 km from Lomé, and also in Kpalimé, which is less distant.  She sells merchandise in the entryway of her house in the Tokoin Tamé district in Lomé.  To renew her almost-exhausted stock, she's requesting a WAGES loan to order 50 containers of palm oil and 45 containers of white oil.  This loan will also enable her to cover the costs of transport to places with better supplies.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Igor

texts.en: Igor is married with no children yet. He uses his car to offer taxi services in his city and between neighboring cities as well. Igor has been in this business for 5 years. Today more and more people use taxi services increasing number of potential clients. Using phone to get client’s orders Igor always have plenty of clients.  This business is the only source of income for his family. Igor would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to fix his car engine. As he makes more profit Igor hopes to increase his family living conditions.

loans.use: to fix the taxi engine

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo es un joven soltero de 24 años, actualmente vive en la casa de su abuela, por la que siente un gran amor porque lo cuido desde niño tras el abandono de su madre y le enseñó la responsabilidad y el trabajo. Él se dedica a la siembra de café, plátanos y ají, paralelamente estudia la carrera de Agroindustrias, diariamente de 7 de la mañana a 1de la tarde, en un instituto tecnológico de la ciudad. Para ello, viaja durante dos horas en carro y cuando regresa a su casa a las 3 ó 4 de la tarde cuida de sus cultivos y los fines de semana se dedica a la recolección de sus plátanos, los cuales vende, a 5 soles la arroba (12 kilos), a los compradores que van hasta su chacra. Sus sueños a futuro son de de terminar airosamente su carrera, dedicándose plenamente a sus cultivos, que son su única fuente de ingresos económicos, por ello estima y cuida a cada una de sus plantas.
Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, donde se le reconoce por su responsabilidad, pues cuando no puede asistir a la reunión de su banco comunal, deja el dinero de su pago al tesorero. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la siembra de ají en otra de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is a 24 year old single man. He currently lives in his grandmother’s house. He feels a great love for her because she took care of him after his mother abandoned him when he was a boy. His grandmother taught him about responsibility and work. He devotes himself to planting coffee, bananas, and chilies. At the same time, he is studying for a career in the agricultural industry. He goes to a technology institution in the city every day from seven in the morning until one in the afternoon. To do so, he travels two hours by car. When he returns home at three or four in the afternoon, he takes care of his crops. On the week ends he gathers his bananas, which he sells for 5 soles for twenty-five pounds (12 kilos) to the buyers who come to his farm. His dreams for the future are to proudly finish his career, and to fully devote himself to his crops. They are his only source of income. That is why he values and takes care of each one of his plants. This is his third loan with MFP, where he is recognized for his responsibility. When he cannot attend a meeting of his communal bank, he gives the money for his payment to the treasurer. The money from the loan he is now asking for is to plant chilies on another one of his farms.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare his land for the next planting

loans.name: Irvy

texts.en:
Irvy B. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old and married with three children of school age. To make a living, Irvy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $227 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Irvy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irvy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Irvy is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to invest in another business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Como segunda actividad se dedica al cultivo de papa y otros, en su respectiva comunidad, su esposa es ama de casa y colabora con el cuidado del ganando.


Vive. en la  comunidad  de Ticuyo de la Provincia  los Andes  del departamento de La Paz, ubicado  a  dos  horas de la ciudad de La Paz.


El crédito lo destinará a la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Luis raises cattle and sells the milk to PIL Andina (leading milk supplier in Bolivia). As a second activity he grows potatoes in his community. His wife is a housewife and helps take care of the cattle. He lives in Ticuyo, in the Los Andes province located two hours away from La Paz. He will use his loan to purchase a dairy cow and increase his production, thus increasing his income. This is his first loan with Impro; his evaluation has qualified him to receive it.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Rosemarilyn

texts.en:
Rosemarilyn B. is from the town of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarilyn owns and operates a business venture in  agriculture sector. While not the only means for generating revenue the means source of income comes primarily from raising pigs for sale in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rosemarilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her piggery.

Rosemarilyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 


About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase another cow.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap N. is a villager in Ta Non village in Takeo province. She is a silk weaver in the local village. In this business, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy more silk for her business, so she decided to ask for a loan to this for her purpose. Her husband, Mr. Sreong Vannak, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for an income. Mrs. Sopheap N. is a mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more silk for her business.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mr. Sinat T. is 44 years old. He and his wife, Mrs. Lay Meach, age 40, have been married since 1992 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. All of them attend school. The family lives approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sinat has been a motor taxi driver for ten years. His wife stays at home and does housework. His motorbike is old and does not work well, so he is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike to replace his old one.

loans.name: Soeu

texts.en: Soeu N. is a low-income person earning a living as a grocery seller in Kampong Chhnang province. She is married with six children, two of whom are married while the remaining four are single. To help feed the family, two of her daughters sew clothes for a garment industry. Her husband is a contributor who assists the family by cultivating rice. Soeu N. is very busy in her business due to there being many clients who need her items, and recently part of her inventory has been exhausted. She hopes to acquire other items by asking for a loan to increase the different types of groceries she sells. (Soeu N. was very busy selling her items when the photo was taken so her husband is shown instead.)

loans.use: To increase the different types of groceries she sells

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon C. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. He is 42 years old. Marlon is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Marlon plants and harvests rice to sell. Marlon has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately $76 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Marlon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. Marlon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 32,000 PHP from ASKI. He is requesting a new loan of 37,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 4th loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Virginia's Group

texts.en:
Virginia C. is from the village of Maligaya. She is 48 years old. Virginia is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Virginia C.'s Group.

Virginia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia raises livestock, namely pigs, for fattening and sale. Virginia has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase  livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Liliana Patricia

texts.es:
Liliana Patricia C. T. es una mujer de 33 años de Malambo, municipio del área metropolitana de Barranquilla, allí vende fritos, verduras y pescado desde su casa. Liliana se vinculó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace un año, cuando recibió un crédito con el fin de comprar sillas, mesas, un calentador, un molino y un surtido de pescado. Esta vez, solicita Para ampliar su negocio su segundo crédito por valor de $2.000.000, con él comprará pescado, una pimpina de aceite, un bulto de maíz y un congelador pequeño.
Hace ya 5 años Liliana comenzó su negocio de venta de fritos y verduras con el fin de apoyar con su  esposo  los gastos de la familia, aprovechando la experiencia de su papá, que  tiene desde hace 15 años un puesto en el mercado. Después empezó a traer pescado de Tasajera, corregimiento en el departamento de Bolívar, y se compró un enfriador para guardarlo. Una gran parte de la clientela de Liliana llega a su negocio porque vive al lado de un cementerio y es costumbre desayunar con fritos y pescado, especialmente en cuaresma.
Este crédito y los nuevos activos que ha ido adquiriendo han incrementado las ventas pues cuando empezó, solo tenía un pequeño capital y no tenía infraestructura. En el futuro sueña con que su negocio continúe creciendo y que sus ingresos se incrementen, permitiéndole terminar la educación de sus cuatro hijos en edades entre los 14 y 6 años. Más adelante quiere construir un local para independizar su negocio que actualmente está en su casa.
texts.en:
Liliana Patricia C. T. is a 33 year old woman from Malambo, a municipality within the metropolitan area of Barranquilla. There she sells fried foods, vegetables, and fish from her house. Liliana has been affiliated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for one year. At that time, she received a loan so that she could purchase chairs, tables, a heater, a food mill, and a supply of fish. Now she is seeking to expand her business with a loan of 2,000,000 COP so that she can buy fish, a large container of oil, corn in bulk amounts, and a small freezer.

Five years ago, Liliana started her business selling fried foods and vegetables so that she could help her husband with the family expenses. She took advantage of the experience she learned from her father, who operated his own vending post at the market for 15 years. Afterwards she began bringing in fish from Tasajera, the location of the magistrate for the Department of Bolívar. She also bought a cooler for storing them. Most of her customers come to her business because she lives next to a cemetery, and it is customary to eat fried fish, especially during Lent.

These loans and the new assets that she has acquired have helped increase her sales since she started her business. She had very little capital and no infrastructure. In the future, she dreams of continuing to grow her business and increasing her earnings. This will allow her children to finish their education since they are between the ages of 6 and 14. Later on, she wants to build a separate location for her business since it is currently in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish, cooking oil, corn, and a small freezer

loans.name: Maria Ernestina

texts.es:
La señora María Ernestina D. se desempeña como maestra de primaria en un pequeño colegio del departamento de Chinandega. Ella es casada y con dos hijas que mantiene ya que viven con ella y una está culminando sus estudios universitarios.
La señora María Ernestina solicita el crédito para ayudar a su hija con el pago de la universidad puesto que está terminando su carrera y es de necesidad realizar dicho pago para llegar a cumplir el deseo de su mamá de tener una hija profesional.
texts.en:
María Ernestina D. C. is a primary school teacher at Marcos Dessys School. She is married and has two dependent daughters who live with her. Ana María Barrera Sobalvarro is asking for a loan because one of her daughters is about to finish college.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her daughter's school fees

loans.name: Hernan

texts.en: To make a living, Hernan R. provides jeep/ jeepney services to local community members. He is 37 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Airport Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. Hernan has been in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Being a jeepney driver, Hernan has a sari sari store managed by his wife as another source of income. In 2009, Hernan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Hernan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide his service. Hernan is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his third loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja y tiene 3 hijos en etapa escolar. Vive en la localidad de Pichari, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia.

Él se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy aguerrido, pues a corta edad vivió junto a sus padres la época de terrorismo en su localidad. Por ello, desde muy joven empezó a tener su pequeña parcela (que sus padres le obsequiaron), de donde sacó mucho provecho, pues empezó a cultivar cacao. 
En el presente, con una cantidad considerable de tierras, cultiva y comercializa sus productos de cacao y hoja de coca con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Para Ismael sus hijos son la razón de existir, ya que le dan muchas fuerzas de seguir adelante, por más que en el camino esté lleno de obstáculos. 
Generalmente sus productos los vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad, por lo que sus ventas están mejorando con respecto al mes anterior y normalmente recibe la ayuda de sus familiares para el trabajo en el campo. Su horario de trabajo es desde las 6:00AM hasta las 6:00PM y ya lleva casi 10 años trabajando en esta actividad.
Su plan a futuro es comprar un carrito sanguchero (móvil para comida rápida), para que su esposa labore con éste y obtenga dinero extra.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por las facilidades que le otorgan. Es por ello que se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos, además agradece a su banco comunal por la solidaridad que ejercen entre todos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en darle un mantenimiento adecuado de sus plantaciones de cacao y hoja de coca, con la finalidad de minimizar futuras apariciones de plagas.
texts.en:
Ismael is 29 years old and lives with his wife and three school age children in the town of Pichari, located in beautiful Cuscan jungle, where he has his own home.

He is known for being a courageous man because, at a young age, he and his parents lived during a violent period in their neighborhood. Ismael took advantage of a small plot of land that his parents bought for him and began growing cacao. He presently owns a considerable amount of land that he uses to grow and sell products such as cacao and coca leaf so that he can improve his family’s quality of life. For Ismael, his children are the reason for his existence since they provide him great strength to press forward even though the road of life has many obstacles.

Ismael usually sells his products at the local collection centers. Lately his sales have been improving as compared to previous months. His relatives normally help him with the work in the fields. He works from 6am to 6pm and has been engaged in farming for almost ten years. His future plans include buying a mobile fast food cart so that his wife can work and earn extra income.

This is his second loan with MFP. Ismael is appreciative of the services that he has received. Therefore, he promises to complete his payments. In addition, he is grateful that everyone in his Communal Bank works closely with one another. The money he requested will be used to provide adequate maintenance to his cacao and coca leaf crops in order to minimize future occurrences of pests.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of his crops

loans.name: Letty Yolanda

texts.es:
Letty de 55 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su esposo es comerciante ellos tienen dos hijos que ya no viven con ellos, ella es vendedora Yambal (compañía de venta de cosméticos por catalogo que ayuda a las mujeres del Ecuador a ser vendedoras potenciales con un porcentaje de ganancia). 

Comenzó a ser vendedora Yambal cuando una amiga la inscribió en una charla, después compro algunos cosméticos para ver como le iba vendiendo a sus amigas, por esa buena decisión ahora ella es vendedora, para tener dinero adicional también vende artículos para hogar y ropa. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa y perfumes para vender a sus clientes, en el futuro quiere tener un almacén de productos varios.
texts.en:
Letty is 55 years old and lives in the urban zone of Suburbio de Guayaquil. Her husband is a businessman and they have two [adult] children who no longer live with them. She is a Yambal sales representatives (a cosmetic company that specializes in catalog sales and who pays commissions to their Ecuadorian saleswomen). She bagan as a Yambal saleswoman when a friend spoke to her about it. She then bought a few cosmetics to see how sales to her friends would go. It turned out to be a good decision. She is a good salesperson and she also sells articles for the home and clothing in order to earn extra money. She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing and perfume to sell to her customers. Someday she hopes to have her own general store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana I. is a 57-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a bakery business. She lives in Mangnao, Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental, with her husband, Felix, who is a baker, and their three children who are between 32 and 35 years old. Ana has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her bakery business she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 30,000. Ana is now borrowing Php 19,000 as additional working capital for her business. This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ana aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Azumi

texts.en: Azumi S. is married and has a child. Her husband is a carpenter and she has received a junior high education.  Azumi sells oranges at Abura. She wishes to use the loan to buy fruits including oranges in sacks to be able to sell in both smaller and larger quantities. She has been in this trade for six years. Azumi uses her income to help her husband take care of the family. With the new profits as a result of the loan, she plans to reinvest in other kinds of fruit to bring variety into her business.

loans.use: To buy fruits including oranges in sacks

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
44-year-old Josefina L. wants her youngest child to graduate from college and at least have a more comfortable life than her three elder children who are only high school graduates. For financial support to the needs of her children, whose ages range from 14 to 22 years old, especially for the sustainability of education, she is requesting for a loan from KIVA through ASHI. She will be using the loan to enhance her husband’s fishing business as the primary source of income for her family. Her barbeque selling business goes a great deal towards augmenting her husband’s income. , Josefina is selling chicken and pork barbeque, grilled just in front of their house. People passing by are tempted to buy because of the captivating smell. 

For the opportunity for having been a member of ASHI since 2009, Josefina is very glad that she has been entrusted with a loan which has become the main financial source for her family to have a business. Someday, she wishes that her husband’s fishing activity will grow further and will become sustainable. She hopes to sell a large volume of fish from her husband’s catch for bigger amount of profit.

loans.use: Large portion of loan will be used to purchase additional fishing gear and a small portion will be used to purchase ingredients for barbeque.

loans.name: Varnette Venture #1 Group

texts.en:
Eva G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Varnette Venture #1.  She is 44 years old, widowed and has six children who range from 10 to 26 years old. She was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to financial constraints. She also cares for 4 siblings.

For 7 years, she has been selling used clothes in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. She describes herself as an earnest person.

Her goal is to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Meliton

texts.es: Melitón, de 31 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Yesenia de 30 años y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. El trabajo al que Melitón se dedica, es el cultivo de café y plátano. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Él vende sus productos en el mercado de La Merced puesto que es donde mejor le pagan. Lleva 3 años realizando este trabajo, y parte de su actividad le gusta mucho la cosecha, ya que ve el esfuerzo que puso en sus campos, sin embargo tiene cuidar de la plaga de insectos. En adelante, espera mejorar su producción para tener mejores ingresos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, manifiesta que dicho préstamo le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidario con ellas. Los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, lo invertirá en insumos para evitar la plaga de insectos.
texts.en:
Melitón, 31, is an unassuming, hard working man. He lives in his own house with his wife, Yesenia, 30. What he wants most is to get ahead in life. Melitón is a coffee and banana grower. He works his fields every day starting very early in the morning because he knows that the money he’ll get from his products very much depends upon the quality of his crops. He sells his product in the market in La Merced because that’s where they pay best. He has been in this line of work for 3 years and what he enjoys most is harvesting because that’s when he sees the fruits of his labors. However, he has to protect against insect infestations. In the future, he plans to improve his crops in order to earn higher income. This is his 2nd loan with MFP. He states that the loan will be very useful for his business’ progress. He is well liked in his communal group because he is very supportive of his fellow members. He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy supplies to prevent insect infestations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to prevent insect pest infestation.

loans.name: Nicela Libernesa

texts.es:
Nicela de 58 años, vive en una zona periurbana con lomas y caminos de tierra llamado Paraíso de Guayaquil, ella tiene una pequeña papelería/tienda. 

Comenzó hace años con una copiadora, poco a poco con esfuerzo y después de la muerte de su esposo opto por readecuar su casa y ubicar una papelería en la parte delantera de su casa. Trabaja sola desde muy temprano hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo papelería y cuadernos para tener mas ingresos. En el futuro quiere surtir mas su papelería y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Nicela, 58 years old, lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil, an area in the outskirts of the city with hills and dirt roads. She owns a small stationary store. Many years ago Nicela started out with a copy machine, and little by little with effort and after the death of her husband, she decided to convert the back part of her house into a stationary store. She works by herself starting very early in the morning until 9:00 pm every day. With this loan she would like to buy stationary and notebooks in order to make more income. In the future she would like to supply her store with even more items and finish working on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stationary, notebooks

loans.name: Ngem

texts.en: Mr. K., age 57, makes a living driving a taxi motorcycle, picking up his passengers in and around his community. He is currently earning an average of $3 a day and has been running his service for a long time. He is a father of four children. Three of the children are teenagers and one is married and has started a new family home. Most of his children are employed. His wife, Sokha, works sewing for a garment industry. She is also a good housewife who cooks delicious meals and does a daily routine. K. currently lives in his own house that needs repairs. Because of that, K. has requested a loan to mend his old house.

loans.use: To mend his old house.

loans.name: Willian Steven

texts.es:
Willian de 21 años, tiene un  taller de mecánica en un garaje, vive en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales.

Por la necesidad de un empleo tubo que comenzar a trabajar en la misma profesión del papa. Poco a poco a trabajando con la ayuda de su papa arreglando motocicletas a podido mantener a su hijo. Trabaja arreglando la parte electrónica de las motocicletas desde muy temprano. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una maquina para limpieza de inyectores. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y tener un taller bien arreglado para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Willian, 21-years-old, has a mechanic shop in a garage. He lives in an urban zone characterized by informal merchants. Because he needed a job, he had to start working in the same profession as his father. Little by little, working with the help of his father to fix motorcycles, he's been able to support his son. He wakes up early and fixes the electrical parts of the motorcycles. With this loan he wants to buy a machine that cleans fuel injectors. In the future he wants to expand his business and have a workshop that satisfies the needs of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of machine that cleans fuel injectors

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara T. sells soap and is a seamstress at Abura. She is married and lives with her husband who is an electrician. She has been though junior high school. She supports her husband by feeding the home. The loan will be used to purchase more cloth to sew for sale. She anticipates reinvesting her profit back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more cloth to sew for sale

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El Señor Fernando V. C. tiene 23 años, el vive en concubinato  y es padre de dos hijos a los cuales ayuda y apoya en su educación, él desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en diferentes actividades, porque fue padre a muy corta edad desde entonces la responsabilidad como padre hizo madurar y trabajar muy temprano, hoy en día el cliente es una persona muy responsable y trata de brindar una mejor vida a su familia, su esposa se dedica  a la venta de empanadas  y refresco, para tener un mejor ingreso y así poder ayudar a su esposo con algunos gastos en su hogar, él trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato “CARRASCO” en la localidad de Ivirgarzama,  donde esta mas de 6 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad y calidad del servicio. El sindicato les otorga paradas y turnos a cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Fernando is 23 years old. He has a spouse and two children that he helps and supports with their education. Since he was young he has worked in many different fields. He was a father at a young age. The responsibility of fatherhood has caused him to mature and go to work at an earlier age. Today he is a responsible person and he tries to provide the best that he can for his family. His wife sells empanadas (filled dough pastries) and sodas. In this way she makes money and is able to help with the household expenses. He works as a motor-taxi driver with the CARRASCO Company. He has worked in Ivirgarzama for the past six years. The service he provides is profitable because of the large quantity of customers that request his convenient and high-quality services. The company awards stops and turnabouts to each affiliate. These are located at different points in the city of Ivigarzama. The stops are located where customers need the taxi service. 
This is the first time that this customer has obtained a loan from our institution. He will use the loan to buy a new motorcycle. He is finished with his current contract. This is a way that he can bring better service to his customers. In this way he can improve his earnings and thus improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: Working capital which will be used to buy a new tool for his work.

loans.name: Kihanga Women's Group

texts.en: G. Bosco is 35 years old and he belongs to the Kihanga Women’s Group. He has been operating his alcohol and food sales businesses in Nyakibale cell in Ntungamo for 12 years. He says he learned from a close friend how to effectively run a business. Bosco is married with 4 children and in a week his business profits average 50,000 UGX. With this loan he plans to purchase more crates of both hard and soft drinks for resale at his small pub.

loans.use: to purchase crates of soft and hard drinks for resale at his pub

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Soung P., 48, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She and her husband make and sell baskets at the local market and are able to make about US$ 5 in profit every day. This couple has four children; two are in school and other two work in construction and in a garment factory. 

Soung P. would like to take out a loan of US$ 600 to purchase more materials like bamboo to make more baskets to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo and materials to make baskets

loans.name: Gardashkhan

texts.ru:
Gardashkhan G. 48 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. Gardashkhan yavlyayetsya IDP personom , on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, Seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 

Gardashkhan uje 8 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji zapchastey, instrumentov  i t.d. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit tovar dlya pereprodaji. Gardashkhan  ochen lubit svoyu rabotu no v dalneyshem on xotel bi otkrit i masterskuyu.
texts.en: Gardashkhan G. is forty-eight years old. He's married and has two children who attend school. Gardashkhan used to live in Fuzuli City, but has moved into the Fuzuli region, where he now lives with his family. For eight years, Gardashkhan has owned a store, specializing in the sale of spare parts, various tools, etc. He's asking for a loan of 2000 AZN in order to acquire some new products for resale. Gardashkhan enjoys his work and plans to add a workshop to his store in the future.

loans.use: To buy goods for resale

loans.name: Hezekiel Kibunja

texts.en:
Hezekiel is 35 years old and married to Ruth Wangui, who contributes towards the family income. They have three children. He has been running a horticulture farm for a period of 5 years, with an income of about 3,000 KES per month. 

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he wants to use it to buy fertilizer and manure for his farm in order to increase productivity. He hopes to be a leading farmer and give his children a quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and manure

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHIKON”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Erika; ella tiene 29 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia es ama de casa se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y de su casa siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento pero ella espera poder buscar  un buen trabajo más adelante y así poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.   

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su familia.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Erika is a member of the "CHIKON” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Erika is 29 years old.  She lives with her partner and has two children.  Erika is a housewife who looks after her children and her home.  This is the only activity that she carries out at the moment but she hopes to be able to look for a good job in the future and thereby provide her family with a better quality of life.

Erika is requesting this loan to buy essentials for her family.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy essentials for her family

loans.name: Orifkhuja

texts.en:
Orifkhuja is married and has two children. He manufactures wooden objects by hand. He has been in this business for 6 years. Orifkhuja enjoys making objects out of wood and customers recognize his craftsmanship. They order many different things from Orifkhuja. He has very few competitors. This allows his business to be unique and very profitable. 

Orifkhuja would like to receive $3000 USD to purchase materials in bulk for his business. Orifkhuja's work not only gives him and his customers joy but allows him to take good care of his family.   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase materials in bulk for woodwork business

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Махмедова Гуландом жительница района Вахдат. Ей 44 года. Она замужем, имеет 5 детей. Образование-среднее. Более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Она в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для увеличения количества скота.
texts.en: Gulandom M. lives in the Vahdat district.  She is 44 years old, married and has 5 children.  She has a secondary education.  Gulandom has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years.  She primarily feeds up and sells livestock.  She is requesting this loan in order to increase the quantity of livestock.

loans.use: Increasing quantity of livestock

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita D. is from the village of Villaluz, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 56 years old. Angelita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Angelita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Angelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase hog feed and other supplies. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional piglets to raise. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Angelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Nzuga

texts.en:
Nzuga M. is a married man with five children, four of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

He has operated a goat meat business for the past three years, selling wholesale to butcher shop operators and neighbors. 

Nzuga's major challenges are the high cost of transportation and delayed payments by those who purchase on credit. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his living standards. With the KES 20,000, he wants to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.use: To purchase goats

loans.name: Kanoni Tweyambe Group B-Kihihi

texts.en: Marble M., 28 years old,  has been in the retail business for 6 years, operating out of the Kanoni Trading Center-Kihihi. The happily married mother of 6 sells a variety of general merchandise items which are in high favor with many people around the area. Marble also farms, harvesting some of the crops she grows such as beans and cassava, which she sells to supplement her profits. She says that hard work is what has kept her business afloat in an increasingly competitive business genre. Her business generates 160,000 UGX weekly.  Marble plans to use this loan to purchase more general merchandise items to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more general merchandise items

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.en:
Ikrom has a successful small business selling spare parts for cars. From his little kiosk, Ikrom sells an assortment of good quality items. His business, which he has operated for about six years, provides the main source of income for him, his wife and their five children. In the future, Ikrom hopes to expand by opening a second sales location.

Ikrom has requested a loan of 10,000 TJS to add to his working capital and allow him to purchase more inventory. We are happy for this opportunity to provide the means for Ikrom to continue developing his business. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to increase the range of goods he sells

loans.name: Kazita

texts.en:
Kazita, a 39-year-old mother of three, is from the northern village of Reineh.  She began working in insurance sales while she was still studying for her degree. In March she opened her insurance office and serves clients from her village and the surrounding area. There are no other insurance offices in her village so her client base is growing steadily.

Kazita needed this loan to purchase office equipment, a computer, a printer-fax-scanner & furniture.

In the future Kazita wants to continue to expand and bring on additional sales staff and create a thriving, profitable insurance company.

loans.use: Purchase office equipment, a computer, a printer-fax-scanner & furniture.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic P., age 24, has been engaged in rice farming for 20 years. This business earns 15,000 PHP per month. Marivic is married and lives with her family in Bunawan, Agusan del Sur. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. 

In the future, Marivic hopes to improve her business and to earn a bigger income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es: El señor Luciano es agricultor y también vende quesos en la feria de Achacachi. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una vaca lechera, así podrá aumentar la producción y elaboración de quesos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Suñasivi del departamento de La Paz; es casado, no tiene  hijos. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Luciano is an agriculturist and he also sells cheeses at the fair in Achacachi. He needs the loan to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase cheese production. He lives in a house which he owns and it is located in the community of Sunasivi in the department of La Paz. He is married and he has no children. This is his first loan with IMPRO (Kiva Field Partner) and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to increase cheese production.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 42-year-old married man with seven children living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is the sole provider for the family and his dream is to set up a farm. For two years he has been operating a retail shop and this has helped him provide the basics for his family. He started with 100,000 shillings and currently he has working capital of 2,500,000 shillings. He has the challenge of irregular sales due to inflation. His desire is to become a wholesale trader. John needs this loan to buy maize, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Katy Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Katy es socia del banco comunal Ricardo Palma, del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Su esposo es músico en una orquesta de la ciudad, recién lleva dos años trabajando con los  préstamos de Manuela Ramos, tiene una bodega que funciona en su propia casa y puede trabajar sin descuidar a sus hijos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 comprará: 1 caja de conservas, 1 caja de leche, 1 caja de aceite, 1 caja de condimentos, 2 kilos de ají especial,  1 paquete de ajino moto, 1 caja de galletas, 1 bolsa de orégano, 1 bolsa de detergente, 1 bolsa de legía.
Espera que más adelante Manuela Ramos pueda darle un mayor crédito para poder abastecer mejor su negocio, de esta forma puede generar ingresos que le permita apoyar en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Katy is a member of the Ricardo Palma communal bank, in the district of Yarinacocha, Ucayali department. She is 21 years old, married, and has 1 son.

Her husband is a musician in an orchestra of the city. Katy has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Katy has a general store that operates from her own house where she can work without neglecting her child.

With this new loan of 1,500 new sols Katy will buy: 1 case of conserves, 1 case of milk, 1 case of cooking oil, 1 case of condiments, 2 kilos of special garlic, 1 package of ajino moto, 1 case of cookies, 1 sack of oregano, 1 sack of detergent, and 1 bag of legia.

Katy hopes that later, Manuela Ramos may provide a major loan so that she can better supply her business, and in this manner, generate income that will permit her to boost the household economy.

loans.use: buy groceries: preserves, cookies, detergent, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Etasnislado

texts.es: El señor Miguel, es un pequeño agricultor de la zona de San Ignacio, los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Miguel desde hace treinta años se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es no poder contar con un capital suficiente para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios que requiere la plantación , ya que actualmente tienen mal color , el tamaño no es normal , hasta puede llegar  a la pérdida total de producto .Agradece Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva el apoyo que le brinda a los agricultores de las zonas rurales para que puedan darle un mejor mantenimiento agrícola.
texts.en: Miguel is a small-scale farmer in the San Ignacio area.  He plans to improve his family's living conditions.  Miguel has been a pineapple farmer for 30 years.  The main obstacle he faces is not having enough capital to buy fertilizers and the supplies he needs for his crops, which currently have a poor color and an abnormal size, and may even end up a total loss.  He is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for the support that they are providing to the farmers in the rural area so that they can better maintain their crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a 52-year-old married woman living in the Philippines. She has three children. Carolina's spouse works as a driver in their community. 

Carolina is engaged in a business of raising chickens for sale and she offers dressed chickens too. She has been in the business for over 20 years and she earns approximately PHP 3,000 monthly.

Carolina is requesting for a loan of PHP 7,000. She plans to use this loan to have additional revolving capital to purchase feed for the chickens.

In the future, Carolina would like to strengthen her business in order to provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for chickens.

loans.name: Saddam

texts.en: Saddam, 20 years old and single, lives in the Philippines where he has had a shop that sells t-shirts, blouses, shoes and sandals for four years. A  member of HSPFI since 2009, he is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of clothing and shoes.  In the future, Saddam hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Elena; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno de cultivo que queda en la provincia de Anta distrito de Mollepata que está situado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco, ella siembra manzanas y frejoles y luego los vende al por mayor en los diferentes mercados, la socia por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, fertilizantes y también para pagar la movilidad de traslado de los productos de manzanas y frejoles para la ciudad de Cusco.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "SANTO DOMINGO".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco, and department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Maria Elena, she is 42 years old and married with 2 children.  The member combines her daily activities with the business of agriculture; she has farmland in the province of Anta, in the district of Mollepata, which is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.  She grows apples and beans, and then sells them at wholesale in different markets.  By means of this business, the member is moving her children forward in life.

The member wants to expand and improve her agriculture business. The member is requesting the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and also to pay for transporting the products of apples and beans to the city of Cusco.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with the repayments of her share.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers, and also to pay for transporting the products of apples and beans to the city of Cusco.

loans.name: Frecia

texts.en:
Frecia has practiced farming in the Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. She is 34 years old and is married to Moses, and they have three children who attend school.  

Frecia was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow. In the future, she hopes to become a leading farmer in the town of Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 28 years old and is married with one child who is 2 years old. Her business of selling curtains is well-organized and well-known. Her business hours are from 8am until 7pm every day except on the weekend. She has four years of experience and currently employs one person to help her. 

Jeannette has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more curtains for sale. With any profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more curtains for sale

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 45 years old and engaged in buying and selling of bananas. She was blessed with four children, and to provide for their needs, especially educational needs, requires finance. Hence Carolina is working hard to earn enough money to sustain their needs.

She dreams to expand and maximize her business through asking for a loan amount of P5,000 to buy additional bananas, avocados and pineapples to sell. This could increase her net sales and allow her to be able to save for the future of her beloved children. She hopes to finish their education in order for them to acquire a better living and not to suffer forever from poverty.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas, avocados and pineapples to sell

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: El señor Cesar, nacido en la población de el torno hace 20 años, es soltero, el destino del crédito es  para   la siembra de yuca y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, actualmente vive en  casa de su padre en el torno, pero con el crédito se ira a su parcela ubicado en la comunidad de Alto Villa Barrientos,  a 20 km. De Santa Rita para trabajar la tierra y poder subsistir de la venta de sus productos que lo comercializa directamente del productor al consumidor, con el fruto de sus ganancias desea comprarse una moto para poder movilizarse de un lugar a otro, después de cumplir con sus obligaciones. En sus tiempos libres juega al futbol y es fanático de blooming un equipo de la ciudad de Santa Cruz.
texts.en:
Señor Cesar was born in the village of El Torno twenty years ago. He is single. He plans to use the loan money to buy yucca seed and agricultural supplies. 

Cesar lives in his father's house in El Torno, but once he has the loan he will move to his land in the community of Alto Villa Barrientos, 20 km away from Santa Rita so that he can work the land. He will be able to live on the money he earns from the sale of the produce. He will sell the yucca directly to the consumer. 

After he has paid off the loan, Cesar wishes to buy a motorbike with the profits so he can move easily from one location to another. In his free time he plays football and is a fan of Blooming, a team from the town of Santa Cruz.

loans.use: to buy yucca seed and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Clarita works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling of jewelry. 

Clarita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional linens, threads and other materials for her tailoring business.

Clarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy additional linens, threads and other materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban tiene 39 años, está casado, tiene dos hijos, los cuales aun son pequeños y dependen de el y de su señora, vive en casa propia con su esposa Epifania. Es carpintero, comenta que aprendió el oficio de su padre con quien trabajó por más de 10 años.
Tiene su propia carpintería sobre una ruta muy transitada, camino a Quiindy desde hace mas de 5 años. Decidió dedicarse al rubro ya que cuenta con una experiencia en el ámbito y a esta le acompaña la necesidad de dar ingreso a su familia. Es un hombre trabajador, honesto y responsable. Los vecinos le tienen un aprecio por los valores mencionados.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de maderas, tablas y otros para seguir activando su carpinteria.
texts.en:
Esteban, 39, is married and has two children who are still little and depend on him and his wife.  He lives in his own house with his wife, Epifania.  He’s a carpenter.  He comments that he learned the occupation form his father who he worked with for over ten years.

He has had his own carpentry shop located on a very busy route, the road to Quiindy, for over five years.  He decided to go into this line of work because he had experience in the area and he needed to provide family income.  He’s a hardworking, honest and responsible man.  His neighbors hold him in high regard because of the aforementioned values.  He needs the loan to buy wood, lumber and others to continue stocking his carpentry shop.

loans.use: to buy wood and lumber.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is married and has five children, three of whom attend school.  She sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for 12 years.  

Valentine is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more beans, bananas, and cassava flour to sell. The profits from this business will be saved so that Valentine can build her own house. In the future, she would like to have a motorbike as another source of income

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: 03.10.112.thiệu Chính Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hợp, 35, is married with two children. She works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle and has been involved in this business for seven years. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.
