Hợp is the group leader of the 03.10.112.Thiệu Chính solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. In 2010, Hợp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and she has successfully repaid two loans.

The main hardships Hợp faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts. With her business profit, she hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her children, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is married with 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nerissa is 32 years old and has 1 child in school.

Nerissa has a Barber Shop in the Philippines. Nerissa requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her barber shop.

Nerissa has been in this business for 4 years.  In the future, Nerissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her barber shop

loans.name: Shirheeregvaa

texts.en: Shirheeregvaa is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and his two kids are school students. He started his deel (Mongolian traditional clothes) sewing business in 2008.  His deels are very stylish and of high quality.  Shirheeregvaa provides customized service and is a trusted supplier to many. Now that winter is approaching, the demand for his products are increasing.   Therefore, he is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy raw materials.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is engaged in agriculture. Edgar would like to develop beekeeping, for which he needs some financial investments. With the loan's help Edgar will get more honey from beehives. He can then sell the honey and get additional income. The latter is vital for Edgar and his family. Edgar lives with his wife and children in a very small flat. As the children are growing up, it is becoming necessary to expand the house. This loan will help Edgar to insure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for beehives

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Analyn has a barber shop that provides haircutting and styling services with her husband as the master barber. She has run this business for three years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy materials for her barber shop.
Analyn is a new member of Kiva partner HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her barber shop.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 33 years old, married to Jacinta and they have two children.  He has been operating a curio shop selling soapstone carvings from Kisii for the last two years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 16,000.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET Ltd of KES 40,000.  He will use the funds to buy more soap stone carvings for sale.  He paid his previous loan back well and in good time.  He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.  With anticipated profits he will educate his children.

His hopes are to expand his business and open up another curio shop outlet.

loans.use: to buy soapstone carvings from Kisii for sale.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en: Hasmik lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Kaps.  She is married with three children – a 26-year-old daughter and two sons (14 and 24).  She has a high school education and has been farming for the past 20 years.  She dreams of renovating the family home.  She would like a loan to purchase livestock and feed.  She expects this investment to increase the family income by 20%.  She is pleased with the services of microfinance.  She is keeping her debt to less than 40% of her equity in the business.

loans.use: to purchase seed and livestock

loans.name: Buena Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Maria Angelica, ella es soltera, tiene 33 años de edad y tiene 02 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de desayunos como kinua con manazanas,leche,maca entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia. 
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de kinua,azucar,leche netre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican a la venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, guía de turismo, crianza de animales, artesanía, preparación de bocaditos, tienda de abarrotes, venta de productos de belleza.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y salud.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank “Buena Esperanza” (Good Hope). It is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Maria Angelica is 33 years old and single. She has two children. The member alternates her daily activities with her breakfast sale business, which includes quinoa with apple, milk, and maca root, among others. She has had this business for quite some time, and she does well as a result of the effort that she puts forth every day. The member is a responsible and diligent person, and this is the way that she moves her family forward. She is requesting a loan to buy quinoa, sugar, and milk, among other things.

The other members make a living selling clothing, selling cosmetics, acting as tour guides, raising animals, making handicrafts, preparing snacks, managing a grocery store, and selling beauty products. The members that appear in the attached photos asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting for work and health reasons.

Maria Angelica gives thanks to those who are part of her dream through this loan, and she promises to make her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy quinoa, sugar, and milk, among other things.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.fr: Nadia a 27 ans. Elle vit en union libre et mère de deux enfants. Son activité est une boutique de boissons gazeuses.  C’est grâce aux revenus de cette activité qu’elle arrive à nourrir sa famille et payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock de boissons gazeuses.

loans.use: augmenter son stock de boissons gazeuses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his dressmaking business.

loans.name: Bedah

texts.en: B. is 42 years old and married with three children aged 16, 14 and 12. She has been running her business for 4 years. She sells vegetables and fried snacks in a small shop. She once had to close her business due to a shortage of capital. After being a member of MBK, she has the chance to re-open her shop. Some of the loan will be used to buy electrical tools since her husband provides electrical and pump services. Since her husband, Marsin, has an unfixed income, the shop is the only livelihood for them.

loans.use: Small Kiosk

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is married and has three children, who are 8, 10, and 13 years old. Her husband works in a business, but the salary he receives is not enough to cover the family’s expenses for their household and for the education of their children. Faced with the need to have extra income, Araceli began her own business selling chemical products one year ago. She started out by selling popular cleaning products, and little by little, she incorporated other products, as well. She sells her products from her house, in the town of Monclava, in CoahuiL..

Araceli works hard every day so that she can offer a better life to her children. Now she needs a loan of $200.00, which she will use to buy merchandise so she can offer a wider variety of products and thereby increase her sales. She promises to pay back the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months. Your help will be of great assistance in the development of this business. Araceli and her family thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Araceli es casada y tiene tres hijos D. 8, 10 y 13 años D. edad. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa, sin embargo, el salario que recibe es insuficiente para solventar todos los gastos D. su hogar y L. educación D. sus hijos. Ante L. necesidad D. obtener un ingreso extra Araceli inició su negocio vendiendo productos químicos hace un año, empezó comercializando sólo dos productos D. limpieza, los D. mayor demanda, y poco a poco fue incorporando L. venta D. otros productos, realiza sus ventas en su propio domicilio en L. localidad D. Monclava, CoahuiL. .

Araceli es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza cada día por ofrecerle a sus hijos un mayor bienestar, ahora elL. necesita un préstamo D. $ 200 dólares que utilizará en L. compra D. mercancía para ofrecer una mayor variedad e incrementar sus ventas, elL. se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso D. 3 a 6 mese. Tu ayuda será D. gran utilidad para el desarrollo D. este negocio, Araceli y su familia te agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru:
Malohat is married with 5 children. She sells sunflower seeds, cigarettes and other retail goods at the Central Bus Station in Isfara town. Her oldest daughter helps her out with the sales. Malohat's husband still works for a collective farm, but his salary is way to low to support the family. The profits from Malohat's small business help with many family needs. The oldest daughter is going to get married and the parents want one of their sons to get married too. They are saving part of the profits for the weddings. Previously Malohat took out a loan from Microinvest and used it to buy more goods for sale. She is requesting another loan to expand her business and improve her work place (to buy a market umbrella).

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer.

Малохат замужем и у нее 5 детей. она торгует мелкими товарами и семечками на центральном автовокзале г. Исфары. Ей помогает ее старшая дочь. Ее муж работает в колхозе, но зарабатывает очень маленькую зарплату. На жизнь ее естественно не хватает. Малохат приходится выходить торговать. Это приносит доход, на который живет семья. Ее старшая дочь должна выйти замуж, а сына она собирается женить. Для этого нужны деньги. Часть прибыли от торговли она откладывает на свадьбу. Чтобы получить дополнительную прибыль она получила займ в Микроинвест. На полученный займ она закупила семечки и сигареты. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ и дальше расширить свой бизнес и улучшить условия своего торгового места (приобрести зонт для защиты от солнца).

loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in raw materials such as wood and paint

loans.name: Raina

texts.en: Raina K. is married and works together with her husband. They have a farm on which they breed hens and geese. Their two kids are students. Raina will spend this $750 loan on stock and corn.

loans.use: Purchasing stock and corn

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon M., 48, and her husband have been married for fifteen years. They have seven children. Five of them are studying, and the other two weave silk at home. Phon’s family lives on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Phon has been a weaver since she was 30 years old. It's a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband cannot work because of an illness. Phon hopes to continue to grow her weaving business so that she can support her children’s studies to the highest possible level.

Phon is requesting her second loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $150. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Thi Minh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Minh, 33 years old, and her husband have 2 children. She sells mobile phones, eye glasses and watches. She’s been in this business for 10 years now. She was referred to the Binh Minh by a friend. She likes it because its procedures are simple, its people are friendly. Her activities with the fund is not just taking out loans, she has a saving account too. She needs a loan to buy more goods.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Minh, 33 tuổi, có 2 con. Hai vợ chồng chị kinh doanh điện thoại di dộng và kính, đồng hồ các loại. Chị kinh doanh đã được trên 10 năm. Vốn đầu tư cho cửa hàng khá lớn nên chị cũng vay vốn của hội doanh nghiệp trẻ và chị cũng là thành viên của hội. Chị tham gia vay nguồn vốn của Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh do được người bạn giới thiệu. Chị thích vay của chương trình vì thủ tục đơn giản, lại được hướng dẫn tư vấn tận tình của các cán bộ tín dụng. Chị vay về đầu tư mua thêm một số kiểu kính mới. Chị không những vay vốn mà còn gửi tiết kiệm mặc dù không lớn nhưng chị có thể sử dụng khi cần.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana lives in the community of San Caralampio, in the municipality of Ticuantepe. It is a mountainous rural area that has a cool climate that is good for producing citrus crops. The land is fertile and good for pineapple, and other conditions of area are also favorable for it production. It was 30 years ago that Juana decided to start cultivating pineapple and citrus crops, such as tangerines, oranges, and limes.

She and her husband both work the land and through the years they have been perfecting their techniques for the cultivation of these crops. Now Juana is requesting a loan to invest in maintaining her plants and trees. She needs to buy fertilizer and soil amendments to improve her harvest and also insecticides and fungicides to prevent problems with insects and fungi that could damage the plants.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana habita en la comunidad de San Caralampio, municipio de Ticuantepe, zona rural, montañosa que presenta clima fresco para producir cítricos, con tierras fértiles para el cultivo de piña, debido a las condiciones favorables que presenta esa zona, la señora hace 30 años decide incursionar en la producción de piña y cítricos como mandarina, naranja y limones. La señora junto a su esposo trabajan las tierras y con los años han ido perfeccionado la técnica de producción de los cultivos. En estos momentos, la señora solicita un préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de los mismos, ya que necesita comprar fertilizantes y nutrientes que favorezcan la cosecha así como insecticidas para evitar el contagio de las plagas o hongos que puedan dañar toda la cosecha.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other soil amendments to improve the soil

loans.name: Mpigi Loan Group

texts.en:
The Mpigi Loan Group has been together for six years and comprises 20 men and women who each have businesses in the area. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, who will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Benna M., the group representative, is seeking a loan to purchase raw materials in order to increase her cake sales. Benna has been baking cakes and selling them at her shop in Tugamo market for 20 years. During this time, she has expanded her business from selling cakes by the slice to making special cakes to order for weddings and other functions. She has also improved her cake shop with the recent addition of a refrigerator and more serving platters. Next, Benna hopes to buy a new cooker and then eventually a warmer and a deep fryer.

Benna is 50 years old and is the sole support of four children, ranging in age from three to 21 years. They all live with her at home and still attend school.

loans.use: Benna Mantale, the group representative, is seeking a loan to purchase raw materials for her bakery.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy belongs to the “Carmen Cabrejos” communal bank, which is located in the district of Calleria, in the deparment of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and is the mother of 4 children, but her earnings are not sufficient to cover the family expenses. With the first S/. 300.00 loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, Nancy decided to invest in a business of buying and selling various merchandise.

She rises at 7:00am to prepare breakfast for her children and her husband. She then sells her merchandise until 6:00pm.

With this loan of S/. 1300.00, which will be paid back in 5 months, she will buy: clothing for women, men, and children, rings, bracelets, earrings, purses, wallets, handkerchiefs, shoes, etc.

Nancy is very happy because she is helping her family to get ahead, as a result of her own hard work and perseverance. This allows her to help her children with their studies and she is very proud of herself because she is able to help out with the family expenses. She is very grateful for the support that Manuela Ramos provides to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nancy pertenece al Banco Comunal Carmen Cabrejos, ubicado en el Jr Cahuide No 528, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años,es madre de 4 hijos, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no le alcanza para los gastos familiares. Nancy con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de compra y venta de mercadería. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de mercadería, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la venta de su mercadería hasta las 6 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1300, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: ropas para damas caballeros y niños, sortijas, pulseras, aretes, carteras, billeteras, pañuelos, zapatos, etc. Nancy esta muy feliz, por que esta sacando a delante a su familia a base de esfuerzo y perseverancia y esto le permite ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios pues también esta muy orgullosa de si misma y también puede aportar en su hogar y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra has been selling shirts, pants, and shoes for more than three years to supplement her family’s income. Her husband works as a mechanic, and the couple has four daughters ranging from six to fifteen years old, all of whom go to school.

It is Petra’s ambition that her children can become professionals, and independent and important people in the society, so she swears that she’ll keep working hard so that she can reach that goal.

With her loan, this entrepreneur will buy a greater variety of goods to add her to her stock to increase her sales volume and attract new clients.

loans.use: To buy shoes and pants to replenish her small clothing business

loans.name: Mahmudjon

texts.en:
Mahmudjon has worked at his small shoe shop located in the main bazaar of the city of Isfara for the past 15 years. Before the fall of the Soviet Union, Mahmudjon worked as a driver for 27 years but, like many in Tajikistan, had to abandon his chosen line of work during the difficult financial times that befell this small Central Asian nation beginning in the 1990s.

Twice a week, Mahmudjon makes the two-hour trip to the city of Istaravshan where his wholesale suppliers are located. There he buys 120-160 pairs of shoes at a time for around 1200 somoni ($350), which yields him a monthly income of at least 400 somoni ($115). Mahmudjon has a wife, who works at a school for the blind, and five children. His youngest son helps him at his shoe store on the days he is not in school. In addition to shoes, Mahmudjon also sells a small assortment of clothing and hopes, with his Kiva loan, to be able to expand his stock and variety of these items.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Phem

texts.en:
Mr. Phem M., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Savorn Chea, who live along National Road Number One about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1981 and have five children, four sons and one daughter.

Mr. Phem has been a wooden-house builder since 1981, while his wife has been a garment factory worker since 2006. The couple needs some money to build a restroom for the family's use. So Phem is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to build a restroom for his family.

loans.use: To build a restroom

loans.name: Phum

texts.en:
Mrs. Phum C. is 27-years-old and lives in Kanthorm Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Mean Prok, is a palm juice collector who gathers palm juice to process into palm sugar and palm wine.

Since inflation in Cambodia is increasing, Mrs. Phum C. wants to start another business in order to meet the family's financial needs. She is requesting a loan to buy piglets to start a pig breeding business. The rest of the money will be used to buy fertilizer for her field. Mrs. Phum C. and her husband are shown in the picture with their daughter.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a pig breeding business and to buy fertilizer for the crop fields.

loans.name: Lorenza Maria

texts.es:
Lorenza, de 40 años de edad, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen De Asunción de Carhuaz”, le gustaría comprar chacras y sembrar maíz en grandes cantidades para poder distribuir a los mayoristas que llevan el choclo a la capital.  

Lorenza es conviviente y tiene seis hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos depende de ella ya que los otros se han ido de su casa, son independientes y tienen sus propias familias.
 
Lorenza se dedica a la venta de verduras, que con ayuda de sus tres menores hijos, trata de sacar adelante el negocio, el cual se encuentra ubicado en las puertas del mercado modelo de Carhuaz. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará choclo de la chacra y lo venderá al por mayor, ya que con 12 años de experiencia ella tiene clientes fijos.
texts.en:
Lorenza is 40 years old, and is a member of the "Virgen De Asunción de Carhuaz" Communal Bank. She would like to buy a farm and plant maize in large quantities to distribute to wholesalers who take the corn to the capital. Lorenza lives with her partner and has six children, 3 of whom depend on her support; the others have left home, are independent and have their own families. Located at the front of the Carhuaz market, Lorenza sells vegetables with the help of her three younger children while trying to advance the business. The loan of S/. 1,000 that she will pay in 6 months, it will buy corn that she will then sell at wholesale; with 12 years of experience she has many regular customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn from farms

loans.name: Todjidin

texts.ru: Раджабов Тоджидин проживает в городе Яван. Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того уже 8 лет зарабатывает на жизнь ведением бизнеса. Торгует на рынке промышленными товарами . Бизнес приносит неплохой доход , который позволяет ему использовать доход только на то , чтобы прокормить семью. Теперь он планирует расширить дело и увеличить товарооборот. Поэтому он решил получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Тоджидин имеет очень большую семью. Он женат и имеет шестерых детей. Все они живут дружно и весело.
texts.en:
Todjidin R. lives in Yavan and works as a teacher at a secondary school. Besides this, he has been earning a living in a private enterprise for the past 8 years. He sells industrial products at a market. The business brings in a decent profit that allows Todjidin to support his family. He is now planning to expand his business and increase turnover. This is why he decided to obtain a 12-month loan. Todjidin has a very big and happy family. He is married and has six children.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: Demetria,  vive en el  Centro Poblado Poccona, del Distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno, es casada, tiene 58 años D. edad, madre D. 05 hijos (con familia) estudio  solo segundo grado D. primaria.nnElla es socia del Banco Comunal “Candelaria” hace 06 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 con el que compro  habas (menestras) para poder tostar, negocio que inicio cuando accedió al crédito, nos dice que no pudo estudiar porque sus padres no contaban con medios económicos suficientes, Demetria trabaja junto a su esposo en el tostado D. habas para luego vender su producto en el Mercado 15 D. Agosto D. Yunguyo. Con el préstamo que solicitara D. S/.2000.00 nuevos soles y que pagara en 04 cuotas    comprara 10 arrobas D. habas en  Yunguyo  y continuar con su negocio.nnSu deseo es tener una tienda para poder vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Demetria lives in the center of Poccona, in the Yunguyo district of the Yunguyo-Puno province. She is married, 58 years old, the mother of five children (who have families), and studied only to the second graD. of primary school. She has been a member of the communal bank El Candelariau for six years. Her first loan was for 300.00 soles, with which she purchased beans to toast. She started the business when she gained access to the credit. She tells us that she wasn’t able to further her studies because her parents did not have sufficient economic means for her to continue. Demetria works together with her husband in the toasting of beans, to later sell their product at the “15th of August” market in Yunguyo. With the loan of 2,000.00 soles that she is requesting and will repay in 3 installments, she will buy 10 arrobas (unit of weight, about 14 kg) of beans in Yunguyo and continue with her business. Her wish is to have a store to be able to sell her goods at wholesale.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beans at wholesale.

loans.name: Enma Del Rocio

texts.es:
La Señora Enma del Rocío es una socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Creativas”, vive en la región  San Martín, provincia y distrito de Moyabamba. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa,  lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes que son mayormente los vecinos de su  barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes y otros productos de mayor salida para surtir bien el negocio y que sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan. 

 Enma del Rocío tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 04 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Ya tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal y está agradecida con el apoyo brindado por Manuela Ramos, el cual le permite crecer en su negocio, tanto a ella como también a las demás mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Enma del Rocío is a member of the Mujeres Creativas (Creative Women) Village Bank and lives in the San Martín region, in the district and provice of Moyabamba. She earns her living selling groceries. Her business is located in her home, where her customers, mainly neighbors from her village, shop daily. With her loan of 1,700 Soles, which she will repay in 6 months, Enma de Rocío will purchase basic grocery products such as rice, sugar, milk, oils, a variety of canned goods, toilet paper, and other popular products required to stock her business so her customers can find what they need. Enma de Rocío is 34-years-old, and lives with her husband, as well as her 4 children, who are still dependent on her. She has been working with the Village Bank for 4 years. She is very appreciative of the support she gets from Manuela Ramos, which allows her, and the other hard-working women in her lending group, to grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, milk, oils, canned goods, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Mani Dalair Khan Group

texts.en:
My name is Mani and I reside in a city named Vehari, Pakistan.  I have six members in my family.  I have been living in this city for the past 25 years. 

I am an uneducated woman, but my parents made me a skillful woman who can fight and make herself stable in every circumstance.  I am proud of my parents.  

My husband has a quilt selling business.  It’s a high demand business in Vehari city.  I make warm quilts at home and my husband sells them in different shops and markets and earns profit.  My sons are enrolled in a local school to get an education.  I am applying for a loan to buy materials (cloth, cotton and thread) for making more quilts to resell. 

I am a group leader of a few more women in my locality.  Sumera Baji and Zareena Baji each want a loan to buy sewing machines for sewing clothes.  Farzana Baji and Shakeela Baji each want a loan to buy quilts to resell. 

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for making warm quilts

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Wilfredo Antonio O. S. tiene la edad de 46 años, su estado civil es casado, Don Wilfredo tiene 2 hijos  a su cargo sus edades son las siguientes el hijo mayor de 22 años y cursa el 3 año de su carrera y su hijo menor de 20 años cursa el 1 año de su carrera, su compañera de vida trabaja de domestica y su salario es muy bajo, sus propósitos son de aumentar su clientela para expandirse en su negocio y darse a conocer en otros lugares por su magnifica forma de laborar y su cumplimiento con cada compromiso de trabajo sus deseos es que sus hijos terminen la carrera para que sean profesionales reconocidos en la ciudad y en todo el país los sueños de Don Wilfredo es llegar a poseer un taller que este acondicionado con las herramientas necesaria para realizar mas actividades que se pueden trabajar en el enderezado y pintura, pero que el por falta de ciertas herramientas no se compromete en efectuar ciertos trabajos.

La actividad económica de Don Wilfredo es el servicio de enderezado y pintura, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio de 8 años, Don Wilfredo inicia este negocio por que su hermano fue quien le dio la oportunidad de que trabajara con el en este tipo de negocio y mas tarde decide establecer el su propio negocio y es así como decide establecer su negocio  de forma ambulante por que no tenia los medios completos para realizar todos los procedimientos en su casa de habitación ya que es muy pequeña y con la ayuda de su hermano quien le facilitaba los medios para realizar los trabajos pero mas tarde decide comprar sus herramientas y al paso del tiempo se fue dando a conocer por la calidad de su trabajo ya que tenia muchas amistades que requerían de sus servicios y fue así que logro obtener su propia clientela y su propio negocio por lo que ahora necesita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de pinturas, varillas para soldar repuestos de sus herramientas y la compra de herramientas nuevas y todo esto lo realiza en Managua ya que el conoce ciertos lugares donde le resulta mas favorable.
texts.en:
Mr. Wilfredo Antonio O. S. is 46 years old, married, and has two children in his care. His eldest son is 22 years old and is in the 3rd year of his studies, while his youngest son is 20 years old and is in the 1st year of his studies. His life partner works as a housekeeper and earns a very low salary. Her goals are to increase the number of her clients so that she may expand her business, and to be known in other places for her superb work and fulfillment of every work commitment. Her hope is that her sons finish their studies so that they become professionals recognized in their city and in the whole country. Wilfredo’s dream is to be able to own an air conditioned shop with the necessary tools to be able to complete more work in the body shop trade, however, because of a lack of the certain tools he does not commit himself to carry out certain jobs. Wilfredo’s economic undertaking is a body shop service. His business is located on the road, and he has owned his business for the past 8 years. Wilfredo got started in this business because his brother gave him the opportunity to work with him and later he decided to establish his own business. He began his business in a on the road fashion because he did not have the means to carry out all his work in the house in which he lives because it is too small. His brother aided him and facilitated the means by which he could complete his jobs. Later Wilfredo decided to purchase his own tools and as time passed he was recognized for the quality of his work given that he has many friends that require his services. In this way he was able to acquire his own clients and his own business for which he now needs a loan for work capital given that he needs to purchase paints, bars to weld tools repairs, and new tools. He will carry out all these tasks in Managua since he knows certain places that will give him the best results.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital to purchase paints, tool repairs, and new tools.

loans.name: Oniyo

texts.en: Oniyo sells motor spare parts. He has been in this business for a long time. He needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. Oniyo is a hard working man. He is 32 years old and married with 2 children. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Chuop

texts.en:
S. is 33 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has four children, all of whom are students. She is married to Saveoun, 31, who owns a tourist car for public transportation. He has a net income of $7 per day.

S. has been producing traditional cupcakes for more than two years. She has earned a lot of clients because she is good at making traditional cupcakes. With her experience and good management of sales, she wants to increase her income. She wants to have a better and bigger house as her business is now spreading to the whole commune.

Recently, S. is looking for a loan to buy more equipment and powder stock for her cupcake stall. She dreams of having a degree for her children.

loans.use: To buy more equipment and powder stock for her cupcake stall

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.ru: Фазилат 50 лет, она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Фазилат предприниматель и занимается куплей продажей детской одежды и обуви на разных рынках. Опыт Фазилат в этой деятельности уже несколько лет, но до этого она не получала займы. Так как весна наступила, и многие виды одежды зимние, то Фазилат хочет обновить весенний ассортимент. Сейчас она собирается получить займ чтобы расширить свой бизнес и погасит в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Fazilat is 50 years old, she is married and has 3 children. Fazilat is an entrepreneur and purchases and sells children’s clothing and shoes at different markets. Fazilat already has several years of experience in this area, but has not taken out a loan until now. Since spring has started and a wide variety of clothing is for the winter, Fazilat would like to update her spring assortment. Right now she plans to take out a loan to expand her business and to pay it back over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand spring clothing inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a bajaji for her transportation business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 54 years old and married with four children. She sells drinks and juice. Theresa is an active LAPO client. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 140,000 (USD 975) to purchase more drinks and juice to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Турдикулова Матлюба- женжина 25 лет. Замужем имеет одного ребёнка. Она занимается откормом скота более 8 лет. Её свекров ухаживает за её маленьким ребёнком. В свободные время ей помогает муж. У Матлюбы муж работает на стройке. На полученный займ  хочет купить овец и козы. Матлюба очень признателен нашей организации хочет в дальнейшем развиваться.
texts.en:
Matluba T. is 25 years old, married and has one child. She has been involved in livestock feeding for over 8 years. Her father-in-law looks after her young child. Matluba’s husband helps her with the business during his free time. He works as a construction worker. Matluba wants to use this loan to purchase sheep and goats. She is very grateful to our organization and wants to further grow her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Celia Lucrecia

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Queñuani, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 32 años edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 05 hijos, todos estudiantes.  Tiene estudios  de secundaria completa y vive en el Barrio Vista Alegre.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que invirtió en la compra de sacos de polietileno (plástico).  

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, que es compra y venta de sacos de polietileno al por mayor, para luego venderlo en las ferias de yunguyo y otras de la zona

Su deseo es comprarse una casita.

A ella le gustan las reuniones, las charlas y los encuentros que organiza Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucrecia M. is a member of the “Virgen del Rosario” Microfinance Institute, located in the Queñuani community, district of Yunguyo, province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is a 32-year-old married mother of 5 school age children. She completed secondary school and lives in the Vista Alegre neighborhood.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 8 years. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN, which she invested in purchasing polyethylene (plastic) sacks. At this time, she needs a 3,000.00 PEN loan so that she can invest in her current business—buying and selling polyethylene sacks in bulk—so that she can then sell them in the markets of Yunguyo and other areas. Her dream is to purchase her own little house.

She likes the meetings and discussions that are organized by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase polyethylene sacks

loans.name: Fernanrdo Francisco

texts.es: El Señor Fernando Francisco R. García tiene 26 años de edad. Es casado y actualmente tiene 2 hijos y estudian. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de ropa usada. La ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio este negocio con capital propio y con ayuda de su esposa, por lo que juntos han tratado de salir adelante, por lo que Don Fernando traslada la mercadería a los lugares que su esposa ofrece los productos y así es como ha logrado obtener clientes. Y financiamiento será invertido en la  compra de ropa como faldas, pantalones, camisas y ropa para niños. Su deseo es de ampliar su negocio, y además brindar una estabilidad económica para su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Fernando Francisco R. García is 26, married, and has two children who go to school. He sells used clothes. His business is located in his house. He has had the business for over five years. He started the business with his own money and help from his wife. Together they have tried to get ahead. Fernando takes the merchandise to the places that his wife sells it. That way they have been able to get customers. The loan is to buy clothes like skirts, pants, shirts, and children’s clothes. His wish is to expand the business and provide economic stability to his wife and children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 48 años, vive con la madre de sus 2 hijos en su casa propia de su pueblo llamado Patay. Sus hijos viven en la ciudad de Lima en la casa de unos familiares por motivos de estudios. Desde hace 28 años viene sembrando papas en sus propias chacras, hace algún tiempo atrás debido a la helada (clima muy frío) y a los bajos precios del mercado tuvo una gran pérdida que no le permitió ni siquiera recuperar sus inversiones. Desde entonces decidió empezar a cultivar también arvejas, las cuales le han resultado muy rentables y de menor inversión, pues siembra en las chacras donde ya han crecido las papas y de no ser así, tiene que abonar constantemente la tierra para lograr frondosidad en sus hojas y que prontamente revienten las vainitas de las arvejas. Jorge ama a sus siembras, cuando viaja a Lima para visitar a sus hijos, extraña mucho sus cultivos, entonces decide regresar para trabajar en sus chacra, puesto que gracias a sus cuidados oportunos puede lograr producir buenos frutos que le sean muy rentables. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, durante los ciclos anteriores pagó puntualmente sus cuotas, por ello se ha ganado la confianza de sus compañeros quienes lo nombraron fiscal de su banco comunal, labor que cumple responsablemente en bienestar de su grupo. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará 25 sacos de fertilizantes químicos para abonar su chacras de arveja.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 48-year-old homeowner who lives with the mother of his two sons in a town called Patay. His sons live with relatives in Lima because they are studying there. Jorge has planted potatoes on his own parcels of land for 28 years. He suffered a tremendous loss because of a cold snap, and low market prices, a while ago and has not been able to recuperate his losses. Therefore, he decided to also cultivate beans, which have proved to be profitable and to cost less. He plants them on the same land he’s cultivated potatoes and has to fertilize constantly to get lush plants that soon explode with pods of beans. Jorge loves his crops. When he goes to Lima to visit his sons, he misses them so he goes back to work his piece of land, that thanks to his care can grow and produce good crops that are profitable. This is his eighth loan with MFP. He paid his former installments on time and earned the trust of his fellow communal bank members. They nominated him treasurer, a position he takes seriously working for the good of the group. He plans to buy 25 sacks of chemical fertilizer for his beans with the loan money.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida D. J. is one of the most outstanding members of ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She is 59 years old and the mother of three. She is married to Efren, who is 58 years old. She lives in the busy town of Morong, Rizal province in the Philippines.

To remove her family from poverty and to make a decent life for her children, are her greatest desires. In 2000, she joined ASHI hoping to access capital for her business. Her previous loans were carefully and wisely spent on a sari-sari store (general store) as a primary business, and portions of her loans were also spent on the maintenance of the tricycle that her husband drives. Both of her businesses bring in enough proceeds for her family's consumption.

Now on her twelfth loan, she requests a loan of 45,000 pesos as additional capital for her store and for the maintenance of her tricycle. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for 100 pieces of placenta soap and prepaid load for cell phones. She is optimistic that, with the trust and support of ASHI and Kiva, she can achieve her dream of expanding her business and having space in the market some day for a bigger store.

loans.use: To pay for 100 pieces of placenta soap and prepaid load for cell phones, also tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Gardenia Milagros

texts.es:
La señora Gardenia es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 03 hijos, ella pudo estudiar solo la secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Bellavista.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace varios años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir galletas para venderlos en su negocio.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para poder comprar variedad de galletas, gaseosas, gelatinas.

Su deseo es poner una tienda de venta de galletas al por mayor.

A ella le gusta el cumplimiento y la puntualidad en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gardenia is a member of the “Cinnamon Flower” (Flor de Canela) Community Bank, which is located in the district of Puno, in the province of Puno, in the department of Puno. She is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and is the mother of 3 children. She was not able to complete secondary school. She lives in the Bellavista neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for many years. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles. She used the loan as capital to buy cookies and sell them through her business. At present, she needs another loan for 300 nuevos soles. This loan will be used to buy a variety of cookies, soda, and gelatin. Her dream is to have a store to sell cookies at wholesale. She like the performance and punctuality of her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies, soda, and gelatin

loans.name: Homegnon Kossi

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme est le Directeur d’un établissement de débit de boisson très connu à Lomé appelé « First Class ». Cet Etablisssement fait aussi office de bar-dancing. Ce débit de boisson est très visité par beaucoup de jeunes et des touristes visitant le quartier de Bè à Lomé. Actuellement il  a besoin de renouveler son stock; c’est pour cette raison qu’il voudrait avoir un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 10 casiers de bière Lager, 15 casiers de bière Eku Bavaria, 20 casiers de Guiness et un nombre significatif de boissons gazeuses et des sucreries. Ce jeune homme est célibataire et sans enfant.

loans.use: Achat des casiers de boissons

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie G. is from the village of Malangka, P-6 Brgy. 25, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old. Margie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Margie owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the business’s main income comes from selling specialty food products in the local community, such as longganisa, chorizo, hot dogs etc. Margie has had her business for over three years and earns approximately PHP2,400 a month.

In 2009, Margie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Margie is requesting a loan of PHP5000, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Margie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products to sell

location.town: Malangka, Barangay 25, Gingoog City, Misamis Orien

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: compra de arroz, manteca, maiz, azucar, jabon, salsas, leña, refrescos, maseca, pollos, condimentos, alfareria jarrones de barro con decoraciones, maseteras de barro.

loans.name: Alule

texts.en:
Alule H. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs like matooke (cooked bananas), beans, etc., at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase cassava flour.

Alule is 41 years old and married. Her husband is a teacher, and they have 6 children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by purchasing chickens and goats for restaurant use.

About BRAC:

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase cassava flour

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
Carmela H. mujer de 59 años, desde que contrajo matrimonio aprendió a elaborar braseros (recipientes pequeños, medianos y grandes que se utiliza para bendecir costumbres). Ella trabaja con Pro Mujer hace 5 años aproximadamente, indica que los préstamos obtenidos le han sido de  utilidad y ahora necesita  seguir comprando materia prima como son los turriles con los cuales elabora los braseros. Carmela cuando tiene una cantidad suficiente vende sus productos a las chifleras (personas que venden yerbas, dulces para bendecir costumbres) de la ciudad de La Paz y Cochabamba. 
Carmela es casada y madre de 5 hijos, 3 de ellos están casados y 2 solteros que también ayudan en la producción de braseros.

Sus compañeras tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de ropa, comida, verduras y tejido de chompas. Todas necesitan  el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios comprando materia prima y mercadería.
texts.en:
Carmela H., age 59, learned how to make braseros (small, medium, and large containers used in traditional blessing ceremonies) when she got married. She has been working with Pro Mujer for approximately 5 years. She states that the loans she has obtained have been very useful to her. She now needs a loan so that she can keep purchasing materials like the barrels she needs to make the braseros. When she has the right quantity, Carmela sells her products to chifleras (people who sell herbs and sweets for blessing ceremonies) in the city of La Paz and Cochabamba.

Carmela is a married mother of five children, 3 of whom are married while 2 are single and help her to produce braseros.

Her fellow group members own different businesses, such as clothing sales, fast food sales, vegetable sales, and sweater weaving. They all need this loan to invest in purchasing raw materials and merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Nayfa

texts.en:
Nayfa is a 35-year-old woman who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with her husband and their four children. Nayfa has owned a grocery store since 2006. She also sells candies, canned food, and other items. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Nayfa has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.
Nayfa is special in her work because she offers a wide range of products. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and traders. When she first started this business, she didn’t have enough cash. Nayfa decided on doing her business because she wanted to supplement her husband’s income. In the future, she plans on improving her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Amu

texts.en:
Amu N. is currently in the business of selling various items in a shop and is requesting a loan to stock pilsner beer to sell. Amu is 31 years old and is married to a businessman. She has nine children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hotel.

About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock pilsner beer to sell

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch R. is a villager in Rolus village in Takeo province. She is a Khmer cake seller. Her husband, Mr. Chhouk Mann, is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare (5-acre) piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a duck breeder.

With his careers, Mrs. Touch R.’s husband faces some problems in his production and in his poultry business. Now, Mrs. Touch R. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and duck feed.

Mrs. Touch R. is 50 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, and duck feed for her husband's businesses

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Mrs. Soy S. (pictured here), 54, and her husband, Mr. Phin Sin, 55, live on an island on Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1975 and have eight children: five sons and three daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home, two assist their parents in their farming business, and one daughter attends school.
Mrs. Soy S. and her husband are farmers who grow ginger on their farmland in the village. The couple wants to buy piglets for their children to raise. In this way, they will be able to earn extra income to support their family. Therefore, Soy is asking for her first loan of $1,000 USD for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for her children to raise

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys W. M. is thirty-eight years old, married, and has two children. Her business is located at Ngong, a busy area in Nairobi, and is known by the name "Mwea General Shop." She has been serving the local people for the last two years, and her major challenge is that there are so many people engaged in the same kind of business as hers that customers are spoiled with choices. She is using her loan to buy maize and wheat flour, soft drinks, and cereals. She hopes to expand her business and become a wholesaler. She is a very hard-working business lady.

loans.use: Soft drinks, flour, and cereals

loans.name: Magdaleno

texts.es:
El señor Magdaleno T. P. es originario de la comunidad el coyol municipio de condega se dedica a actividades agrícolas y ganaderas su finca tiene una extensión de 160 mz de terreno siendo estas mas a la actividad de ganado, se le otorgo el crédito para la compra de 4 novillos de engorde para después venderlos de pesa en el matadero de condega ya que es una de las principales actividades de este cliente.

Su negocio comenzó desde niño ya que su papa también se dedicaba a este rubro por lo que no fue difícil para él aprenderlo y sacarle provecho a este negocio  de compra y repasto de ganado él espera que 
Con el crédito le vaya muy bien porque tendrá mas oportunidad de seguir trabajando y obtener un buen ingreso y comprar mas ganado de repasto cabe mencionar que este productor también se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y papa esto con el objetivo de mejorar cada día mas su finca y poder dejarle a sus hijos un buen patrimonio de su parte.


Don Magdaleno es casado y tiene cuatro hijos dos edad escolar y dos que trabajan con él ya mayores de edad. Este es sexto crédito que se le otorga y trabaja con ceprodel desde el dos mi cuatro y nos expreso que esta agradecido con la institución por la ayuda que se le a brindado ya que a mejorado sus condiciones de vida de su familia y espera seguir trabajando sin tener problemas.
texts.en:
Magdaleno T. P. is from Coyol, Condega. He is a farmer and cattleman. His farm is 160 manzanas (one manzana=7000 square meters approx.) which are dedicated almost exclusively to cattle raising. He was given a loan to buy 4 calves to raise for subsequent sale to the Condega slaughterhouse; this is one of the main activities of this client. His business began when he was still a child because his father was in the same line of work so it wasn't difficult for him to learn and take advantage of this cattle raising business. He expects the loan will do him good because he will have more opportunity to continue working, have higher income, and buy more cattle to raise. It is worth mention that this producer also farms basic grains and potatoes in order to improve his farm and leave a greater asset to his children. Magdaleno is married and has four, school-age children and two adult children that work with him. This is his 6th loan and he has collaborated with Ceprodel since 2004. He stated that he is grateful to the institution for the help it has given him because his family's living conditions have improved and he hopes to continue to work problem-free.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao N. is a 33-year-old married woman who lives in Preak Ta Ong Ti 2 village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Tha Thorn, are mango sellers who can earn a small income by selling their mangoes to support their family. Since their business is still going well, Mrs. Mao N. wants to expand it. She decided to ask for 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy more mangoes to enlarge her business. She hopes that the loan will increase the family income and improve the family's living conditions. Mrs. Mao N. is the mother of four children. Two of the children are students in the public school and two are too young to study or work. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more mango

loans.name: Pablo Vidal

texts.es:
Pablo M. de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa vende ropa. Ellos tienen 3 hijos todos estudiantes de escuelas particulares. 

Pablo hace 18 años ya tiene la farmacia inicio como vendedor ambulante de medicinas y con ayuda de sus padres pudo tener su propio local el primer nombre de la farmacia fue “droguería” (este nombre es común para las farmacias en Latinoamérica). 

Ahora el tiene una de las más grandes farmacias en todo el sector de Paraíso. Tiene dos empleados que le ayudan a vender los medicamentos. Trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 23h00 todos los días. La delincuencia es uno de los mayores inconvenientes que tiene. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicinas y productos para laboratorio y así incrementar su farmacia. En el futuro quiere ser distribuidor de medicinas en todo Guayaquil.
texts.en:
Pablo M. is 43 years old, and lives in a peri-urban area in Paraíso de Guayaquil. His home is made of cement and has all the basic services. His wife sells clothing and they have 3 children, all are students in private schools.

Pablo for 18 years has had a pharmacy. He began as a street vendor selling medicine, and with the help of his parents he was able to have his own stall, the name of the pharmacy was “droguería” (drugstore-this name is commonly used for pharmacies in Latin America).

Now he has one of the biggest pharmacies in all of the Paraíso area. He has 2 employees that help him sell the medicines. He works from 6 a.m. until 11 p.m. every day. Delinquency is one of the biggest problems that he has.

With the loan he wants to buy medicines and products for the laboratory and that way expand his pharmacy. In the future he wants to be a distributor for medicines in all of Guayaquil.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicines, products for laboratories.

loans.name: Amado

texts.es: El señor Amado es casado con la señora Patricia y son padres de familia de 4 pequeñitos, 2 en edad escolar, el señor Amado es empleado de una empresa aduanal como tramitador desde hace 4 años, y su esposa tiene un negocio propio, donde le realiza cortes de cabello a caballeros y damas, además de tintes, mechas entre otros servicios. Ellos son una familia establecida y unida que están tramitando este crédito para terminar la construcción de un cuarto en le frente de su casa, ya que desean ampliarse para el negocio de su esposa.
texts.en:
Amado is married to Paticia and they have four children, two still school-aged. Amado has been employed as an expediter for a customs agent for the last 4 years. He and his wife own their own beauty parlor where they serve both men and women offering haircuts and hair coloring, among many other services. They are an established and united family that are negotiating this loan in order to finish building a room in front of their house that they want in order to enlarge the wife's business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building a room.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia M. is married and has four children. She runs a retail shop in Majaoni, Mombasa where she sells household goods. Her retail shop is one year old and is doing well. 

This loan marks Lydia's second time borrowing from KADET. With the money, Lydia plans to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, and sugar for her shop. Her clients are the area residents of Majaoini.

Lydia hopes to have a really bright future and to open up another business to supplement her income.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, maize flour, and sugar for her retail shop.

loans.name: Teodosio

texts.es:
Teodosio tiene 55 años de edad, es casado, tiene cuatro hijos mayores y dos hijos en edad escolar. Reside en la localidad de Pichari, específicamente en la ceja de la selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia.

A pesar de los obstáculos que se le presentaron en la vida, él sobresalió desde abajo y al final del camino tuvo su recompensa. Ahora se dedica por entero a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de cacao y café. Trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposa e hijos y algunos peones que le facilitan la extracción y selección de sus productos. 
Normalmente labora desde las 7:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM y sus productos los venden en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad; por lo cual le está dando buenos resultados económicos. No contento con ello, en el futuro espera ampliar su terreno de cultivo con el propósito de incrementar su producción.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, además agradece a su banco comunal por el respaldo que le brindan. Con el dinero solicitado piensa darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus cultivos de cacao, con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de su producto.
texts.en:
Teodosio is 55 years old, is married and has 4 adult children and 2 children of school age. He lives in Pichari, specifically the rim of the Cuzco jungle where he has his home.

Despite the obstacles that he has faced in life he overcame them and in the end he got his reward. Now he dedicates his time completely to agriculture, specifically to cocoa and coffee. He works by himself but sometimes his wife and children help him as well as some workers that help pick and select his products.

Normally Teodosio works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM and his products are sold in the central gathering places of his neighborhood, which is why he has such good profits. Not satisfied with his success, he hopes in the future to expand his plotted land to increase his production. This is his first loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and is committed to meeting his set quotas and adds that he is grateful to his communal bank for the support that they give him. With the money loaned he will use it to take care of his crops of cocoa to improve the quality of his product.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To take care of his crops.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
el sr. Alexis B. L. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Suyapa de la ciudad de Nacaome departamento de Valle. Alexis se dedica a la venta de verduras, tiene poco tiempo de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
todos los dias se levanta temprano para cargar su carro pickup de verduras y salir a venderlas en diferentes barrios, colonias y caserios en donde no llegan muchas personas que venden verduras, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes y le gustaria llegar mas lejos ya que este es un buen negocio, las personas consumen muchas verduras todos los dias porque son muy nutritivas.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas verduras y asi poder tener mejores ventas.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con todos los gastos de su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Alexis is 29 years old and lives in the Suyapa neighborhood in the city of Nacaome, located in the Valle department. She sells vegetables, but has not been doing this for very long. She rises early every morning in order to load her pickup truck with vegetables, and then sell them in various neighborhoods and homes where few people go to sell vegetables. This is why she has many customers. She would like to be able to travel farther, as this is a good business. People eat many vegetables daily because they are nutritious. She will use the money from this loan to buy more vegetables so that she can increase her sales. She needs the money in order to pay for household expenses and help to move her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Dios Es Nuestro Amparo 1 Group

texts.en:
Luchi is the coordinator of her group, Dios es Nuestro Amparo (God is our Protection), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the slums north of the capital, Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their two children.
Luchi is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling shoes by purchasing men's shoes and sandals, women's shoes (with and without heels) and purses to sell. She will use the profits to invest in inverters for her home to deal with frequent blackouts, as well as save towards repairing her roof. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase men's shoes and sandals, women's shoes and purses for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Activas es un excelente  comité conformado en fecha 22 de Marzo del 2010, integrado por 15  mujeres de la ciudad de Ita. Este grupo se formó  gracias a que la Sra. Fermina Morán se acercó a la asesora y conformaron el grupo, y ahora ya se encuentran trabajando muy contentas en el 2° ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Las integrantes de este grupo destinan su crédito a diferentes actividades  tales como: compra de frutas y verduras, compra ingredientes para la preparación de alimentos, compra de mercerías, compra de mercaderías para la despensa (azúcar, arroz, yerba, panificados, lácteos, carnes, etc.), compra de ropa para la venta. .
Es un grupo muy activo, todas las integrantes demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad, asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo. .
Dentro del grupo se encuentra la señora Fermina quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, ella comenzó con esta actividad después de integrar comité de mujeres. .
Ella ofrece sus mercaderías a su casa, y también sale a ofrecer en casas de conocidos  y amigos. .
Le va bien hasta ahora ya que le genera un ingreso, e invierte en su casa, y actualmente quiere comprar más prendas de vestir para contar con mas variedades como remeras, vestidos, suéter, pantalones, jeans, para solicita el crédito.
texts.en:
The committee Mujeres Activas is an excellent committee formed on March 22, 2010, and is made up of 15 women from the city of Capiatá. This group was formed thanks to Fermina who went up to the assessor and formed the group. Now she finds herself working very contently in the second cycle of the Program of the Committee of Enterprising Women. The members of this group use their loans for different activities like: buying fruits and vegetables, buying ingredients for the preperation of food, buying for a notions store, buying merchandise for a market ( sugar, rice, maté, breads, dairy, meats, etc.), and buying clothes for resale. It is a very active group, all of the members show comradeship and solidarity, they attend the weekly meetings and do activities to collect funds for the common good of the group. In the group is Fermina who works selling clothes. She began this job after forming the committee of women. She offers her merchandise from her house and also leaves to offer in houses of her friends. It has gone well up to now as it creates an income, which she invests in her house for various things, and now she wants to buy more items of clothing to have more varieties like T-shirts, dresses, sweaters, pants, and jeans. This is why she needs the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Gerrit Larsen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy T-shirts, dresses, sweaters, pants, and jeans.

loans.name: Flor Kantutita Group

texts.es:
C.F. GERMAN BUSCH
A.C. FLOR KANTUTITA
FECHA: 15/07/2010

La Asociación Comunal “FLOR KANTUTITA”, es una asociación que solicita crédito por cuarta vez, es parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve personas, tienen como presidenta a la señora Rosario del Carmen L. C.. 

La señora Rosario del Carmen L. C. trabaja en Pro Mujer desde hace 3 ciclos (aproximadamente un año y medio).  Tiene como negocio la venta de comida desde hace ocho años. La venta es realizada en la Zona de Alto Lima. 

El primer crédito fue por Bs.1500.-, actualmente la asociación le aprobó Bs.3500.-, ella indica que le servirá para la compra de víveres al por mayor.
 
En el caso de las  integrantes de la asociación comunal, tienen diversos negocios, como: venta de telas, venta de comida, comerciante, venta de cosméticos, confección de chompas de cuello alto, pasanaku (sistema de ahorro diario, no formal), producción y venta de CD, DVD´s, VCD.
texts.en:
Regional Office GERMAN BUSCH Communal Bank “FLOR KANTUTITA” Date: 07/15/2010 The communal bank “Flor Kantutita” is requesting a loan for the fourth time; it is a part of the German Busch Regional Office. It is made up of nine people. Their President is Rosario del Carmen L. C.. Rosario del Carmen L. C. has worked with Pro Mujer for 3 loan cycles (approximately 1.5 years). Her business for the past eight years has been selling food. She sells in the neighborhood of Alto Lima. Her first loan was for Bs. 1,500.00. Currently the communal bank has approved her to receive Bs. 3,500.00. She says that she will use it to buy foodstuffs at wholesale prices. The members of the communal bank have several types of businesses, such as: Selling fabrics, selling food, general sales, selling cosmetics, making turtle-neck sweaters, pasanaku (an informal system of daily savings), and making and selling CDs, DVDs, and VCDs.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food items at whole-sale prices

loans.name: José Ylden

texts.es:
Jose es un padre de familia de 48 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el sector Macuaco del distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola situada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Se caracteriza por tener tierras fértiles y terreno accidentado, dada su cercanía con la sierra norte del país.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la crianza y venta de animales menores, específicamente aves de corral, el cría patos y gallinas en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona en donde vive o en una feria que se realiza una vez por semana en el distrito de Cayaltí.

Jose desea adquirir mas animales para ampliar su negocio y alimento balanceado para lograr que estos de desarrollen de manera correcta lo que hará que sean vendidos a mejor precio, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternatva un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Jose es un padre honrado, trabajador y que continuamente da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Jose is a 48 years old family man living with his wife and their two children in Macuaco, a sector of the Oyotún district, a rural area located two hours away from the town of Chiclayo. The area is characterized by rich lands and uneven ground, being located close to the country's northern mountain range. For more that ten years he has been engaging in breeding ans selling small animals, poultry in particular: he breeds ducks and chickens in an area located at the back of his house, and when they have grown enough he sells them to traders that visit the area where he lives or at a weekly fair located in the Cayaltí district. Jose wishes to buy more animals to improve his activity, as well as feed for his animals so that they will grow correctly and he will be able to sell them at a better price.Wishing to reach his goal, he has come to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time, requesting a loan of 1000 PEN. Jose is a honest and hard-working father who constantly does the best he can to provide for his family. His main desire is to be able to give them better living conditions. He is known to be a calm and responsible man by the neighbors and acquaintances of the area where he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animls and animal feed to improve his activity.

loans.name: Rafael Leopoldo

texts.es: Rafael es un padre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a 4 hijos en el. El Se dedica a trabajar en la  compra y venta de ganado por lo que lo heredo de su padre ya que él se dedicaba a tiempo completo a su actividad Con los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades él se encarga de apoyar a su esposa con los gastos familiares. Rafael trata de dar lo mejor de sí para mantenerse en el negocio y sacar adelante a los que quiere. Por lo que quiere obtener muy buenas ganancias por medio de este crédito, que será implementado para la compra de más ganado. El es un hombre muy tranquilo, trabajador y responsable.
texts.en:
Rafael is 42 years old, a father, and lives with his 4 children. He works in the buying and selling of cattle, which he inherited from his father and to which he dedicates himself to full time. With his earnings, he helps his wife with their household costs. Rafael tries to give his all in his work in order to maintain his business and to move those he love forward. With this credit, he hopes to obtain better profits by purchasing more livestock. He is a calm, hard-working, and responsible man.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
Mr. Song V. (pictured here), is 32 years old. His wife, Mrs. Sokhim Chang, is 28 yeas old. They live in a suburb about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh city. They have been married for ten years and have three daughters. Two of them are in school and another one is still young. 

Song has been a construction worker for five years, and his wife has been a garment factory worker for seven years. The house where they live is small and it’s difficult for family members to stay, so Song is asking for his first loan of $900 to renovate his house.

loans.use: To renovate the house where he lives.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de verduras y granos secos, ella vende tomates,zanahorias,cebollas,pepinos y toda variedad de granos secos, ella lleva a diferentes lugares como Urubamba, Pisac y también los vende en la ciudad del Cusco y en algunas oportunidades manda a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, su esposo se dedica a cultivar verduras en su pequeño terreno de cultivo y por medios de estos trabajos pueden sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un puesto para vender las verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras  y también para comprar abonos y semillas para su terreno de cultivo.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata communal bank. The bank is located in the community of Yuncaypata, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Julia is 38 years old, married, and has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling vegetables and dried grains. She sells tomatoes, carrots, onions, cucumbers, and all varieties of dried grains. Julia travels to different places like Urubamba, Pisac, and also sells them in the city of Cuzco. When she has the opportunity, she also sends them to Puerto Maldonado. Her husband works growing vegetables on his small piece of farmland and through these jobs, they are able to help their children get ahead. Julia wants to have a stand to sell the vegetables. She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables, as well as fertilizer and seeds for their farmland.

Julia is grateful for everyone who has made this dream possible and she promises to make her payments by the established deadlines.
