For 10 years she has been a dressmaker, she is very good making garments for ladies, children and lingerie at her workshop which is installed in her own house. She sells from door to door. On the other hand, Lina also makes earrings, necklaces, shoes, and wallets which she decorates with beeds and colored stones. And if this was not enough, she also sells wood (planks, strips, and cants). She likes to keep busy especially when she sees daily economical growth as she gets good earnings from all her activities. For the future she would like to build adequate premises with a section for each of her businesses.

This is her 3rd loan with MFP and what she likes about her community bank is that her partners are enthusiastic, communicative, and friendly individuals, and above all, they support each other. With the money requested she will buy cloth, yarn and other textile materials to keep active with the dressmaking. She will also invest in her business selling wood and imitation jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase textile materials

loans.name: Felly

texts.en:
Felly C., 47, is a rice farmer from Norala, South Cotabato. She manages a 3-hectare rice field. She also has a hog raising business. Felly supports her family of four children; the eldest is 25 years old. She works hard in order to have a good harvest.

She is limited in her capital. That’s why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to avail a loan. She’s requesting 8,000 Philippine pesos to support her business in buying seeds and farm materials.

loans.use: Seeds and farm materials

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose C. is a 35-year-old married woman with six children. Her husband is a carpenter, and her children attend school. To earn a living, she sells bread and sugar out of a shop. Now, she is requesting a loan to purchase other items, such as beans, rice, maize, and flour for re-sale purposes. With the extra income generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to alleviating poverty and empowering the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. Such services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its activities. In 2007, BRAC commenced operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations and includes more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional goods (e.g., beans, rice, maize, and flour)

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia L. is from the village of San Manuel. She is 54 years old. Ignacia is widowed and has three grown children. To make a living, Ignacia owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation in the local community. Ignacia has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2005, Ignacia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ignacia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Benta Atieno

texts.en:
Benta Atieno M. started her current clothes-hawking business (selling door-to-door) in 1993 before which she was a retail shop owner. She is a 47 year old widow and a mother to one child.

Benta Atieno would like a loan of Kshs 40,000 which she says will go to expanding her current clothes stock.

Benta Atieno’s main future plan is to guarantee an education for her only child and to expand her business across the Kenyan border.

loans.use: To expand her current stock of clothes

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mrs. Eng T., 40 years old, owns a small wooden house and a grocery shop, where she sells many items, including cooking ingredients, sweets, and soft drinks. Eng T. sells her inventory to passers-by and also neighbors living near her house. She has been running her grocery shop for a long time and earns an average of $5 a day. To ensure financial stability for the entire family, her husband works farming rice. The couple now lives with three children who are going to school. Eng T. is taking out her loan to increase her inventory for her grocery store. (Mrs. Eng T. was busy at her business, so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To increase her inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Lesbia Lizeth

texts.es:
la joven Lesbia Lizeth Z. D. tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con su abuela.
lesbia se dedica a la elaboracion de pan, quesadillas, hojaldras, rosquillas, tiene varios años de realizar este tipo de actividad. Su madre le enseño el oficio con el cual a podido salir adelante en estos años. 
 
Su producto lo fabrica en su casa y lo vende en el mercado viejo de san lorenzo y tambien les vende a los empleados de la camaronera,  sus ventas son diarias.
 
esta solicitando el credito para compra de maiz, leña para almacenar para la epoca de lluvia 
ya que la leña se escasea para esa epoca.
texts.en:
The young woman Lesbia Lizeth Z. D. is 31 years old, single with no children and lives with her grandmother. Lesbia makes a living making bread, quesadillas, puff pastries, and doughnuts. She has been working at this for several years. Her mother taught her the trade, which has allowed her to get ahead throughout these years. She makes her products in her home and sells them at the old market in San Lorenzo and to the employees of the shrimp farm. She sells her products daily. She is requesting this loan to purchase corn and firewood to store for the rainy season. Firewood is very scarce during that period.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, oil, butter margarine cheese and firewood.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine was born in 1972; she is married and has two children who are 6 and 13 years old.  Alphonsine and her family live in the Kicukiro district, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  

Alphonsine has been in the business of selling food for a long time; her business is open from early in the morning until late in the evening. 

Alphonsine is proud of her business because it helps her to provide daily food for her children.  The good news is that the number of her customers has increased to the extent that she is not able to satisfy them.  To satisfy her customers, Alphonsine is requesting a Kiva loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company.  

Once Alphonsine earns more profits through the expansion of her business, she expects to save a portion of her profits for future reinvestment and to use another portion to build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy food for resale

loans.name: Fanny Judith

texts.es:
Fanny tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo menor de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, considerado el distrito más poblado de la región, pero a la vez es el que tiene los indices mas altos de pobreza. Este distrito queda ubicado a cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de desayunos y almuerzos en un puesto ambulante ubicado en el parque de los mecánicos del distrito en donde vive. Anteriormente el negocio era de su madre y actualmente ella lo conduce debido a que esta ya es de avanzada edad. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida, sobre todo de los trabajadores que laboran en los talleres ubicados en el perímetro de la zona, ellos acuden al negocio de Fanny porque prefieren el buen trato que ofrece y la buena sazón con la que prepara la comida.

Debido a la gran demanda que posee su negocio Fanny desea ampliarlo instalando un puesto de venta adicional, con el cual daría trabajo a un familiar. Para lograr este objetivo ella se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de mobiliario y utensilios para lograr su objetivo.

Fanny es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, con alto sentido de compromiso y responsabilidad. Su mayor anhelo es poder instalar un restaurante en la zona.
texts.en:
Fanny is 30 years old and a single mother with one son. She lives in her parents’ home, located in the José Leonardo Ortiz district, considered to be the most populated in the region, but with the highest levels of poverty. This district is located minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 10 years, she has been selling breakfast and lunch from a stall in the park within her district. The business used to belong to her mother, but [Fanny] runs it now that her mother is getting older. The business has been very welcomed, especially by the workers who work in the shops located around the perimeter of the zone. They prefer Fanny’s business because they like the good service and the enthusiasm with which she prepares the food. Because of the high demand, Fanny would like to expand her business and set up another stall that will be run by a member of her family. In order to meet this objective, she is asking for her first loan, through Edpyme Alternativa, of 1,000 PEN ($375) to buy furniture and utensils. Fanny is a very hard working and enterprising woman with a high regard for commitment and responsibility. Her greatest desire is to open a restaurant within the zone.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up a second food stall

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia L. tiene ya más de 14 años dedicándose a su negocio de venta de abarrotes. 
Doña Antonia ya es una persona mayor de edad y tiene poco tiempo que es viuda, por atender a su esposo, desatendió el negocio y le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía. 
Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertirle en el negocio en mercancía, es por eso que solicita un préstamo y así poder tener más variedad de productos para la venta. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
La señora Antonia L. has already spent more than 14 years selling groceries. She is a senior citizen and recently became a widow. To care for her husband, she left her store unattended, and she now lacks a variety of merchandise. Because she does not have money to invest in her business, she has applied for this loan and will use the proceeds to purchase a variety of products that she can sell. She plans to make loan payments with earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 44-year-old married woman living in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. She has been in the business of selling clothing and women's accessories like bags, belts and jewelry since 1997, in order to help her family improve their financial situation. She doesn’t own a shop; she sells from home. For the ninth time, Amal has requested a loan to purchase merchandise. She has always reimbursed on time. This loan will be used to buy clothing for the new summer season. Her earnings will be used to pay for basic expenses and to acquire other items, such as clothes and accessories that her customers request. In addition, she will use some of the loan to repair her car. Thanks to her previous loans, she has always been able to diversify her merchandise, improve her business and her financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es: José Manuel G. G. de 36 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Desde hace 6 años que se dedica a la compra y venta de madera, negocio el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, gracias al cual ha logrado sostener a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, y sus dos hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar educación básica en la escuela del lugar. El negocio de venta de madera es muy rentable para José ya que cuenta con muchos clientes quienes hacen pedidos grandes, lo que le permite obtener más ganancias. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar madera por mayor y así contar con más materia prima para su negocio. El mayor deseo de José es el de aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma mejorar la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
José Manuel G. G. is 36 years old. He lives in the city of Santa Tecla, which is located in the La Libertad district. For 6 years, he has been buying and selling wood, a business which is located in his home. Thanks to this business, he been successful in supporting his family. This is confirmed by his wife, who does the household chores, and his two children, who are 14 and 12 years old and go to the local school. The business of selling wood is very profitable for José, since he can count on many clients who place large orders, which gives him bigger earnings. He is applying for a loan so that he will have the money needed to buy wood wholesale and thus have more material for his business. José's greatest wish is to increase his earnings and in this way improve the economy of his household.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood wholesale

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Materials and supplies

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua N. prepares Fante kenkey for sale in Abura. To prepare her kenkey, she buys maize from the market and soaks it in a lot, or enough, water to soften the maize. She washes it on the third day and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn and leaves it to prove for the next day. She divides the proved dough into two and uses one half for her firm half-cooked dough. She mixes it with water to get it into a porridge form, cooks it for some time to get a firm mixture or texture of the dough. Then she mixes the rest of the uncooked dough with the half-cooked portion. She moulds into balls and wraps them in corn husk. She cooks them again till they become soft to eat. Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce, with fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, roasted turkey or any other kind of meat or fish.

Ekua is married to a farmer and has four children. She has been through junior high school. Ekua uses her income to help her husband pay for accommodation and take care of the family. Ekua will use this loan to buy more bags of corn to prepare kenkey for sale. Ekua plans to reinvest the new profits from her extended business back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of corn to prepare kenkey for sale

loans.name: Sam-Onn

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-onn S. is 30 years old and is single. He lives with his parents, brothers and sisters in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. He is a policeman. 

One of Sam-onn’s brothers has full-time employment but he does not have his own transportation to get work and spends a lot of money on traveling costs. S., Sam-onn is asking for his first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for his brother to drive to work.  

Photo: Mr. Sam-onn S..

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his brother to drive to work.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en: Generosa A., 47 years old, is a married woman who supports her family by engaging in a business buying and selling used clothing. She lives in Barangay Calape Daan Bantayan, Cebu City with her 51 year old husband, Emelito, who is an electrician, and their 6 children who are between 13 and 29 years old. Two of their children have their own families while the other four are currently going to school. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business of buying and selling used clothing, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000. Generosa is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can use it as additional working capital for her business. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Generosa aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more phone cards.

loans.name: Mujeres De Combate (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de Combate esta formado por un grupo de 10 mujeres quienes se dedican a realizar varias actividades en busca de un mejor futuro para sus familias, son mujeres muy alegres y trabajadoras. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por ser la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, fue nombrada el primero de  diciembre de 1999 como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad.

La Señora. Marcia Patricia C.  vive en de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, su primer hijo tiene 10 años, sus dos últimos hijos son gemelos de 6 años y  todos  estudian en la escuela, su esposo es chofer y tiene su propio taxi, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus padres pero de una manera independiente.
Nuestra socia es estilista y lleva laborando como profesional hace 14 años, cuenta con su propio gabinete de belleza en el cual labora de lunes a domingo de 8 a.m. a 6 p.m. Es el primer crédito que realiza, fue invitada por una amiga que es socia de la banca comunal, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para vender en su local. Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.

La Señora. María Adela H. vive por el sector de Huizhil que es perteneciente a la parroquia Baños. Este es su primer crédito y fue invitada por su suegra, nuestra socia se dedica hace un año a la cría de pollos, los que vende pelados o vivos, también se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal actividad que la realiza hace 7 años. 
La Señora. María Adela tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene una hija de 2 años y 7 meses, su esposo es comerciante de discos compactos, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus suegros pero de manera independiente. Su crédito lo va  a invertir en pollos y también en su alimento. Su sueño es viajar a España.
texts.en:
The Mujeres de Combate (Women of Combat) Community Bank is made up of 10 women who work in a variety of activities to provide a better future for their families. They are very happy and hard-working women. They live in the city of Cuenca, and this city is known as the third most important city in Ecuador. On December 1, 1999, it was recognized as a Cultural Site.

Mrs. Marcia Patricia C. lives in the city of Cuenca, is 30 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her oldest son is 10 years old and the other two are 6 year old twins, and they all are students. Her husband is a taxi driver and has his own taxi. They do not have their own home, but live independently in her parents' home.

This group member has been a professional hair stylist for 14 years. She has her own location where she works from Monday to Sunday from 8:00am until 6:00 pm. This is her first loan, and she was invited to the group by a friend who is a member of the community bank. She will use the loan to buy cosmetics to sell at her business. Her goal is to have her own home.

Mrs. María Adela H. lives in Huizhil in the region of Baños. This is her first loan and she was invited by her mother-in-law. She has worked for a year raising chickens, and she sells them butchered or live. She also has sold Yanbal products for 7 years. She is 34 years old and has a daughter who is 2 years and 7 months old. Her husband sells CDs. They do not have their own home, and live independently in her in-laws' home. She will use the loan to buy chickens and their food. Her dream is to travel to Spain.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens/food and cosmetics

loans.name: Francisco Enrique

texts.es: Francisco tiene 55 años de edad, es casado tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad que trabajan de manera independiente, Se dedica a la brindar el servicio de taller de soldadura situado en su domicilio desde hace 35 años. El ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de servicios en taller de soldadura y cada día se esmera por ofrecer un buen servicio. Francisco desea ampliar su negocio y comprar más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y percibir mayores ganancias. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de maquinas de trabajo, herramientas, pinturas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Francisco is 55 years old, married, and has three adult children who work independently. He has been providing welding services out of a workshop in his home for the past 35 years. Francisco performs all types of welding jobs for his customers each day and strives to provide good service.

He wants to expand his business and buy more supplies so that he can meet the demand of his customers and generate more income. For this reason, Francisco is requesting a loan to buy machines, tools, paints, and other items he needs for his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase machines, tools, paints, and other items

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Mrs. Som C. I. is a 46-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom province. She is married to Ly Mao, aged 44, and has six children, all of whom are single. The couple work together in the farming business. To help solve their family's financial crisis, two of the children are employed in a garment factory. Som C. I. and her family live in their own house, which breaks down frequently. As a consequence, their living conditions have been affected. In order to resolve this problem, Som C. I. is humbly requesting a loan of $600 to repair her old house.
Note: Mrs. Som C. I. was not available at the time of the photograph, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Epifania; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos como trigo, maíz y moraya, ella vende en el mercado de Ttio desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener un puesto donde vender los productos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos  al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Epifania is a member of the Virgin of Carmen de Yuncaypata Community Bank which is located in Yuncaypata, in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She divides her time between her daily activities and running her business selling dried goods such as wheat, corn, and potatoes in the Ttio market. Epifania works there from 6am to 5 pm and would like to have a stall there from which to sell her merchandise. She is seeking a loan to buy dried goods in bulk. Epifania is grateful to all who help make her dream possible and promises to pay back the loan according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane A, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy dried goods in bulk

loans.name: Julia Estela

texts.es: La señora Julia Estela P. A., tiene la edad de 46 años es una madre soltera que habita con sus hijos mayores de edad en el Barrio los Meléndez, sus hijos trabajan en diferentes actividades que generan sus propios ingresos, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de productos para el hogar, uso propio, abarrotes, etc. Y es para el negocio que solicita un préstamo a ser utilizado en la compra de mayor mercadería, favoreciendo a  sus ventas mensuales y permitiéndoles mejores ingresos para la mejora continua de las condiciones de vida en las que actualmente esta habitando, este no es el primer préstamo de la señora, en los año que Afodenic y fondos Kiva le han apoyado sus niveles de vida han sido mas prósperos y su familia se expresa sentirse muy contenta de los cambios positivos que han tenido en sus vidas.
texts.en:
Ms. Julia Estela P. A. is a 46 year-old single mother who lives with her grown children in the Los Meléndez neighborhood.  Her children work in different jobs that bring in their own income.  Julia has a small store where she sells products for the home and for personal use, groceries, etc.  She is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise for her business, in order to stimulate her monthly sales and allow her to earn more profits so that she can improve her living conditions.

This is not her first loan.  Over the years that AFODENIC and Kiva lenders have supported her, her quality of life has become more prosperous.  Her family says they are very happy with the positive changes they have seen in their lives.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Charles Kamau

texts.en:
Charles has practiced farming in Njambini town for the last six years.  He is 52 years old, married to Lucy Wanjiru, and they have five children.

He was introduced to KADET  LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his previous loan well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs to increase production.

In future, Charles hopes to embrace technology and farm in greenhouses to maximize his harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs to increase production

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky L. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread products like legemat (sweet fried dough balls) and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour to use to bake more products to sell. Vicky is 30 years old and married. Her husband is an NGO staff member. She has no children yet.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more baking flour in order to bake more bread to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora P. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Flora is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Flora owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods, canned goods, biscuits, breads, & detergents in the local community. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Flora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products for sale. Flora is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory for sale and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Flora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for sale and as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Edith Atieno

texts.en:
Edith Atieno N. is 30 years old, married to Thomas Wapas who is a clinical officer and is also a source of additional income for the family. They have three children attending school of age five years, three and one years. Their residence is in Lodwar-Kenya. She has been operating a boutique and has been in this business for two years and earns a monthly profit of KES.30,000.

Edith learned about KADET LTD through a credit officer and so she is applying for her first loan of KES.40,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to buy varieties of clothes. With the anticipated profits, she plans to boost up her business and put up a rental house.

In the future, Edith wishes to live a better and more comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: To buy a wide variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana belongs to the “Solidaridad Cachimayo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cachimayo district of the province of Chinceros. She is 35 years old, single and has one child. She is requesting the loan to invest in the restaurant she runs out of her house in Cachimayo. Her favorite dish to prepare in her restaurant is chicken soup! She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in restaurant

loans.name: Alexis  Genaro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES  UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Alexis Genaro; el tiene 26 años de edad y es conviviente; el socio se es egresado de la Universidad de Bella Artes del Cusco, el socio se especializo en  pintura lo cual le llena de alegría y satisfacciones ya que es lo que le gusta hacer, el realiza diferente tipo de pinturas para poder vender a sus clientes y personas que le solicitan, el socio espera poder terminar de graduarse para así poder seguir demostrando su arte ya que él es una persona bien perseverante.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para su negocio como telas, bastidores, pintura al oleo entre otros más.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the ” MUJERES UNIDAS” ["United Women"] communal bank. The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Alexis Genaro. He is 26 and in a common-law marriage. He is a graduate of the Universidad de Bella Artes del Cusco [University of Fine Arts of Cusco]. He is specialized in painting. Painting fills him with joy and satisfaction, since it is what he loves doing. He makes different types of paintings to sell to his clients and to people who make orders. He hopes to finish his schooling soon in order to be able to continue showing off his art. He is a very persevering person.

He is requesting this loan to buy materials for his business such as fabric, frames and oil paints, among other items.

He is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of his quotas.

loans.use: the member is requesting this loan in order to purchase materials for his business, such as fabrics, frames,  and oil paint, among others.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

He has operated a retail shop business for the past nine years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Jane faces a major challenge of delayed payments from those who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to open another business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To  purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice for sale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites C. is from the village of Villaluz, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 38 years old. Marites is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Marites joined Kiva's partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marites is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional supplies for her store. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a single woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity, and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, Mbeyu has operated a food vending business, selling at the market and door to door to her neighbours. She faces the major challenge of competition from other food vendors in the market, and hopes to own a retail shop in the future.

Mbeyu decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards, and is requesting a Kshs 30,000 loan to purchase building blocks for her house.

loans.use: To purchase building blocks.

loans.name: Mechansm United-Kyenjojo Group

texts.en: 27 year-old Nasuru R.  is a businessman dealing in metals and car tires in Kyenjojo Trading center. He has been involved in this business for close to 8 years now. He began this business after graduating from technical college. He had no previous business experience but he had the courage and conviction that he would succeed as long as the determination was there. He sells car tires to motorists in Kyenjojo and also in neighboring districts. Weekly, he makes shillings 150,000 as profit. The happily married father of 2 says he is going to use this loan to purchase more tires to resell at his shop.

loans.use: to purchase more tires to resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife. He has owned a poultry shop since 2009 and has worked in this field for six years. He has good number of customers passing by his shop buying tasty grilled chicken.  He works hard to earn a good income and be able to cover their weighty living expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new refrigerator in order to better preserve the meat. He is planning to have a baby very soon so he is willing to double his work efforts to gain higher income and be capable of handling the upcoming expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator to preserve meat.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina D. is from the village of Victoria, Alicia, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Josefina is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Josefina runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2005, Josefina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Josefina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith M. A. is a woman of 35 years, married and a mother of six lovely children. They live in Matisi on the outskirts of Kitale town. She sells cereals and vegetables along with a few clothes. Judith has been in this business for six years now and gets a monthly income of 39,000 KES.


This will be Judith's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to add stock to her business; buying cereals like maize and beans for resale. 


In the future she wants to raise her family's living standards, and also educate her children.

loans.use: to buy cereals like beans and maize

loans.name: Swayibu

texts.en:
Swayibu is 25 years old he has five children who are between the ages of 9 and 23 years old. They are all in school.

Swayibu sells food such as sugar, rice and cooking oil. He has done this business for five years. He is requesting a loan to buy more food such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. With the profits he plans to buy more food and make more profits with which he plans to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy food such as sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and two siblings who are still attending school. He has owned a snack since 2008. He specializes in preparing delicious beef and chicken sandwiches. He has a large number of customers visiting his shop enjoying his tasty sandwiches. He works hard in cooperation with his father to afford the high costs of living. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional tools and equipments to improve his business. In the future, he is planning to redecorate his shop in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and equipment for his shop

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 41 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Bernadeth works very hard to provide for them.

Bernadeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries.

Bernadeth has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, biscuits, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future Bernadeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 52 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eyner de 52 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Para Rosa el negocio de venta de ropa ha sido una actividad que le ha ayudado a obtener los ingresos necesarios para sostener a su familia. A sus 20 años decidió salir de la casa de sus padres y hoy es una de las vendedoras de ropa más solicitadas de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 30 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Espera con el tiempo tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender con más comodidad su mercadería. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de todos ustedes; además se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa, para así incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene para vender
texts.en:
52 year-old Rosa is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 52 year-old Eyner, and her five beloved children, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Rosa's clothing sales business has helped her to make the income that she needs to support her family.  At the age of 20, she decided to leave her parents' home and now she is one of the most requested clothes sellers in the city of Pucallpa.  What she most enjoys about her work is chatting to her customers.  She has been in this business for 30 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to walk all day in search of customers.  Even so, she knows that this is her work and that she must do it.  In the future, Rosa would like to have a large store where she can sell her merchandise more comfortably.

This is Rosa's fourth loan from MFP and she hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Rosa will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more clothes so that she can increase the quantity of merchandise that she has available to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi, from the village of Kveda Simoneti, Terjola district, is a musician who sings in a local restaurant during the evening hours. He lives with his adult children: a 21-year-old daughter and a 20-year-old son and daughter-in-law.

Along with his main job, Giorgi is also actively involved in the family farming business which includes four milk cows and two calves. Giorgi sells approximately 800 liters of milk in the nearby town of Kutaisi.The family also has a six-hectare plot of the land upon which maize is grown. Harvested corn is used on the dairy farm to feed the livestock.

Giorgi is requesting a loan for the construction of a cattle shed, as the old one is too small for the existing livestock and won't accommodate any increase in the family's number of cows or calves. In the future, Giorgi plans to expand the farming activities by purchasing additional milk cows.

loans.use: to purchase materials for cattle-shed construction.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past five years, Esther has operated a clothes sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major goal is to establish a sales stall for her business. With her loan of 20,000 KES, Esther wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase medicine, such as antibiotics and vitamins, for his business.

loans.name: Riyad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has two children. 

Riyad has been the owner of a store since 2006, selling cosmetics, shoes and accessories for women. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 


He decided to apply for a loan to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floor and walls. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floor and walls.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 35 years old, from Kisumu, and is married to Lucy. They have three children who are all in school.

Michael has a paraffin business and is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD  to enable him buy more paraffin to add to his stock. 

He hopes to open up another paraffin base in the neighboring town.

loans.use: To buy more paraffin to add to his stock.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 21-year-old young woman. She is married and has one daughter. Her husband is employed in a concrete production company with a low salary. Nada wants to improve her family life by purchasing new home furniture but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $1,214.07 from FATEN. When Nada gets her FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase new home furniture and that will allow her family to live in better conditions. Nada is a conservative woman so her husband is photographed instead in the FATEN branch.

About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es: La clienta,  ARMINDA, vive con sus 2 hijos, la clienta se dedica a la producción de la leche cruda, actualmente cuenta con 5 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción, y 3 cabezas de ganado lechero preñadas. El destino del crédito es para comprar un tanque de enfriamiento, donde un grupo de personas están haciendo ese esfuerzo de comprar un tanque de enfriamiento, ya que la producción que sacan les queda muy lejos para ir a entregar, en ese sentido, será de mayor beneficio para la clienta y sus demás compañeras.   Actualmente la clienta vive en la localidad de Esquilan Chico que se encuentra en la Provincia de Quillacollo del Departamento de  Cochabamba.
texts.en: The member, Arminda, who lives with her two children, is a dairy producer and currently has five dairy cows in production, and three pregnant dairy cows.  The loan is to buy a cooling tank that will be used jointly by a group of people who are in the same business and who deliver their milk to customers far away. The tank will benefit the member and others.  The member currently lives in Esquilan Chico in the province of Quillacollo which is in the department of Cochabamba.

loans.use: To buy a milk cooling tank.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is 53 years old and is a married woman with six children. The oldest child is 29 years old while the youngest is only 5.

Emeliana and her husband work together to support their family. They are engaged in farming and fishing businesses. According to Emeliana, they have been growing and selling rice for 15 years. Emeliana's husband operates a fishing boat and she is the one who sells his catch.

Emeliana has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, fishing nets and hooks. Emeliana hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, fishing nets and hooks.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 51 years old. She is married with one child.

Carmelita has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Carmelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Carmelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Raeli

texts.en:
Raeli is a very hard working lady who has practiced mixed farming for over five years. She is 40 years old, married and has three children.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use part of the loan amount to buy farm inputs. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Arcele

texts.en:
Arcele is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Arcele has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Arcele has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Arcele hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 28 years old, married, and has two children, ages 4 and 7 years old. Her business is clean and good. She sells various goods such as drinks (water, juice, fanta, etc), sugar, biscuits, etc. She has two years of experience in this business and employs one person to help her. Her business runs from 6am until 9pm every day except Sunday.

Vestine has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as drinks (water, juice, fanta, etc), sugar, biscuits, etc to sell. With any profit from the loan, Vestine will expand her business and save for her family.

loans.use: to expand her boutique by purchasing various goods such as drinks (water, juice, fanta, etc), sugar, biscuits, etc to sell.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is from Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old, married and has three children. 

To earn a living, Lilibeth runs a general store, selling a variety of food items and household goods in the local community. Lilibeth has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month for these activities.

Lilibeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2010, Lilibeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve both her business and her living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve and/or to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Nema

texts.en:
Nema is a 35-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She has had a food stall business in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Nema is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, onions, and tomatoes. 

She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, onions, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 28 years old and a business lady. She is a single mother of one child. She has been selling nursery trees for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,500, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET after being introduced to the lending agency by a KADET staff member. Jane will use the loan to buy seedlings. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hope is to buy a piece of land and plant trees.

loans.use: To buy seedlings.

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
Norma, es casada, vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos, tienen casa propia, ella administra un cafetín desde hace 7 años, este lo inicio por ideas propias, las ventas las realiza a los estudiantes de centros escolares y personas que transitan el lugar desde las 7:00am hasta las 5.00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio como boquitas, galletas, pan, huevos, Lácteos y medicina, este crédito le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, fortaleciéndolo de mercadería para que los clientes encuentren lo que necesitan.
Su aspiración es mejorar su condición económica a través del préstamo, para tener una mejor solvencia económica frente  a sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Norma is married living with her husband and four children; they own their house.  She has been running a café for seven years that she started with her own ideas.  She sells to students from local schools and to people who pass by between 7am and 5pm.

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise for the business like snacks, cookies, bread, eggs, dairy products and medicine.  The loan will help her improve the business strengthening the merchandise so that customers can find what they need.

Her hopes are to improve her economic situation through the loan to have better economic solvency in face of her obligations.

loans.use: to buy snacks, cookies, bread, eggs, dairy products and medicine.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe Benkadi sont des hommes mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Ils vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames au KOLOMBADA, un des villages de la commune de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Ils sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante de la zone. 
Pour l’utilisation de ce prêt, KOKE, debout avec une chéchia blanche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 2 hectares environs de maïs.
La production est vendue au niveau de Fana, Marka-Coungo après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 300 000FCFA après la campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group "Benkadi" are married men averaging 45 years of age and five children each. The men live for the most part in polygamous families in KOLOMBADA, a village in Commune de Fana, in Dioïla Prefecture (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their fifth collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of carrying out their rainy season work. They grow corn exclusively, as it remains the dominant crop in the area. 

To put this loan to use, KOKE, who is standing in the photo and wearing a white fez, intends to buy supplies and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 2 hectares of corn. After the harvest, the produce is sold in Fana and in Marka-Coungo to a customer base composed of men and women. 

KOKE plans on making an average profit of about 300,000 francs CFA after the planting season. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and also to help out his extended family in meeting day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, weeding, and sundry farm equipment

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Don Ismael es cliente desde hace variomeses dentro de la institución por lo que es una persona que se puede platicar muy a gusto cuando le comentamos sobre su historia de éxito se emociono saber le tomaríamos la foto, es por eso que nos otorgo la entrevista en ella nos cuenta que tiene 37 años de edad vive en una comunidad mazahua que lleva por nombre San Agustín Mextepec está casado con la señora Guadalupe desde hace 16 años juntos han procreado 3 niños que van ala escuela.
Don Ismael tiene una zapatería desde hace que era niño el sabia como vender zapatos ya que sus padres fueron los fundadores del negocio y del mercado donde se venden los zapatos, pero ahora ya tiene un negocio propio que aunque viene de sus padres don Ismael es quien la atiende y se encarga de ella, Don Ismael esta solicitando el crédito para comprar más zapatos como, botas, tenis, zapatillas, sandalias, etc. para dama, caballero, niña y niños. Nos cuenta que le crédito le ayudara de mucho ya que podrá invertir mas en su negocio y mas que nada porque para Don Ismael se acercan las temporadas buenas y no tendrá que preocuparse en mucho tiempo para para comprar mercancía.
Sin embargo la dificultad a la cual presenta es muchas veces no vende y por falta de dinero no puede invertir mas en su negocio también porque acaba de pasar por la enfermedad de su esposa de eco también cuenta que le gusta mucho el campo tenia borregos y un sembradío de nopales, aunque los borregos los vendió para solventar los gastos que se originaban acusa de la enfermedad de sus esposo.
Pero Don Ismael es una persona muy trabajador responsable y tiene metas como echarle mugas ganas a su negocio de zapatos ya que recuerda que algún tiempo le fue muy bien en la venta de sus zapatos y quisiera  vender como antes para mejorar la calidad de sus hijos y esposa considera que por falta de dinero no puede levantarse pero hará todo lo posible para levantarse nuevamente.
Es un padre de familia muy trabajador por lo que esta muy agradecido con frac y kiva por el apoyo que le brindan y esperar no quedar mal.
texts.en:
Ismael has been a client of the institution for a few months. He is a person who can talk very comfortably when we comment on his history of success. He was excited knowing we would take the picture. This is why he gave us the interview. 

He tells us that he is 37 years old and lives in a Mazahua community called San Agustín Mextepec. He has been married to Guadalupe for 16 years, and together they have 3 children who attend school. Ismael has a shoe store. From the time he was a child, he knew how to sell shoes, since his parents were the founders of the business and of the market where they sell the shoes. Now he has his own business. Although it comes from his parents, Ismael is the one who tends to it and is in charge of it. Ismael is asking for the loan in order to purchase more shoes such as boots, tennis shoes, high heels, sandals, etc. for women, men, girls, and boys. 

He tells us that the loan will help him a lot since he will be able to invest more in his business and more than anything, the good seasons are coming and he will not have to worry about buying merchandise for a long time. Nevertheless, the difficulty he faces is that many times he doesn't sell and due to lack of money, he cannot invest more in his business.  He also recently got through his wife's illness. He also says that he likes the countryside a lot and had sheep and a field of cactus, although he sold the sheep to cover the costs resulting from the illness of his wife. 

But Ismael is a very hard-working and responsible person and he has goals, such as to put everything into his shoe business.  He remembers that his shoe sales were once very good, and he would like to sell like before in order to improve the quality of life for his children and wife. He thinks that due to lack of money he will not be able to raise himself up, but he will do everything possible to get himself ahead again. He is a very hard-working family man, and he is very grateful to FRAC and Kiva for the support they give him, and he hopes it does not turn out badly.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, boots, and tennis shoes for men and women

location.town: San Agustin San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti aged 40 years, is married and has been blessed with one child who has completed schooling. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a café business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentions that stiff competition has been her major challenge. She dreams of expanding her business to a big hotel in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase food stuff such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and tea leaves. She decided to join Yehu to access  loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase food stuff such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and tea leaves

loans.name: Libertad

texts.en: Libertad is an active member of Paglaum MPC since 2005 and access its programs and services including insurance services. Recently, she avails a loan to pay for tooth extraction and dentures.

loans.use: to pay for tooth extraction and dentures

loans.name: Elia

texts.en:
Elia lives in the community of Escobedo, in the province of Nuevo Leon. Some years ago she went through a difficult divorce. Six years ago, the last of her single chidlren was married and she was left alone without any support, with only whatever her children can sometimes offer to giver her. Following this worry she started to sell clothing, and this way be able to secure her daily sustenance. Things have not been at all easy for Elia, she has had to overcome many obstacles that life has bestowed on her, but thanks to her great character and her unquestionable integrity she has been able to keep going.

She now needs your help. She requires a loan of $925 to be able to complete the orders placed, and this way support herself. Elia plans to repay the full amont of the loan in a 6-12 month term. You can help her, don\'t leave her alone. She will forever be grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Elia vive en la comunidad de Escobedo, en el Estado de Nuevo León, ella hace algunos años vivió un difícil divorcio. Hace seis años el último de sus hijos solteros se casó y ella se quedo sola y sin ningún seguro, solo lo que eventualmente sus hijos pueden darle. Tras esta preocupación ella comenzó a vender ropa, y así poder asegurar su sustento diario. Las cosas no han sido nada fáciles para Elia, ha tenido que vencer muchos obstáculos que la vida le ha impuesto, pero gracias ha su gran carácter y a su indudable entereza ella ha logrados seguir adelante.

Ella ahora necesita de tu apoyo, pues requiere de un préstamo de $925 dólares para poder hacer frente a los pedidos que tiene, y así poder mantenerse sola. Elia planea cubrir el monto total del préstamo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes apoyarla, no la dejes sola, ella te lo agradecerá por siempre.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a father of 5 kids, two of whom are university students. His wife and children help him in his activity. He has a college degree and he has a goal to help all his kids to get university degrees.

He has experience in livestock for over 22 years. He started as a middleman between individuals who wanted to sell livestock and individuals who wanted to buy it. He used his profit wisely and over a certain period of time collected enough money to raise livestock himself. Currently he has two big cows and two calves. The next loan will be used to buy another two calves. Currently the prices are lower than other periods of the year.

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
C. Bosco has been an active member of Life in Africa since 2005. He currently works at the WE center as a gatekeeper and also participates in the paper bead production. Cieye also works with a Life in Africa partner (invisible children bracelets) as a sander. He is married and has 3 children.

He was forced to flee from northern Uganda to central Uganda due to Joseph Kony's rebel activities in his district. He lives with his family in the displaced persons camp known as Acholi Quarters. There, he earned some money working in the stone quarry. Since he came to Life in Africa, he has been able to provide much more for his family, and life has been much easier.

He is among the first LIA members who got a loan from Kiva, and he repaid it without any hardship! His loan request was for building a family house in Acholi Quarters on a plot the King of Buganda donated to the Acholi some years back. He did not actually use that loan to build a house in Acholi Quarters, but in his home district of Pader, since the situation in the north is not as alarming as it used to be. He felt he should own a house in his home district, though he will continue working in Kampala.

He built a three-room family house that is almost finished but is still lacking doors and windows. He is, therefore, seeking a loan amounting to 250,000 (US $150) so that he may own a house of his dreams. He will be able to repay this loan in 3 months with savings from his salaries that he earns from different sources.

Below is his budget:

-3 wooden doors @ 50,000/=……………150,000/=

-2 wooden windows @ 20,000/=…………40,000/=

-1 bag of cement @ 19,000/=………………19,000/=

-1 tin of paint @ 10,000/=……………………10,000/=

Labor @ 31,000/=…………………………………31,000/=

loans.use: Fixing doors and windows

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Far from downtown Ayacucho, Peru, on an unpaved road frequented by goats, chickens, and the occasional car, lives Julia H. T.. No more than 5 feet tall, Julia has a warm smile and plenty of jokes to tell. She opens the small, nondescript metal door to her grocery store that she has owned for more than 12 years. She has always worked in this same storefront near her home, but the shop today is far from where she began.

Julia is a busy mother of 7 children. Her husband is often away, working in agriculture in the “chacra,” or the countryside. Julia started selling beverages, such as water and soda, to supplement her husband’s meager income. Over the past decade, however, she has expanded the products she offers bit by bit. After beverages, she moved on to household cleaning supplies and snacks. A few years later, she began selling spices and canned goods. Most recently, she has begun selling rice, sugar, and flour, which have turned out to be her most popular items. She also has a large basket of kumquats, which she grows and picks in her own garden. These small orange fruits are very popular with the neighborhood whenever they are in season.

Julia hopes to receive a loan of $500. She would like to use this money to purchase more inventory of all of her items, to prevent selling out. She would also like to start selling fresh milk, which she thinks there is a demand for. She would use part of the money to purchase a cold case and test the new product.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of all of her items, and to purchase a cold case to start selling fresh milk.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
"I need to finish the construction of a protective fence in front of my house. I have young children and I feel they would be more secure." I am requesting $1200 to finish this construction.

“Necesito terminar la construcción de la barda de enfrente en mi vivienda ya que tengo hijos pequeños y siento que estarían más seguros” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para terminar la construcción de la barda.

loans.use: Complete the construction of a protective fence

loans.name: Angwi Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a widow with two children all below the age of 15 years. As an unemployed single mother, she has not found it easy providing for these children.

With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA) she plans to invest in sales of water fufu and ‘’ndzah.’’ Water fufu is grated and fermented cassava while ndzah is the local name for certain fruit, in most cases huckleberries.

The profit will enable her to pay school fees for her children and buy food for them. She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: Purchase of ndzah, water fufu

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his clothing business.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.en:
Virgen D. las Mercedes is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari project, which provides its credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations, being a very mountainous area (the altituD. ranges from 6,000 to 17,000 feet above sea level), the cold, the difficulty of growing crops and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR Virgen D. las Mercedes has its base in the capital of the province of Churcampa, which is located at over 10,000 feet above sea level. Currently the bank has completed 2 loan cycles in just one year of existence with 17 female borrowers. Some of the group members live in small communities outsiD. the city of Churcampa, in places like El Carmen and Chupas, more than an hour of walking distance away.

The members of the bank, during their one year in FINCA Peru, besides having learned to be responsible and punctual, are learning more and more about savings and how to invest their loans. The group was able to save over 5,500 soles (about $1,800) in the first 2 loan cycles and will continue to save in the future. For all members, the main use of the savings is for the education of their children: buying school uniforms, supplies, books and even to pay for entering primary or secondary school. Another dream they have for the use of their savings is to be able to make renovations to their houses, like constructing another floor or changing the roof to a more sustainable one.

All members have different enterprises, ranging from raising guinea pigs, having a kiosk with sweets and juices close to the primary school, selling food and ice creams, buying and selling small animals, selling potatoes, selling chicken or having grocery stores.

Every member has a different testimony, as is the case of 36-year-old Mary O. C., who has a small grocery store in the central square of Churcampa, where she also sells homemaD. sweets. As with many women, she has more than one occupation: she also buys and sells chicken. The chicken she buys in a major city that is more than 8 hours away by public transport. Her dream is to grow her business and keep on saving to be able to pay for the education of her 3 children. Her new loan she will use for buying more groceries for her store.

Another story is the one of Edith A. G., who has a grocery store and buys and sells small animals like sheep and lamb. Those are the businesses she runs during the whole year, but living in a rural area, she also has fields of corn and is waiting for the harvest in May to be able to sell her corn. Her new loan she will invest in buying more small animals.

As the women of the group have different businesses, different businesses require different loans. The loans range from 200 soles, 400 soles, and 600 soles up to 1200 soles, and the total of the loans reaches 8,900 soles among the 17 members.

loans.use: As the women of the group have different businesses, different businesses require different loans. The loans range from 200 soles, 400 soles, and 600 soles up to 1200 soles, and the total of the loans reaches 8,900 soles among the 17 members.

loans.name: Maria Griselda

texts.en:
Maria Griselda T. R. runs a general store from her home in the rural town of Jepelacio, San Martin. In the store, she sells basic commodities, such as rice, oil, pasta, sugar, milk, beer, and soda. Her customers are happy they don’t need to walk across town to the main market when they need a common product. She started the business 4 years ago with $100 to help improve her family’s economic situation. It has turned out to be a wise investment as her business has steadily grown.

Maria is 56 years old and married with 6 children. Her children are all grown and the profits of her business help fund her grandchildren’s educations. She is happy she started her business and personally feels much more comfortable with her family’s situation.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Responsables, Maria is requesting a loan of $525 (s/1500) to repay over 4 months. With the loan, she will buy more rice, sugar, candy, milk, beer, and soda to sell in her store.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more rice, sugar, candy, milk, beer, and soda to sell in her store.

loans.name: Elsi

texts.en: Elsi is a teacher who earns only $50 a month, and her husband, who is also a teacher earns $80.  With two children all in school, the couple’s income does not meet family expenses.  Elsi started a utensils-selling business to supplement their salaries.  She operates her business in the afternoon after classes.  Elsi is requesting a loan of $150 so she can invest in her business and earn more income.  Elsi is 29 years old and married with 2 children.

loans.use: To invest in her small business.

loans.name: Thị Lý

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Ly, 56 years old, want to borrow 2.006.000 VND to buy foodstuff for her breeding pigs. Pig-breeding is the main source of income for her family, with a smaller part coming from her daily reselling of groceries. One of her children is currently a carpenter and also helping out her family while her husband help her in breeding and reselling. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Danh, 49 years old, need to borrow 2.006.000 VND to buy nitrogenous fertilizer for the field. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Anh, 24 years of age and Mrs. Nguyen Thi Cam, 22 years old, both would like to borrow 560.000 each to buy fertilizers for their rice field. Mr. Nguyen Van Giang, now 61 years old, is asking for 2.006.000 VND to aid his pig-breeding and his cultivated crops.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị N. Thị Lý (MS: 06020001), năm nay 56 tuổi, chị chăn nuôi để tạo thu nhập cho gia đình, ngoài ra chị còn bán hàng khô để có thêm thu nhập hàng ngày, 1 con chị đã đi làm mộc để tạo thu nhập cho gia đình còn chồng chị ở nhà phụ giúp chi trong việc chăn nuôi và bán hàng. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn và mua cám cho lợn. Chị N. Thị Dành (MS: 06020002), năm nay 49 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND mua phân đạm để trồng trọt. Chị N. Thị Ánh (MS: 06020003), năm nay 24 tuổi, vay 560.000 VND mua phân đạm trồng lúa. Chị N. Thị Cam (MS: 06020004), năm nay 22 tuổi, vay 560.000 VND mua phân đạm để trồng lúa. Anh N. Văn Giang (MS: 06020005), năm nay 61tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn mua phân bón cho cây trồng.

loans.use: Chăn nuôi và trồng trọt

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is forty years old, and she and her husband have four children who go to school. She has been cooking specialty fried dishes for a long time in her community. Petronila explains that she started this business when she realized that her husband’s job couldn’t help him to support all of the expenses of the family.

“There’s a lot to be said for running this business”, she says.

Actually, it’s easier to pay the children's school tuitions and the rental of her house. Petronila dreams of buying her own house in the upcoming of years, so she can provide a comfortable lifestyle for her children.

She’ll use her loan to buy ingredients to keep producing her tasty fried dishes and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy the ingredients for her fried dishes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goods for her store.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mrs. Eng N. is a villager in Kbal Domrey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a Khmer noodle maker and seller. Her husband, Mr. Sovann Pin, is a fisherman and pig breeder (pictured on the left). Mr. Sovann Pin faces a small problem with his pig-breeding business because he does not have enough money to buy pig food. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Eng N., asked for a loan for her husband’s business. Mrs. Eng N. is 53 and the mother of five children, three of whom are fishermen while the remaining two are pig breeders.

loans.use: to buy pig food for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Ni Ayu Putu Astiti

texts.id:
Although still young as a mother, Ayu Putu did not take life easy. Moreover with the tight economic condition deteriorating and her 2 children still young made Ayu Putu decide to be diligent in pig farming which has been a family tradition since generations. Her husband’s income as a farmer is felt to be not sufficient to provide for the family’s expenses. With the motivation to assist her husband Ayu Putu decided to borrow from DINARI through the KIVA program to increase her capital to fund her pig farming. With the initial loan 4 breeding pigs Ayu once again purchase 5 pigs with the loan from DINARI. Coincidentally, Ayu’s pig pen are adequately permanent adequate to accommodate many pigs. Ayu is very serious in the pig farming because income from the sale is large. After 5 months of breeding usually result in income of Rp.500.000,- (about USD 54) each month. This will definitely aid fulfilling the family’s expenses.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.
