Meski masih berusia muda untuk seorang ibu rumah tangga, tidak membuat Ayu Putu bersantai-santai dengan kehidupannya. Apalagi dengan himpitan ekonomi yang semakin berat dan ditambah harus menghidupi kedua anaknya yang masih kecil-kecil membuat Ayu Putu memutuskan untuk menekuni usahanya sebagai peternak babi yang memang sudah digeluti oleh keluarganya secara turun temurun. Penghasilan suaminya yang seorang petani dirasa masih belum cukup memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Dengan motivasi membantu suaminya inilah Ayu Putu memutuskan untuk meminjam ke DINARI melalui program KIVA sehingga modalnya akan bertambah untuk usaha ternak babinya. Dengan modal awal 4 ekor babi penggemukan Ayu kembali membeli 5 ekor lagi dengan menggunakan modal dari DINARI. Kebetulan kandang babi Ayu sudah cukup permanen sehingga mampu menampung banyak babi. Ayu memang sangat serius menekuni usaha ternak babinya karena keuntungan yang didapat cukup besar dari hasil penjualannya. Selama 5 bulan pemeliharaan nantinya diharapkan bisa mendatangkan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 500.000,- setiap bulannya. Tentunya hal ini akan sangat membantu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya.

loans.use: Purchase piglets and supplies (Membeli anak babi dan pakannya)

loans.name: Maria Fabiola

texts.es: La señora Maria Fabiola V., tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad que cursa el tercer grado de primaria, no tiene ayuda economica del papa de su hijo, la actividad economica de la sñora es la comecializacion de cosmeticos como perfumes para hombres y mujeres y ropa variada como pantalones, blusas trajes, actividad que tiene seis años  de desarrollar la cual da inicio como una alternativa al desempleo y aprovechando el apoyo de un familiar en el exterior ha ido creciendo poco a poco en capital, siendo su sueño poder instalar un tiene de ropa para niños y adultos, y su proposito poder satisfacer la demanda, y darle un mejor porvenir a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Fabiola V., is 31 years of age, is a single mother of an 8 year old child who attends the third grade. She does not receive financial help from her son’s father. The economic activity she engages in is the marketing of cosmetics such as fragrances for men and women; she also sells a variety of clothing such as trousers, blouses and suits. It has been six years since she developed this business which began as an alternative to unemployment. She has been slowly growing her capital by drawing on the support from a relative that lives abroad. Her dream is to install a clothing store for children and adults to meet the demand from her customers; this will allow her to give her son a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Hace varios años atrás, Fortunata  tuvo la idea de vender bebidas heladas en su domicilio, a pesar de tener ciertas limitaciones por no contar con un lugar propicio para la venta de cerveza, ella misma acondicionó un espacio libre sin mesas ni muebles, pero igual vende estos productos, espera que con el tiempo esta situación pueda mejorar y adquirir bienes útiles para su negocio.Los pobladores demandan su servicio por su amabilidad y buen trato, que es lo que resalta en su negocio, y es uno de los mejores de la zona.Por ello, Fortunata quiere tener un local propicio para la venta de cerveza y poder así mejorar su negocio y su condición económica.Es así, que solicita un préstamo para mejorar su local e incrementar la cantidad de cervezas.
texts.en:
A few years ago Fortunata had the idea of selling chilled beverages from her home. In spite of having certain limitations, such as not having a proper place to sell beer, she herself remodeled an open space, without tables or furniture, but where nevertheless she sells these products. She hopes that with time this situation will improve and she will be able to acquire useful goods for her business. The neighbors demand her service due to her friendliness and good customer service, which is what makes her business successful and one of the best in the area. Fortunate wants to have her own proper locale to sell beer and in this way be able to improve her business and her economic condition. So she is seeking a loan to improve her local and increase the quantity of beer.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her business and increase the number of bottles of beer

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch R. is a villager in Rolos Village in Takeo Province. She owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. She is a farmer.

On her plantation she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile, which makes it difficult to grow her crops.

Her husband Mr. Chhouk Mon is a construction worker who earns only a small salary.

In order to fix her field, Mrs. Touch R. has decided to ask for a loan so she can hire laborers with two oxen to plow her field. She will also buy fertilizers and pesticides to support her field and make her crops more productive.

She is 49 years old and the mother of three children. One child is a construction worker. The other two children attend the local school.

Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers to plow the field and buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es:
La señora MARISA es socia del Banco Comunal  “LA MUJER RIOJANA” y vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Rioja. Se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida tipo menú así como también pollos a la brasa. Esta actividad la realiza en el jr Santo Toribio Nº 835, lugar donde diariamente acuden su comensales, los cuales son moradores de la propia localidad o transeúntes de lugares cercanos. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar por sacos, fideos en paquetes, aceite a granel, huevos en jabas, también quiere comprar un televisor grande para que sus clientes se entretengan y poder brindarles un mejor servicio.  
    
La señora MARISA tiene 38 años de edad, vive con sus 03 hijos, dos de ellos aún estudian y dependen de ella y que son la razón para luchar cada día. Más adelante desea tener su propio local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marisa is part of the communal bank The Riojana Woman. She lives in the San Martin region, province of Rioja. She prepares and sells sit-down meals as well as grilled chicken. She does this at Jr. Santo Toribio N 835, where customers come every day to dine. These people are local residents or visitors from nearby places. With this loan of $500, which will be paid back in six months, Marisa will purchase rice, sacks of sugar, packets of pasta, cooking oil in bulk, and eggs. She also wants to buy a big-screen television to entertain her customers and better serve them. Mrs. Marisa is 38 years old and lives with her three children, two of whom are still in school and depend on her so that she much fight (for economic purposes) every day. Someday she hopes to have her own place of business in the city's center.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients as well as a television for her restaurant

loans.name: Nusrat Faryad Hussain Group

texts.en:
My name is Nusrat and I am a 28-year-old married lady. I reside in a famous historical city named Yadgar of City Lahore, Pakistan. I own a two-room brick house and have been living in it with my family for the last 10 years. I studied until the fifth grade. My husband's name is F. H., and he is a driver by profession and drives a horse cart. He uses this cart to pick up and drop off the people for a fare. I have four kids: three daughters and one son. All of my children are getting an education in a local school near to the community. I sew clothes for my neighbors and earn a profit. I share my income with my husband to help him relax in some way. I am applying for a loan to buy a horse cart because the old ones became rough. 

I am a group leader of a few more women of my locality. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to resell. Bushra baji and Sajida baji each want a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, flour and cooking oil) for their food businesses. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a horse cart

loans.name: Sroin

texts.en: Mrs. Sroin K. was born in 1959 and she now lives in Andoung village in Kampong Cham province. She owns a small grocery store in the local market. With the business, she now faces small problem because she has difficulty buying more grocery product because of mobility. Thus, Mrs. Sroin K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, she will be able to travel to buy grocery products to re-sell. She has two children who are construction workers.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add to her saving to buy a motorbike in order to travel to buy grocery products to re-sell.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Originaire de l’OUEME, dame K. Jeanne est née en 1955 Gbodjè. Mère de 5 enfants dont deux garçons et trois filles, elle est mariée à GOUTON Adrien un chauffeur de taxi. Le couple vit à Agbodjèdo un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou depuis 25 ans où la dame exerce l’activité de la vente des condiments, des divers, du maïs en détail etc. Elle est à son 3ième crédit. Elle sollicite un prêr pour renforcer son activité.


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Ms. Jeanne K. is from OUEME but was born in Gbodjè in 1955. She is the mother of five children (two boys and three girls) and is married to Adrien GOUTON, a taxi driver. For 25 years, this couple has been living in Agbodjèdo, an outlying district of the city of Cotonou. There, she is in the business of selling condiments, various goods, corn, etc. at the retail level. She is on her third loan, which she is requesting to bolster her business.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments, various goods, and sacks of corn

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom S., 32, is married and lives in the Prey Veng province with her three children. She works in a grocery store, making around US$5 each day. Her husband, pictured here, typically makes US$7 every day as a trailer driver. 

Inflation has driven up prices all across Cambodia and many Cambodians have faced economic struggles. Tom S. has approached CREDIT for a loan of US$1,200 to diversify her grocery items. She feels that this investment can increase her income and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To diversify her grocery items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth B. is single and has four dependent children. Elizabeth has sold cloth in Kissi, near Elmina, since 2003.  Elizabeth is the sole provider of school fees and housekeeping money, so she uses her income to provide these things for her family. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase additional cloth to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to reinvest in her business so she can better provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy cloth to sell

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Абдулло - мужчина 45 лет. Женат. Имеет 6 детей. Живет в горной местности, в кишлаке Айри. Занимается откормом и продажей скота, потому, что в этих краях почти нету другой работы для мужчин и для женщин. Жена - домохозяйка. Занимается домашними делами и смотрит за своими детьми. Один сын в Российской Федерации - рабочий мигрант. Невестка сидит дома и смотрит за маленьким ребенком. Семья у них большая: состоит из 14 человек, которые живут в одном доме. Они должны постепенно разделятся, поэтому должны увеличить количество своего скота и делить между сыновьями. За счет кредита они хотят увеличить количество скота.
texts.en:
Abdullo is a 45-year-old man. He is married and has six children. He lives in a mountainous area, in the village of Ayri. He raises and sells cattle because in that area there is hardly any other work for either men or women. His wife is a housewife. She manages the home and looks after the children. One son is a migrant worker who works in Russia. Abdullo's daughter-in-law lives with them and cares for their grandchild. Their family is large, 14 people who all live in the same house. They would like to set up separate households, and therefore must increase the size of their herd in order to be able to divide it amongst the sons. They want to use the loan to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Zahida Parveen M. Nazir Group

texts.en:
Zahida parveen baji is the wife of M. N. A. khan and has resided in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 28 years. She completed her education up to 5th standard. Her husband is a driver by profession and drives a vehicle named “Shahzore”. He uses this vehicle to deliver different items (construction supplies & fruits & vegetables) from one place to another.

Zahida baji is the mother of three: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son is a welder and the younger son works in a factory for a monthly wage. Her daughter reads in 10th standard. Zahida baji operates a clothes selling business. She buys clothes from the city of Multan and sells in her native city Lahore. She does this work to pay off the school fees of her daughter so that she will able to complete her 10th standard without any difficulty. She is applying for a loan to buy clothes to expand her clothes selling business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy material (sugar, cooking oil and dry fruits) for her sweetmeat selling business. Safia baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Qamar khanum baji wants a loan to buy another juicer machine for her juice corner. Khalida parveen baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita is a hardworking mother; she will sacrifice a lot and venture in any work to help her husband in improving their poor living situation. She thinks positively and works out the things that are good in the eye of other people around her.

Estrelita is 44 years old with seven children. Two of them are currently attending school. Her husband is a Barangay (district) leader who wants to become a good model to his constituents. 

Estrelita manages a vegetable vending business where she has a small stall that displays her products. Aside from vegetables, she also sells generic medicines. To further improve her business, she wants to borrow PHP 12,000 that will serve as additional working capital for her business.

loans.use: To uses as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo vive en la zona Bautista Saavedra, calle German Jordán  de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposa y sus  hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, en su casita propia ubicada en una zona periférica de la ciudad.

La Pareja se dedica a la confección de overoles (ropa de trabajo de uso en fabricas, talleres etc.) los cuales vende en la ciudad de Oruro, y una pequeña parte los vende en la feria principal de la ciudad de el Alto..
 
El crédito lo destinara, en la compra de tela al por mayor y asi  incrementar su producción, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Eduardo lives in the Bautista Saavedra zone in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and children who are of school age in a their own small house located in a zone adjacent to the city. The couple dedicates themselves to making overalls (clothing used in factories, garages, etc.), which they sell in the city of Oruro, and a small part is sold in the principal market of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase wholesale fabric to increase their production, and in that same manner their income. This is his second loan with Impro, and the evaluation carried out qualifies him to be approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase wholesale fabric).

loans.name: Joahna

texts.en:
Mrs.B. is residing at Poblacion Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old, married and blessed with only 1 child who is still an infant.She owns and operates a business venture by raising pigs for sale. She has been engage in this business for more than 5 years and earns 18,000.00 for every 5 months.
She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mrs. B. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 25,000.00 PHP which will be used to buy additional piglets to raise,and feeds.This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Joahna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.

loans.use: To purchase additional feeds and baby pigs to raise

loans.name: Laura Dina

texts.es: Laura Dina R. R. de 40 años de edad  vive el departamento de Ahuachapán. Laura posee de negocio una venta de madera, su local está ubicado en una buena zona ya que tiene buen acceso a sus clientes y camiones que llegan a cargar madera. Laura posee un excelente record creditico ya que su negocio le permite una buena estabilidad económica, el crédito que Laura solicita es para la compra de todo tipo de madera, de esta manera lograra aumentar sus ingresos y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Laura Dina Rodriguez R. is 40 years old and lives in the department of Ahuchapan. Laura has a business selling wood, her store is located in a good area because it provides easy access to her clients and trucks that come to carry wood. Laura has a great credit record because her business gives her financial stability, the loan Laura is requesting is to buy all kinds of wood, so she can keep on increasing her income and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy all kinds of wood

loans.name: Reny

texts.en: Reny is a mother of two children, Warren and Lawren. She serves as a simple housewife while managing a typical village store in their house. She is married to Walden B., a 42-year-old farmer. While doing her house chores daily, Reny is also manages her store in order to gain income for her family's necessities and to provide her children with their daily allowances in school. They live peacefully and happily despite the difficulties of life. Her dream is to become a successful business woman. That’s why she always works hard and is very patient with every challenge of life. She hopes that her business progresses in the future so that she will able to improve their poor living situation. That is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva of PHP 18, 000. She will use funds as additional business capital for her to develop a better business in the future.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL CAPITAL

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo sells drinks and she has been in this business for the past seven years. She is requesting the loan of N140,000 to purchase drinks to sell, so as to be able to meet the demands of her customers. Her customers appreciate knowing that she will always have what they need. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Janet is 62years old she is divorced and mother of five children. One is a trader whiles the rest of the children are farming in their inherited farmland. She is resourceful mother who works very hard to provide food and support for her business.  She is a petty trader and sells at the community market square; she enjoys selling, a business through which she makes a living. She sells items like cooking oil, pepper, spices, toilet soap etc. on top of a table in the market. She takes stock of goods from the Kumasi central market which is a nearby city and her surrounding communities for the vegetables. She is requesting for the loan to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, spices, pepper, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a 34-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their child.

Suzan owns a hairdressing salon and she also sells beauty products. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new equipment and beauty products for her work. This is her third loan and she has always repaid on time.

Suzan is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and is aware of new hairstyles. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Suzan decided on doing her business because of her experience and when she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. In the future, she plans on expanding her work.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and beauty products

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda I. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del sur. She is 32 years old. Rosenda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosenda owns & operates a "sari-sari" retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Rosenda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosenda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosenda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mrs. Kheang Srey Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Kheang S. is the bank president in Aopheasang village in Takeo province. She has been selected as president by the nine member group requestI. this loan. Mrs. Kheang S. is a beautician who is hired to do make-up at weddings, ceremonies, parties, etc. Aside from her beautician business, she also works as a tailor and would like to expand it by purchasI. more material to support her sewI.. Her husband, Mr. Mao Kimly, is a farmer who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice. Mrs. Kheang S. is 46 years old and the mother of three children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy material to sew for her customers.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: A small-sized wooden house in Kampong Chhnang is the location of Mrs. Nhem M.'s home and grocery store. She usually buys produce in bulk from a market supplier and sells it from her house. Normally, she can make an average income of $6.00 per day. She has been running her business since early 2000. Nhem M. is a single woman who tries to earn money for herself. Nhem M.'s investment is her main source of income and she recently sold all of the produce in her store. Therefore, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 49 years old, married to Beatrice N., and they have three school-going children. He operates his butcher shop in Naivasha town and has done so for four years now.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be his second loan. He repaid his first loan well.  He plans to restock his butchery with more beef, as he has only been dealing with goat meat. This will help him serve other clients who prefer beef over goat meat.

His future hopes are to buy a vehicle which he will use as a taxi offering transport to various destinations.

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy beef to sell

loans.name: Amil

texts.en:
This photo is of Amil S., a young man who plays the "tar" which is a national musical instrument in Azerbaijan. This talented 21-year-old man plays the tar at weddings. He has been in this business for three years.
Amil lives in the Fuzuli region and is single. 
He plans to go to weddings and to also play the guitar. Therefore he is applying to Kiva for a loan of 2000 AZN to buy a guitar to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy a guitar

loans.name: Forever Living Group

texts.en:
Thomas M., age 36, is married and has one 4-year-old child.  He has had a business making telephone repairs for four years now and he is able to earn a monthly profit of around $419.

This will be Thomas’s first loan, called a motisha loan, from Tujijenge Tanzania.  Thomas hopes to obtain a loan to buy software, a computer and a blower.
	
Thomas will share this loan with his loan group, which totals 16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.  In the picture, Thomas is the man in a red T-shirt.

loans.use: To buy software, a computer and a blower

loans.name: Wafeek

texts.en:
Wafeek is a 53-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their five children. Wafeek has been working as carpenter for over 30 years. Wafeek requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase wood for his work. This is his fourth loan and he has always repaid on time. 

Wafeek distinguishes himself by his skilled and precise work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. He decided to start his business because he wanted to work independently and had experience in carpentry.

loans.use: To purchase wood for his business

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: F. Delphine est née en 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à GBETCHOU Robert, Delphine est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Delphine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Agbato à Cotonou, depuis environs 5 ans. Delphine vient en aide à son mari pour assurer les besoins de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Delphine  n’a pas été à l’école. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Delphine vend divers produits (couscous, lait, œufs, riz, dentifrices, comprimés, etc.) à son domicile. Delphine vend également des liqueurs à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de multiplier ses sources de revenus. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Delphine s’approvisionne. Delphine exerce son activité depuis environs sept ans, mais n’a encore jamais bénéficié de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité afin de mieux satisfaire la demande nombreuse des clients, Delphine sollicite un premier prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Delphine F. was born in 1978 in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. Delphine is married to Robert Gbetchou and the mother of four school-aged children. Delphine and her husband and children have been living in the Agbato quarter of Cotonou for the last five years. She helps her husband meet their family's needs with the income generated from her business. Delphine never attended school. To cover expenses, she sells various products (couscous, milk, eggs, rice, toothpaste, pills) from her home. She also sells liquor from her home, which allows her to increase her source of income. Delphine gets her provisions at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She has had her business for roughly seven years, but has yet to benefit from an ALIDé loan. Delphine is soliciting her first loan from ALIDé with the intention of expanding her business to better suit the needs of her many clients.

Translated from French by Owen Frivold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of liquor and various products  (cans, sugar, milk).

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthol S. is 42 years old and her husband, Mr. Ty Bouy, is 50 years old. They are both in the photo. They have been married since 1983 and have eight children: five sons and three daughters. Two of their children are drivers, two others work in the garment factory and three attend school. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.


Chanthol and her husband have been farming for 27 years. They grow vegetables on their farmland. They hope to expand their productivity, so Chanthol is asking for her first loan of US$300 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her vegetable farm.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Samini Ngumbao

texts.en:
Samini is a 41 year old single lady with two children: Mwanjinji and Dickson. 
She is in the green grocery business and she has been in this business for nine years in New market-Malindi. She gets a monthly profit of KES 14,000 a month. She also does some farming on the side. Her target customers are households of Malindi town who come to the market.
She was introduced to Kadet by the chairperson of her group. 
With the extra income from this loan, Samini hopes to save for her children’s education.
Samini is a hardworking woman who dreams of building a house and settling down in a quiet place in the future.

loans.use: Setting up a charcoal Kiosk with KES 20,000, Adding stock in her grocery shop with KES 20,000 and renovating her business premises with KES 5000

loans.name: Ludth

texts.es:
La Sra. Ludith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando. La Socia presenta Secundaria Completa.
Su fuerza y anhelo emprendedor y teniendo la habilidad de la costura no dudo en implementar su propio taller de confección de  ropas interiores, ubicado en su misma casa en un ambiente amplio y acondicionado para atender a sus clientes que a diario acuden hacer sus pedidos. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.
Con este préstamo de S/ 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Ludith, se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
La Sra. Ludith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando. La Socia presenta Secundaria Completa. Su fuerza y anhelo emprendedor y teniendo la habilidad de la costura no dudo en implementar su propio taller de confección de ropas interiores, ubicado en su misma casa en un ambiente amplio y acondicionado para atender a sus clientes que a diario acuden hacer sus pedidos. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente. Con este préstamo de S/ 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. Ludith, se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que quieren crecer empresarialmente.

Translated from Spanish by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará telas en metros de diferentes especies para surtir su negocio.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia S.'s main source of income comes from selling "RTW" (Ready-To-Wear) items, dry goods, mats and other products in her community. She is 64 years old, married and has seven grown-up children. She is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. Anastacia has been in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Anastacia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Anastacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Anastacia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria H. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su hijito de tres meses de edad.
La señora Maria es empleada en un restaurante de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia. 
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una habitación en su vivienda, la misma cedida en obra gruesa por sus padres.
Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
María H. and her three-month-old son share her parents’ house in the Pasankeri neighborhood of La Paz. She uses her earnings as a restaurant employee to support her family. She is asking for funds to complete a room on her dwelling that her parents have given her still in rough state. This is her 4th loan and the socioeconomic evaluation she underwent indicates that she qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room for more comfort for herself and her son.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe E. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Fe owns and operates a specialized retail business, buying and selling rice in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Lina Marcela A. es una joven diseñadora de 24 años vive en Bogotá, su negocio es diseñar bolsos, calzados que manda a fabricar y luego promociona mediante su guía especializada. 

Hace 2 años   incursionó en el medio para el cual se había preparado e inició  su propia línea de sandalias y zapatos, que actualmente distribuye en las ciudades de Barranquilla, en el departamento del Atlántico, Valledupar y el Municipio de Codazzi en el departamento del Cesar, así fue como con  la ayuda de su familiares y amigos de confianza en Septiembre del 2009  viajó a Bogotá a vivir en casa de una hermana y desde ese momento abrió su venta de bosos y zapatos por catálogos, con su propia marca “LinA.”   dándole buenos resultados  en su negocio que es el diseño, la distribución y venta de calzado. En la actualidad está solicitando su primer crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues quiere mayor apertura de su mercado y necesita comprar en volumen materia prima especialmente cuero, para la fabricación de  bolsos y zapatos en su nueva colección.
 
Lina es una joven que sueña  con  crecer profesional y empresarialmente mente para ayudar a su familia, además quiere  tener su propio taller y  tiendas  de calzado con empleados. Pues en algunas ocasiones  enfrenta el desafío de incumplimiento en la fabricación de sus diseños.
texts.en:
Lina Marcela A. is a young 24-year old designer who lives in Bogotá. Her business involves designing handbags and shoes that she then has made and promotes through her specialized catalog. It has been 2 years since she entered into the arena that she prepared for, and started her own line of sandals and shoes. She currently distributes these in the city of Barranquilla, in the Atlántico department, Valledupar, and the Codazzi municipality in the Cesar department. This is how, with the help of trusted family and friends, she traveled to Bogotá in September of 2009 to live with her sister. Since that instance, she started selling bags and shoes by catalog from her own line called “LinA.”, with good results. Her business includes the design, distribution and sale of footwear. Currently, she is requesting her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, as she would like greater access to her markets. She needs to buy a greater quantity of raw materials, especially leather, in order to make the handbags and shoes in her new collection. Lina is a young woman who dreams of growing as a professional and entrepreneur in order to help her family. In addition, she would like to have her own workshop and shoe stores staffed by employees. In some instances, she has faced the challenge of her designs not being fabricated.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy prime material in volume, especially leather, for making the handbags and shoes in her new collection.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Don Manuel es  un padre de familia de dos  hijos, de 34 años de edad, junto a su esposa administran una pequeña pulpería que desde hace varios años logro poner, con apoyo económico de su papa. Su casa es pequeña parte de concreto y madera, al poner la pulpería le quedo poco espacio para su privacidad, lo cual desea construir al lado un pequeño local para poner sola la pulpería y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Y lograr estar cómodo con esta mejora. Entre las dificultades se le ha hecho difícil desde que se le robaron su caballo el cual era el medio de transporte para vender y hacer las compras.
Comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y madera para hacer el local. 
Con los financiamientos ha logrado las mejoras a largo plazo, lo que ha venido a mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 34-year-old father of two children. He and his wife run a small local store which they were able to open with the economic support of his father several years ago. Their home is small, part concrete and part wood. When they opened the store there, they did not have much space left for privacy; so they want to build a small area next to their home for the store, in order to offer better service to their customers. They will live more comfortably with this improvement. Among other problems, it has been difficult for them since their horse was stolen, as it was a mode of transportation to buy and sell merchandise. With this loan they will buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, iron and wood to build their store. With previous loans they have made long-term improvements to their house, which have improved the infrastructure of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials for a store

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en: Crisanta P. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 59 years old, is widowed, and has nine adult children. Crisanta owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Crisanta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
La señora Edelmira tiene 52 años de edad, está casada hace mas de 25 años, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales  algunos viven con ella y otros ya formaron su propia familia.
 La señora Edelmira emigró de la ciudad de Caraguataity a un populoso barrio de la ciudad de Itá hace 21 años en busca de mejorar su nivel de vida.
Una vez instalada en dicha ciudad abrió una pequeña despensa donde surte a sus vecinos y a ocasionales de carne, leche, azúcar, yerba, bebidas en general, panificados y otros insumos de primera necesidad para el hogar hace mas de 15 años.
El préstamo que solicita en esta ocasión es para la compra de los citados insumos a modo a aumentar su stock de mercaderías y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Edelmira, 52, has been married for over 25 years. She has 7 children some of whom still live with her and some who have formed their own families. Edelmira moved from the city of Caraguataity to a crowded neighborhood in the city of Itá 21 years ago seeking to improve her living conditions. Once established in this city, she opened a small grocery store over 15 years ago where she provides her neighbors and drop-in customers with meat, milk, sugar, herbs, beverages, baked goods and other basic items for the home. The loan she is requesting on this occasion will be used to buy the items listed above in order to increase her stock inventory thereby improving family income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, assorted beverages and other merchandise.

loans.name: Janeth Guadalupe

texts.es:
Janeth Guadalupe G. G. tiene 35 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  tiene 4  hijos, Jairo (17), Boris (16), Evelin (13) y Mishel (11), vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Janeth es una socia de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Janeth dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Bucay y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en semillas para sus cultivos. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra de una casa. Enfrenta desafíos son el clima y las enfermedades.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Janeth Guadalupe G. G. is 35 years of age. She is married and lives with her husband and children. She has 4 children: Jairo (17), Boris (16), Evelin (13) and Mishel (11). She lives in the village fo Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. Janeth is an associate of the 'King of Kings' rural branch, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 associates in all. The majority are dedicated to agriculture. This is the first loan that she has requested from the San José Cooperative. Janeth is dedicated to agriculture, sowing corn. She carries out her purchases each month in Bucay y sells her produce in the same location. She requests a loan to buy seeds for sowing. She thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to have money to buy a house. She faces challenges such as the weather and diseases. She likes to listen to music.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds to sow

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia T. is from the village of Tabon. She is 59 years old. Bonifacia is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Bonifacia owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Bonifacia has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Bonifacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bonifacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Bonifacia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Bonifacia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea N. is a long-time businesswoman and a low-income person. She has been operating a grocery business since the beginning of 2005. In front of her home, she owns a kiosk where she sells different kinds of materials, including cooking ingredients, cleaning products and some snack foods, to people in her village. Chea N. is married to 52-year-old Cheng Taiy, who is a fish-raiser. The couple is blessed with six children, two of whom are now married. In order to earn extra profits and to make the business more successful, Chea N. will be using the loan she requested to increase her inventory. (Mrs. Chea N.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Adolyn

texts.en:
Adolyn O. lives in the village of Catibac, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 29 years old, married and has three school-aged children. For the last three years, she has made a living selling snacks and other delicacies. She earns about 4,800 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Adolyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan, her first, for 5,000 PHP to buy the ingredients she needs to make her products. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve and expand her small business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients she needs to make items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Antonia Magali

texts.es: Antonia Magaly tiene 35 años su actividad es la venta de artesanía. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella tiene 3 hijos menores de edad  de 16, 13 y 11 años respectivamente con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado que estudien. Ella se levanta muy temprano desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, que llega a su vivienda a realizar las tareas del hogar. Este financiamiento es para la compra de más artesanía.
texts.en:
Antonia Magaly is 35 years old and she sells traditional crafts. For more than 15 years he has had this business. She has 3 young children, aged 16, 13, and 11 years old. With great effort she has managed to send them all to school. She starts her days very early in the morning at 7a.m. and works until 8 in the evening. After work she comes home to take care of the household chores. This loan will be used to purchase more crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Josphine Ndunge

texts.en:
Josphine Ndunge M. is 40 years old, single, and has four children who range in age from 25 to seven years old. They live in the town of Kitale, Kenya, where Josphine makes a living running a grocery store. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns Kshs. 15,000 per month.

Josphine is applying for her third loan, for Kshs. 50,000, to buy fruit to sell to her customers.

In the future, she hopes to own a truck and earn enough money to provide all of her children with a first-class education.

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell to her customers

loans.name: Naomi Adjoa Essoun

texts.en:
Naomi Adjoa Essoun A. sells provisions. Naomi has been through junior high school.  She is married and lives together with her children. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more provisions for resale. She hopes to educate her children with the additional income which will be generated from the loan.

In this photograph, Naomi is standing infront of her provision cage with some few provisions on display.

loans.use: buy more provisions for resale

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa S. is 27 years old and he is the head in a family of five people (including himself).  He is married and his spouse does not contribute to the family’s total income.  He has two children aged four and two years.  


Musa runs a hotel where he sells cooked foods and snacks to customers who are within his business location. He has been in business for two years and he earns a monthly income of Kshs. 5,000. He has just borrowed a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to purchase more hotel stock which included the charcoal for cooking, the vegetables and flour which is needed to prepare the food he sells and others. He will use the anticipated profit from the business to open another hotel. This is his second loan and his previous loan was successfully paid back. 


His hopes to open a retail shop in future.

loans.use: To purchase more hotel stock.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza B. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 34 years old. Analiza is married and has 2 children aged 7 and 8. To make a living, Analiza owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and daily use products. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Analiza joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Analiza from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Kintei Ole Tingoi

texts.en:
Kintei Ole has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last nine years.  He is 38 years old, married to Muinante Ene Kuntei, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy 15 sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Kintei hopes to increase the number of animals that he rears to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: C2855 Abisunganye Group

texts.en:
Francois is 27 years old and married with two children and two dependents.  He is the president of a group called “Abisunganye” and they all own separate businesses selling a variety of goods including spare parts, secondhand clothing, foodstuffs, etc. Francois sells spare parts for bicycles.

Francois would like to use this loan to help build a small shop from which to run his business. Any profits from the improved business will be used to pay school fees and provide for the basic needs of his family.

Abisunganye Group thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more produce and build a small shop.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: El señor Luis Manuel tiene 45 años, es casado y tiene tres hijos menores de edad a su cargo. El señor se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, es una persona muy responsable  y padre de familia que se hace cargo de su familia. El ya tiene 10 años de  dedicarse a esta actividad, dio inicio con la pequeña moto y con ciertos ahorros logro obtener su propio medio de transporte siempre está ofreciendo el mejor servicio. El financiamiento es para la compra de repuesto para la moto.
texts.en: Luis Manuel is 45 years old, married, and has three minor children in his charge. He provides taxi services. He is a very responsible person and father to his family, and takes care of his family. He has been providing taxi service for 10 years, starting with a small bike and with savings he was able to obtain his own vehicle. He always offers the best service. The loan is to buy a part for the vehicle.

loans.use: Buy a part for his vehicle.

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en:
Mykola is married with grown up children. He owns a small business selling clothing, shoes, as well as seeds and fertilizers in seven small towns in Nova Kahovka area. 

Mykola started this business 5 years ago. Today he's got many repeat clients. Mykola goes to each place once a week to bring his inventories. He also takes individual orders from people and brings them what they ask for.

Mykola is requesting a loan of 16,000 Grivnas to increase his working capital. He is hoping to make additional profit and use it to improve his family living conditions.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Karachi

texts.en:
Karachi is a widowed woman with seven children, all of whom had graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity and clothing.  

She has been operating a food stall business for the past four years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In her business, Karachi faces a major challenge in competition from other food stall operators. She hopes to expand and establish a café business in the future.

With the loan for 15,000 Ksh, she wants to purchase bundles of cooking flour, baking flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase cooking flour, baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman who lives in Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living buying and selling fresh/dried fish. Her husband Julius, who is 33 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living. They have two children who are 8 and 9 years old. Rowena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rowena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 28,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to continue to save up for future expansion of her business and to send her children to school. Rowena is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, and school fees.

She has operated a cereals shop for the past six years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Jackline faces a major challenge regarding the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of groundnuts, beans, peas, and green grams for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of groundnuts, beans, peas and green grams for sale

loans.name: Chocolate Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento "CHOCOLATE" se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de la Institución, compuesto por 9 personas,  sus actividades están entre venta de comida, promotora de cosméticos, modistas y transporte urbano, la mayoría de los integrantes son del barrio 8 de Septiembre de la zona del Plan 3000. El grupo se fundo por la iniciativa de la Sra. América  que se dedica a la venta de comida en su mismo domicilio y que saca a vender todos los días por la noche y que vende  a sus vecinos y conocidos ya que ella tiene mucha clientela con el dinero del crédito la Sra. América comprara ingredientes y abarrotes para la elaboración de sus platillos ,  la Sra. Eliane se dedica vender productos cosméticos  y en las noches vende pizza, ella ofrece sus productos a las amigas que tiene y vecinas de su casa, ella no tiene hijos así que el dinero que junta es para ayudar a los gastos de sus padres y juntar para poder estudiar el año que viene alguna carrera técnica en un instituto, tiene su pareja que es taxista - chofer y que la motiva a estudiar aprovechando que ellos aun no tienen hijos con el dinero del crédito comprara cosméticos que se  encuentren en promoción. Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras, están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Banco de Eprendimineto “Chocolate” (“Chocolate” Communal Bank) is working its first cycle with our Institution. It is composed of 9 people, engaging in various activities such as: meals sale, cosmetics promoter, seamstress and city transportation. The majority of the members come from the 8 de Septiembre neighborhood, in the Plan 3000 area. The group was born out of the initiative of América, who engages in selling meals in her own house. She works every day in the evenings, selling her products to neighbors and acquaintances, and she has many customers. With the loan she is requesting América will buy ingredients and groceries to prepare her dishes.
Eliane engages in selling cosmetics, on top of selling pizza in the evenings. She offers her products to her female friends and neighbors. She has no children, so with the money she earns she helps her parents paying for their expenses; she will also use some next year to study for a technical career in a school. Her partner works as a cabby and as a driver, and he encourages her to study now that they have no children yet. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cosmetics on special offer. All the members are hard-working and responsible people, and they are thankful to the institution for the help provided.

loans.use: To buy ingredinets and grocery ant to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Alexi Maria

texts.es:
Alexi de 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora que inicio su actividad cuando ella estaba embarazada y su esposo le compro una carreta.

Ella trabaja sola de miércoles a domingo por la tarde hasta la noche vendiendo comidas rápidas. Una de sus dificultades en su negocio es la competencia ya que hay muchos puesto sobre lo mismo por el sector. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar más su mercadería para la carreta como ollas, baldes, aceite, carnes para así expandir su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Alexi is 34 years old, she is a hardworking woman that began working when she was pregnant and her husband bought her a cart.
She works alone Wednesday through Sunday from the afternoon until nightfall selling fast-food. One of the problems of her business is the competition since there are many other sellers in the same area. With the loan she wants to buy more merchandize for the cart and expand her business and increase her earnings to give her family the best.

loans.use: to purchase pans, buckets, oil, and meat

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe A. is from the town of Tinago, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 42 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a food stall selling food products like fried chicken in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for three years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP per month from these activities. 
In 2010, Fe joined PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase chicken meats for her fried chicken business. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

* Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase chicken meat for her fried chicken business in the local communtiy

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
For the past two years Ama Y. has been selling plastic bowls and saucepans as a peddler at Besease near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is single and has one child. The income she makes from her sales is used to take care of her child and other expenses. A loan from Kiva will enable her to buy plastic bowls in larger quantities for resale. Ama plans to save her new profits to build a shop.
In the photograph, Ama has on her lap some of the plastic bowls she sells.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls in larger quantities for resale.

loans.name: Nidia Andrea

texts.es:
Nidia madre soltera, su hija le ayudan económicamente. Mujer emprendedora trabaja por cuenta propia teniendo una librería y fotocopiadora desde hace un tiempo, su proyecto es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda para mayor seguridad para su negocio y familia. Inicio con fondos propios, tiene planes de agrandar el negocio ofreciendo otros servicios como fax, acolochado, levantado de texto, variedad de productos.
El préstamo que solicitad será invertido en la compra de laminas de zinc, golosas, reglas de maderas para cambiar el techo de la casa. Agradece a la institución por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Nidia is a single mother whose daughter helps her financially.  She is an entrepreneurial woman who is self employed.  She has owned a stationery store and photocopying business for some time.  Her project is to improve the infrastructure of her home to make her business and family safer.  She started out with her own money and has plans to expand her business, offering other services such as a fax service, a text preparation service and also a variety of products.

The loan that Nidia has requested will be invested in buying metal sheets, bolts and wooden beams to replace her roof.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have given her in developing her business.

loans.use: to replace her roof

loans.name: Santa Catarina Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Santa Catarina y esta conformado por 11 mujeres indígenas D. la población D. Santa Catarina Mechoacan. Denominada Santa Catarina por la Virgen Santa Catarina ya que es la patrona D. la población. Mechoacan: significa “Lugar D. Pescadores”. Este grupo esta conformado por mujeres D. raza indígena muy trabajadoras que se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas para el apoyo económico en su hogar.
Gudelia tiene 33 años D. edad, ella es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos que estudian la primaria.
Gudelia tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa donD. venD.  pollo destazado (cortados en pedazo) y mole. Ella solicito el préstamo para comprar mas pollo para que su negocio crezca un poco más, tiene 5 años con su  negocio inicio con el debido a la necesidad que tenia D. mantener a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante, al principio comenzó con pocos pollos D. 5 a 10 pollos al día y sus ventas los realizaba D. casa D. casa en casa y asi fue creciendo poco a poco actualmente venD. D. 30 a 50 pollos.
Para ella es muy importante este negocio ya que con el pueD. mantener a sus hijos y darles educación, ella se esfuerza día con día para que a sus hijos no les falte nada. Es una mujer que a pesar D. las adversidades D. la vida ah salido adelante. Ella esta contenta con su negocio ya que le deja buenas ganancias, actualmente tiene muchos clientes ya que da a buenos precios cada pedazo D. pollo y es el trato que le da sus clientes es bueno y es por ello que va a adquiriendo nuevos clientes.
Su más granD. meta es que sus hijos estudien una profesión y tener un local propio para su negocio.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Cecilia(Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
Leticia(Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
Cristina(Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
María(Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
Rosa(Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
Cirina (Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
Tomasa (Venta D. pollos),
Gudelia (Venta D. pollos), 
Raquel (Venta D. ropa), 
Zoila (Elaboración D. servilletas), 
Rogelia (Venta D. artículos D. papelería).
texts.en:
This group is called “Santa Catarina” and is composed of 11 indigenous women from the town of Santa Catarina Mechoacan.  It is called Santa Catarina after the Santa Catarina Virgin since she’s the village’s patron saint.  Mechoacan means “Place of the Fishermen.” This group is composed of indigenous, very hard working women who carry out various economic activities to support their homes economically.

Gudelia, 33, is a single mother of three children who are in elementary school.  She has a small, home-based business selling butchered chicken (cut into pieces) and mole (traditional chili sauce).  She asked for the loan to buy more chicken so that her business can grow a bit more.  She’s been in business for five years.  She started because of the need she had to support her children and move them ahead.  At the beginning, she started with just a few chickens, from 5-10 daily and her sales were door to door.  This is how the business gradually grew and now she sells from 30-50 chickens.

This business is very important to her because she’s able to support her children and proviD. them with an education.  She strives daily so that her children will lack nothing.  She is a woman who, despite life’s adversities, has gotten ahead.  She is happy with her business because it produces good profits.  She currently has many customers since she sells each piece of chicken for a good price and the treatment she gives her customers is good; because of this she continues to acquire new customers.

Her main goal is that her children study a profession and to have a locale of her own for the business.

The other group members are:

Cecilia(Sells regional fast food), 
Leticia(Sells regional fast food), 
Cristina(Sells regional fast food), 
María(Sells regional fast food), 
Rosa(Sells regional fast food), 
Cirina (Sells regional fast food), 
Tomasa (Chicken sales),
Gudelia (Chicken sales), 
Raquel (Clothing sales), 
Zoila (Napkin manufacturing), 
Rogelia (Sales of stationery supplies).

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Enriquita has a shop that sells a variety of products like bananas and firewood and serves different varieties of meals. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy yellow and green bananas, raw ingredients for cooking viands (tasty dishes) and firewood.

Enriquita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Enriquita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy yellow and green bananas, raw ingredients for cooking viands and firewood

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 52 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Inés de 46 años y sus 3 queridos hijos menores, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Para Francisco la crianza de animal vacuno,  es una actividad que le viene de familia, desde muy pequeño aprendió a realizar esta actividad, actualmente él realiza este trabajo y es muy bueno haciéndolo, ya que su reses son muy solicitados en las ferias de Pucallpa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pastear a sus animales y poder permanecer al aire libre. Lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para él es llevar su ganado degollado hasta el camal de Pucallpa. En adelante espera incrementar el número de animales que tiene para así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP y por tal espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Asimismo se compromete en ser puntual en sus pagos. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más forraje para engordar mejor a su ganado.
texts.en:
52 year-old Francisco is a very unassuming and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 46 year-old Inés, and his three beloved children, who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.

For Francisco, raising cattle is an activity that comes from his family.  He learned the business when he was very young.  He currently carries out this business and is very good at it.  His cattle are very much in demand in the markets in Pucallpa.

What Francisco most enjoys about his work is pasturing his animals and being able to spend time out in the open air.  He has been in this business for 13 years and the most difficult part of his work is taking his herd to the slaughterhouse in Pucallpa.  In the future, he hopes to increase the number of animals that he owns so that he can improve his income.

This will be Francisco's second loan from MFP and he hopes to receive the support of each one of you.  For his part, he pledges to be punctual in making his repayments.  Francisco will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy more fodder so that he can better fatten his herd.

loans.use: to buy more fodder with which to feed his animals

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, David has operated a shop, selling to his neighbors and passersby. In addition, he also sells water, which contributes additional income. David faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in his business.

David decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With a 20,000 KES loan he wants to purchase water pipes for a water distribution business. His dream is to purchase a water tank in the future.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes for a water distribution business.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a 45-year-old woman who is married and has three sons and two daughters. Majeda's husband Abdul Salam is a taxi driver who drives passengers inside and outside the city. His income is not enough to cover licensing and insurance fees, therefore Majeda took out a loan from FATEN to pay for them. 

Majeda is a conservative woman, therefore her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To pay for car licencing and insurance

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: Carmen de 34 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena  con su esposo y sus hijos en las edades de 1  a 12 años. Allí tiene un negocio en un punto  muy comercial  donde vende de variedades de productos, mediante crédito y de contado; Igualmente para generar otros ingresos los fines de semana tiene otro negocio en el que le va muy bien,  de venta de comidas  rápidas cuya infraestructura física ubica en la puerta de su miscelánea. Como en su negocio hay productos que rotan muy rápidamente, ella para comprar debe esperar reunir un dinero, para responder a su clientela cuando la mercancía se termina, pues su capital de trabajo no es suficiente y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa para niñas, chancletas, accesorios para damas y para el hogar, y también útiles escolares y papelería en general. Con su inyección de este nuevo capital de trabajo financiará su cartera, y surtirá su negocio para que su clientela aumente, así como también sus ingresos que es su gran meta.
texts.en:
Carmen, 34, lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and two children who are 1 and 12 years old.  She has a business there at a commercial spot where she sells a large variety of products both for cash and on credit.  In order to generate extra income she has a weekend job that she does very well in: fast food sales.  This job’s infrastructure is a table she sets up at the entrance to her variety shop.

Her business has items that sell out quickly but she often has to wait until she’s amassed enough money to respond to customer demand when her merchandise runs out because her working capital is small.  This is why she’s calling on her Kiva loan to buy clothes for girls, sandals, accessories for women and for the home and also school supplies and general stationery supplies.  With the injection of this new working capital she will finance her portfolio and stock her business so that her clientele will increase as well as her income which is her main goal.

loans.use: to buy girls' clothes, sandals, women's and home accessories, school supplies and general stationery supplies.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has two children.

Ammar has been the owner of a barber shop since 2004. He has a good experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floor and walls. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floor and walls.

loans.name: Khader
