texts.en:
Khader is a Palestinian man. He is married and has eight sons and two daughters. He has got a license for distributing gas canisters in a vehicle he owns, and he wants to purchase more gas canisters to distribute, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for them, so he needs to take out a loan in the amount of $3,000 from FATEN. 

When Khader takes the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will have more gas canisters to distribute and that will improve his income positively and he can provide his family with better living conditions. Khader is photographed next to the gas canister distribution vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase more gas canisters to distribute.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 33 years old, married and has five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 
Sandra has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.
Sandra has been in this business for a year. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia tiene ya más nueve años con su negocio de venta de ropa usada.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar variedad de mercancía que es (Ropa para mujer, hombres, calzado, juguetes y aparatos eléctricos) por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que desea invertir en su negocio. 
Doña Silvia planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, ya que si esposo el señor Cesar se encargara de los familiares y escolares de sus dos hijos con el sueldo que recibe como músico.
texts.en:
Silvia has owned her business selling used clothing for more than nine years.  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying a range of merchandise (women's and men's clothes, footwear, toys and electrical appliances).  Right now, she doesn't have the money she needs to make this investment in her business.

Silvia plans to repay her loan with the profits that she makes from her business as her husband, Cesar, will take charge of the family and the school expenses of their two children with the salary he earns as a musician.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Lota

texts.en:
Lota is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Lota has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Lota has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lota hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 32 years old. He is married.

Nelson is engaged in raising hogs, which he sells. He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy additional feed for his hogs, which he intends to sell.

Nelson has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nelson hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for the hogs

loans.name: Ruth Elena

texts.es:
A sus 39 años de edad Ruth es una mujer emprendedora que ha luchado con gran esmero para sacar adelante a sus 7 hijos, actualmente tiene su propio negocio, una tienda en la que trabaja día a día con la ilusión de tener un progreso notable.

Ruth sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y es conciente que para ello debe seguir trabajando con la misma tenacidad que hasta ahora para que su negocio crezca, por esto hoy tiene la motivación de solicitar un crédito, el cual invertirá en surtido para la tienda, pues tener variedad, calidad y cantidad es clave para la mejoría de las ventas, y en este momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para la compra de Gaseosas, legumbres y snaks.
texts.en:
At the age of 39, Ruth Elena is an enterprising woman who has worked with much dedication to raise her seven children.  She currently has a business of her own: a grocery store that she works in day to day hoping to make notable progress.

Ruth dreams with her children becoming professionals and she’s aware that to do so she must continue working with the same tenacity she’s had to date so that the business will grow.  Because of this, today she’s motivated to request a loan that she’ll use to buy stock merchandise for the store because having variety, quality and quantity is the key for improving sales and she currently lacks the necessary capital to buy soft-drinks, vegetables and snacks.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and general merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Myrna has a pigpen and sells matured and grown pigs. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Wekhoyela Group

texts.en:
David is the facilitator of the Wekhoyela group. David and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

David takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, David had an excellent maize yield harvesting nine bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, David was only able to harvest 3 ½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to David and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, David will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wekhoyela group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

David and the group members appear in the photograph as shown.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rino

texts.en:
Rino is 29 years old and lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He runs a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business. He has had this business for 5 months. Rino earns about 10,000 PHP from this business.

Rino requested this loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts. Rino hopes to have a stable business. He also hopes to continue supporting his family financially.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.

Maricar has a vegetable garden and she sells vegetables such as patola, ampalaya, and string-beans every harvest time. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 13,200 to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden. 

Maricar has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maricar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.
